Summary: If you are looking for a quick walk to Disneyland this is your best option! Literally across the street from the park entrance and you don’t have to pay Disney prices! The front desk staff was fabulous. Only complaint was the noise of the air conditioning unit.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times and the rooms have seriously deteriorated. The rooms were filthy.  Faucets leaking, black mold, smelled, ac unit struggling to work, ants, dirty walls, dirty floors etc my family and I will not be staying here again. The staff wasn’t thrilled about having to move my family to another room after discovering we were exposed to black mold from a massive leak in one of their rooms. Was offered a very small discount. We will be looking for other hotels in the area next time

Summary Heading: Excellent location, hearty breakfast, very clean.
Summary: We love staying at this property mainly because it’s right across the street from the main entrance. But the rooms are nice, the staff is very helpful, and they serve a free hearty breakfast with eggs, sausage/ham, croissants etc.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay when going to DLR
Summary: This is my go-to place to stay when visiting Disney. The internet works, the pool area is nice, breakfast is good and the rooms are clean. The proximity to the park is the best, can't get any closer to the park! Highly recommend this Best Western.

Summary: BED BUGS found in 5 different rooms here. That’s right- they offered us 5 different rooms because each room, bed bugs were found! We fortunately turned down each room and after the 5th room inspection, we requested a full refund & stayed at Disneyland hotel instead. Health department went onsite to 2 of the 5 rooms (because we could not remember the room numbers to the other rooms they walked my sister into, to inspect) and confirmed bed bugs as well. We lost an entire day at Disneyland dealing with them and these rooms, doing laundry since their rooms were disgusting, and properly checking into a different hotel. The General manager Lara Watkins, numerous managers in “customer care” and the CEO’s assistant Elizabeth all were of no help. Each pointed fingers at each other and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here at least three times to go to Disneyland and we love the location, you just can't beat it! It's close enough to the park to be able to come back and rest and refresh before dinner, making our park days more enjoyable.  Also, it accommodates our family size of 5, 6 and 7 depending on the trip. It's more affordable than the park hotels.  The breakfast and amenities are great. Nice pool.  Comfortable beds.

Summary: I usually don’t write reviews but as someone who depends on them I figured I would. For starters, this is a Disney good neighbor motel so you’re not paying for a resort type room. This motel is right across the main entrance so that’s the big draw there. The room was clean and had everything you will need for a Disney trip. (Comfortable bed, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, and a decent amount of space)   The issues we had were customer service. We were told we could park in the lot (subject to availability) early before check in because we were driving over from AZ and going straight into the park and checking into the room later. We called a few weeks before to make sure and then we were told to call when we’re close to check on availability. My wife called and someone told

Summary Heading: Great for a place to lay your head after Disneyland.
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights with 6 of us in a mini suite.  Beds were very comfortable.  Room needs some updates though.  Ceiling drywall cracking, bathroom vent old and makes a horrible noise.  Something outside the room makes an annoying noise as well.  Really liked the beds....

Summary: I was extremely disappointed in this past weekend's stay at this location. We had two rooms with our reservation and the staff failed to inform us ahead of time that room services was not being done. As having a child with special needs and a parent with asthma, this was extremely difficult. We stayed at the location for 3 nights and the trash was not emptied, the beds were not made - the carpets had an awful smell to them as well. The rooms were very dusty when we arrived as well. We spent a lot of money on this stay and felt neglected by the staff and Best Western overall. It's such a shame that this location as has gone downhill. There was no mention of the breakfast area being renovated either. I just called the front desk to speak with Lara as well but she is not in the
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us, and while COVID-19 has caused us to make temporary amendments to our hotel’s services and offerings, our hotel continues to look for ways to improve our guests’ stay. I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Place to stay for access to the parks
Summary: perfect location, decent amenities! Would recommend staying here but would also recommend bringing ear plugs because walls are paper thin.  Through security this location is less than a five minute walk to the front gates of both parks, we did not use our car once while we were here!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're glad our proximity to the park was convenient for you. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay if visiting Disneyland
Summary: Thanks to Tom Bricker from Mickey Blog, I was fortunate enough to know to stay at Best Western Plus Park Place.  Best place to stay if visiting Disneyland.  The hotel is clean and couldn't be more convenient.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We work hard to ensure all of our guests have a safe and comfortable stay, and we're glad to hear we were able to do that for you. See you next time!

Summary: If you are going to Disneyland this is the best place to stay.  Rooms are small and not much to write home about but being so close to Disneyland was the absolute best.  I don't think I can Disney any other way now that I have experienced staying so close and not having to use the buses.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're happy to hear that you found our location convenient. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary: Such and easy way to access Disney and save money on parking and breakfast. Have been to this hotel several times and they do not disappoint. Park at one in hotel lot, eat lunch at Downtown Disney and go into the either Park. This is GREAT!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! Your continued loyalty is very much appreciated. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: We’re members of best western rewards. We stayed 6 nights at park place mini suites across from Disneyland 9/5 to 9/11. We didn’t get there until 9:00 on Sunday. We have a lot of choices for hotels near there, we usually stay at the grand legacy, but decided to spend $50 more to be closer to the gate and get a mini suite, and rent the scooter right in the lobby.  Got charged the mini suite rate even though it wasn’t. Stayed 6 nights and paid for 6 nights parking. On Friday we were able to reserve another day at Disneyland, so we attempted by phone to extend our stay another night for Saturday, and were first told that it would be ok, but after I expressed the preference of staying in the same room then you said “wait a minute, we’re completely full” even though Booking.com said
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future. I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.

Summary Heading: So close you can smell the Churros
Summary: My family and I stay here each year. The hotel is right across from the park. Clean rooms, free breakfast and outstanding staff!! We have stayed at other hotels and this one keeps us coming back!! Highly recommend!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! Your continued loyalty is very much appreciated. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary: Room was fine, housekeeping was very good but the front desk ruined this stay for us as far as recommending this hotel. Not one single "thank you" checking in or checking out. Breakfast is in a room that required two flights of stairs.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. Please accept our sincere apologies for the service you received upon check-in. We pride ourselves on upholding high standards of service in all circumstances, so we're sorry that was not your experience with us. As far as breakfast goes; while we do not have an elevator to the breakfast room on the second floor, our staff is happy to assist guests that are unable to use the stairs. We are always looking for ways we can improve, and your feedback will help us to better future guest experiences. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again and make it up to you.

Summary: I was talked down to by staff when I asked for our room at 3pm. When told our room was guaranteed at 3pm. Manager actually talked down to me. My friends sitting on couch heard the whole thing and couldn’t believe how she talked to me. Only giving the location a 5 because of it being close to Disneyland. There was hair in the shower and AC was noisy.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. We apologize for the service you received upon check-in. We pride ourselves on upholding high standards of service in any circumstance, so we're sorry that was not your experience with us. We are always looking for ways we can improve, and your feedback will help us to better future guest experiences. We hop to have the opportunity to host you again and make it up to you.

Summary: This hotel was perfect for our family's visit to Disneyland.  It's right across the street, probably a shorter walk that to the Disney parking lots.  The breakfast gave us each a great start to our day.  We rented a suite and were very comfortable.  It is clean.  The staff is friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're so happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your time here. Our staff works very hard to make sure that all of our guests have a fun and safe trip, and we're glad we were able to accomplish that for you. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: Positives- Location right across from Disneyland entrance. Definitely the closest hotel to the park. Staff were pleasant and we had no problem getting an immediate response when we had a problem or needed additional items. Enjoyed the fireworks from Disneyland. Parking was tight but convenient.  It is not an exciting room. We had a mini suite with two queens and a sofa bed. Frankly for the time we spent in the room it was fine. We had no view other than a wall. Beds were comfortable. Shower was ok.  Negatives- The room is not quiet. The air conditioning runs all night. I am a white noise person so it actually worked for me. When people try to get in the room next door to you it feels like they are coming into your room. Carts do roll. However it was the morning scream of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. We value your feedback and we aim to provide all of our guests with a safe and comfortable stay. While COVID-19 has caused us to make temporary changes to our services and offerings, we are always looking for ways we can improve. Please know, for future stays, the Front Desk is open 24 hours a day to assist you with anything you might need. we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Mostly friendly staff (just one member of front desk staff is a little grumpy...everyone else exceeded exlectations). Had an issue with shower which was handled promptly & staff member was great. Rooms are nice, clean & feel newer compared to most hotels in this area we have stayed at.  Breakfast was sufficient & offered in new, clean & well laid out dining area. Everything you need & the walking distance can't be beat unless you stay at Grand Californian ;)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to tell us about your stay! We're glad to hear it was a pleasant one. All of our staff, front to back, work very hard to ensure our guests have a safe and comfortable stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary: The reason you pay so much for this hotel is because of the location. For the money they charge the amenities and rooms should be much nicer. The toilet seat was child size, the carpet felt a bit grungy and the beds were very lumpy. However, pillows were great! There was some drilling & hammering  going on that sounded like they were coming through our wall so taking a mid afternoon nap on a very hot day wasn't easy. Staff was friendly. Didn’t have breakfast so can’t comment on that.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We're sorry to hear that your time with us did not exceed your expectations. We also apologize that the construction on the restaurant next door disturbed you. We are constantly looking for ways we can be better, and your feedback will help us improve future guest experiences. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again and make it right.

Summary Heading: Right Across the Street from Disneyland
Summary: You can't get a better hotel room than one that offers a free hot breakfast and is literally a 5 minute walk from the gates of Disneyland. It was nice not to have to park in a distant parking lot and then take a bus to the park.  Easy Peasy
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're glad our location worked well for you. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I wanted to acknowledge the outstanding young woman at the front desk on Sept 6th around 4pm, I forgot her name. She was being unnecessarily berated by an older couple. She remained calm and redirected appropriately, offering solutions. The couple was unreasonable. The staff at this location impressed me for their ability to handle difficult situations professionally and calmly.  And the location is perfect and the place clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to say such kind words about our staff. I will be sure to pass on your praises to her. We all work very hard to ensure all of our guests experience the high-standards of service we are known for, and we appreciate that it has not gone unnoticed. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Perfect for our family Disney trip!!! It was right across the street from the Disneyland entrance. Typical hotel amenities, very friendly staff, clean, good breakfast choices that are easy to take on the go, great price overall and within walking distance to diners and small shops too. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're so happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your time here. We hope to see you all again soon!

Summary Heading: Didn’t end up a happy birthday…
Summary: The rooms have been partially upgraded recently and are nicer looking - bathrooms and air conditioners appear the same.    We decided we did not need four nights and called the day before to confirm the process. I was told I did not need to release the room because if I changed my mind, I risked the room being sold. I repeated back to the woman on the phone that I could let them know by 11:00 next day and be refunded. I did call the next morning , before 11:00 , that we would be checking out. I went down to front desk to tell them I was checking out/ settle bill and was told, “ you already called to tell us, you do not need to also come to the front desk, it’s all handled “.   We left the car parked for a few hours ,as they allow this and we pay for the parking.  I realized I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. We're sorry that you did not have a satisfactory experience with us. We will be looking into the situation with the staff. We are consistently looking for ways to better ourselves, and your feedback will help us improve future guest experiences. Thank you.

Summary: Absolutely wonderful visit. Staff very nice and helpful. Cleanliness, availability to amenities and pool all great. Room had great AC that worked great, tv fridge microwave all nice. Would highly recommend this place!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! Our entire staff works very hard to ensure all of our guests have a safe and comfortable stay with us, and we're glad we were able to accomplish that for you. See you soon!

Summary: Love this hotel and it’s proximity to the parks. Our room (king bed) room 105 was super clean. AC worked great. Parking can be tight for larger vehicles FYI! Does have scooters that can be rented on site (or at least I believe so). Pool is basic. Breakfast during covid is simple - powdered eggs or hard boiled (pre packaged) sausage patties and salted/peppered potatoes (seasoning is strong) does have other quick items like granola bars, Cheerios / fruit loops, cartons of milk and Orange juice as well as muffins and pantries. Breakfast at the moment does require stairs however they have complied with ada regulations with persons who cannot do stairs order via a form.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We all work very hard to ensure all of our guests enjoy their time with us, and we're glad we were able to show that to you during your stay. Can't wait to see you next time!

Summary: The distance from Disneylands front gate is closer than if you stay at the Disneyland Hotel. The pool is a great distraction for an afternoon break from the parks. Plus it's a Best Western property so you know you're getting a clean room in good repair.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're so glad you were able to enjoy the convenience of our location and that our pool provided a respite from the hustle and bustle of Disney. We look forward to seeing you again next time!

Summary: This is a nice hotel across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland. The rooms were nice and clean our particular room Could accommodate six adults. The breakfast could’ve been better it was basically a continental breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're glad you found your room comfortable. Please accept our apologies regarding breakfast. While COVID-19 has forced us to make temporary adjustments to our services and amenities, we are working on getting our full buffet back up and running as soon as it is safe to do so. We hope to have you back then!

Summary: We were very happy with the location and the staff. It’s a Best Western, not a luxury hotel, the room was exactly as expected. I do think it’s important to note however that due to a major housekeeping shortage (as we were told) we had to wait almost 90 minutes pst check in for our room to be ready. In sitting in the lobby and observing check in, at least 50% of people were told their room wasn’t ready. Traveling with children, having gotten up very early and flying all day, this was a crummy way to start vacation!  While we definitely understand that Covid has impacted nearly all businesses in terms of staffing, no attempt was made to rectify the situation. This was not the fault of the front desk staff, they were all polite and very overworked! However management should have a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. On behalf of our entire team, I want to apologize for not exceeding your expectations regarding check-in. While COVID-19 has certainly had an impact on our staffing, we still try our hardest to provide all of our guests with exceptional service and we're sorry we fell short. We value your feedback and will use it the better future guest experiences. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Staying as close as you can to the park without the cost of a Disney property. Its a Little less magic, but nothing beats a short walk to the hotel after a long day at the parks for a third of the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us! We're glad you were able to enjoy a short walk to and from the parks from our location. Can't wait to see you again next time!

Summary: this is the second time we have stayed here and love it.  Just walk outside and you are across the street from Downtown Disney.  Places to eat close by if you don't want to eat at Downtown Disney.   Room was clean and staff friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for coming back to visit us! We're happy to have you as a returning guest with us. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary Heading: Not the best stay at a best western this time
Summary: Offered grab and go breakfast with limited items unless you got there first. One day milk was sour another day no milk. They did have lots of bananas. Asked to have extra towels and garbage cans done daily since I paid more for this room than any others on the strip, I was told nobody else makes your bed, so they were not going to either. COVID seems to be the blame, but they can change beds when you leave after a guy goes in and sprays entire room in 20 seconds (that sprayer must be supercharged, wish I had it for my garden). I could go on but why? At this time I would not stay there again, this is at least our 15 TH stay with is property,  the location is perfect right across from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not meeting your expectations. Our property values your insight and we aim to provide our guests with a comfortable and enjoyable stay. While COVID-19 has forced us to make temporary changes  to our amenities and services for our guests' safety and wellbeing, we continually look for ways we can improve the experiences for our guests. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again and make it right.

Summary: Location, location, location.  This was a clean and comfortable place to stay very close to the parks.  We had a mini suite for our family of 5 and had everything we needed.  The room was a good size and the refrigerator was larger than we anticipated so we had room for a few groceries, water and pop.  The grab and go breakfast had a lot of handy options and was very convenient to just grab before we headed to the parks.  The pool was nothing special but great for a dip to cool off in the afternoon.  Staff were very attentive and came promptly when we requested extra towels, etc...  Across the driveway there is a little convenience store which was handy as the hotel gift shop is not open at present.  We usually stay at Paradise Pier as we enjoy staying on Disney property but
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're so glad you found the room to your liking and you and your family had a good start to your day with the breakfast. We look forward to seeing you all next time!

Summary: After 2020 the family had low expectations for this trip. Everything was exceeded by 100%. The hotel was excellent in all ways. Location is fantastic after a long day at Disney. If we can’t save enough to stay at the Grand Californian Hotel, on the bucket list, we will definitely stay hear again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our property! We're so glad to hear your stay was too your liking. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: We always stay here when we visit the parks, just outside the gates, next to ihop, and a small store, need I say more? The staff is super friendly and helpful. All of our needs were met. The room is nice, comfortable bed and pillows, plenty of room to get ready in the morning with nice mirrors and a fridge and microwave. Just perfect!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure all of our guests have a safe and comfortable stay, and we're glad to hear we were able to do that for you. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: We found underwear from the previous guest on the floor in our room GROSS, the room clearly had a mold and mildew problem we could smell it and the room and mold flies it was bad. Yes they offered to move us but to a totally different building and a totally different type of room and we were traveling with teenagers who were 3 doors down and we want to be close to we stayed and felt with the problems, air conditioning didn’t work well it didn’t get cold! Overall we stay her almost every time we go to Disneyland but will not be staying there again which is a bummer because it’s a perfect location!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. We pride ourselves on upholding high standards of service in all circumstances, so please accept our sincere apologies for falling short of that during your stay. We are always looking for ways we can improve and your feedback will help us do that in the future. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again soon and make it right.

Summary: This hotel is located in the most convenient spot ever to get to Disneyland and California Adventure! The hotel staff is very service-oriented, friendly and kind. They even figured out a way to offer a great solution for breakfast during covid.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay! We work hard to make sure all of our guests have a safe and comfortable stay, and we're so happy we were able to do that for you. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Due to health issues with one of our teens, this trip to Disneyland needed to be a trip of convenience. BW Park Place fit the bill PERFECTLY!  We usually stay at a Marriott down the street & have about a 30-40 minute walk to the park, but this time, we were steps away from the crosswalk & just a few minutes from DL security.  While this may not seem like a big deal upon park opening--it's a LIFESAVER at the end of the day when everyone is exhausted! Also close enough that you can leave the park at anytime to rest or eat and head back later without feeling like you're wasting time.  We had 2 Queen beds and sofa sleeper in each room.  Rooms were spacious and beds were comfortable. Internet was spotty at times--but didn't keep us from getting highly coveted boarding passes for Rise
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words about our property and staff! We're so happy to hear you and your family had a comfortable and enjoyable stay. We work hard to ensure all of our guests enjoy their time with us and we're glad to hear we were able to provide that for you. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great location, mediocre hotel at best.
Summary: Aside from the location of this hotel, there is nothing about it that makes it worth the money. The bed was uncomfortable, the fridge didn’t work properly, the pool was less than inviting even in the immense heat. I won’t stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. While we're glad to hear that our location was convenient for you, please accept our sincere apologies for the other aspects of your stay that did not live up to the high standards we are known for. We value your insight and will use it to improve future guest experiences. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again and make it right.

Summary: My favorite place to stay when visiting, always great service, clean, comfortable, good breakfast set up, even during Covid-19.  A little expensive, but worth it. You are as close as it gets to the main entrance to the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to stay with us! We're glad you have found a home away from home with us. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary: The hotel is across the street from Disneyland main entrance.  When it was too hot in the afternoon, we came back for a nap.  Due to COVID-19, hotel doesn’t offer housekeeping during your stay.  There is free breakfast every morning, and you may bring breakfast back to your room.   Hotel has limited parking, so make sure you reserve a parking spot once you make reservation.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're glad you enjoyed your time with us. We look forward to hosting you again soon!

Summary: We loved this hotel: 5 minutes walk from Disneyland, various food options immediately nearby (like IHOP), a clean and modernized pool and hot tub area, spacious rooms, and reasonable parking fees. They served a "grab n' go" breakfast when we visited (July 2021), but it was the most substantial grab n' go breakfast I've experienced. If we return to Disneyland again, we will stay here again without question.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! We look forward to seeing you again next time you visit the parks.

Summary Heading: BEWARE as of July 10th 2021 NO CLEANING OF ROOM
Summary: Hello, our family just stayed here and I am warning you all that there is NO cleaning of the rooms due to covid, as they stated. You can call ask for clean towels when needed and they will bring to room. However, No ones actually comes in to clean sinks, toilets'  and take trash! Also their "Breakfast" is laid out on long tables near pool area for you to pick up items you like and I guess go back to your room, as NO seating is provided. This was NOT convenient as we were on 3rd floor and out the door to go to Disneyland. I stood in the laundry room so I had a table for coffee, as I ate a yogurt. So I do feel the room price was rather expensive for NO cleaning and NO Seating area ....Just an FYI for those planning a visit.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere apologies for not exceeding your expectations. We value your feedback very much and we aim to provide our guests with a safe and comfortable stay. While COVID-19 has caused us to make temporary amendments to our hotel's services and offerings for your safety and wellbeing, our hotel continues to look for ways to improve our guests' stay. We hope to have toe opportunity to host you again soon.

Summary: Rude front office staff!! Room not ready well after my reservation time.  Upon check in the front office staff did not acknowledge or help me, despite multiple staff standing around and socializing. Employee hung up on me during the express check out.  I had to call the hotel to request days after my stay, to receive my receipt.  Housekeeping staff attempted to go in my room a total of three times during my one night stay.  I felt rushed to check out, since they kept trying to clean my room.  Breakfast was mediocre.  No variety and options available for guests with dietary needs.  Very cheap and low quality food.  Upon arrival, the room was hot.  Both the AC unit and the refrigerator were turned off.  The AC unit was very loud and outdated!  Couldn’t sleep due to the AC unit
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us about your stay. We pride ourselves on upholding high standards of service in any and all circumstances, so please accept our sincere apologies for falling short of those standards during your stay. We are consistently looking for ways we can improve, and your feedback will help us improve guest experiences in the future. We hope to have the opportunity to make this right and welcome you back soon.

Summary: They don’t tell you when you book that there is no housekeeping . However, they claim they tell you when you check in there’s no housekeeping . Go to marriott hotel . They still do house keeping . 3 nights and nobody came in and replaced towels or sheets . I was told I had to leave the dirty towels outside the door and bring new ones but they wouldn’t enter the room until we checked out due to covid protocols.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Our hotel values your feedback and aims to provide our guests with a safe and comfortable stay. While COVID-19 has caused us to make amendments to our hotel's services and offerings for your safety and wellbeing, our hotel continues to look for ways to improve our guests' stay. Thank you for your time, and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again and make it right.

Summary: Very spacious with a modern look. My family of 5 (3 were kids under 10 yrs old) was very comfortable and appreciated the 3 Queen beds (one was a sofa bed).  Refrigerator was a good size (not a mini); no freezer. Free breakfast was perfect to take Disneyland; not high end but a decent snack (yogurt, muffins, apple sauce, coffee). Hotel is right across the street; cannot get any closer even compared to the Disneyland hotel. We will be staying here again. Only downside is that your car must be out by 3pm so you have to move and pay for parking if checking out and planning to spend the day at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're so glad you and your family hand a comfortable and enjoyable stay. We look forward to having you back soon!

Summary: Literally across the cross walk from Disneyland. Clean, safe with security. Pool, spa, grab and go breakfast. The regular breakfast was not available because of Covid. Parking is so limited that they email you to ask if you need parking when you come. Beware of that, and they charge for parking. My preferred hotel down the street doesn't charge for parking, so this was not something I was used to.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We appreciate your feedback very much and hope to see you back again soon.

Summary: This is now my top 2 hotels to stay at across from Disneyland. The quality, comfort, & convenience all exceeded my expectations. We had a family of 6 (4 adults & 2 kids). There was plenty of space and beds were comfortable. Would recommend!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're so happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your time with us. We look forward to seeing you all next time you visit the Resort!

Summary Heading: You can't get any closer to Disneyland entrance
Summary: This is the closest motel to Disneyland entrance just go across the crosswalk and your in.. parking is very tight here and warning only one car per room you will need your parking pass to get in or out the gates.. the room was very clean we had 2 queens beds and a sofa couch. All very comfortable ..TV was nice size with HBO CNN fox news Disney Channel's and some On Demand stations. Including Disney & HBO.. nice size mini frigerator and small microwave. The free breakfast was a little bit of a letdown the only thing I could really complain about. Some small juice some muffins and 2 hard broiled eggs in a bag.. some granola bars small water and coffee.. if you ask the lady pouring the coffee there's a little frigerator that they keep some breakfast sandwiches in.. Jimmy Dean's
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about your stay with us! We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your time here. Unfortunately, COVID-19 has forced us to make amendments to some of our offerings and amenities. But we are consistently looking for ways to improve our guest's stays and will use your feedback to elevate  future experiences for our guests. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great location, nice pool, loud AC
Summary: This place is across the street from Disneyland, making it very easy to take a break in the middle of the day. The kids enjoyed using the pool. Bathroom needs updating. AC was loud, making it hard to sleep. Due to COVID, grab and go breakfast was offered. Overall, we had a good experience and would stay there again next time we go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're happy to hear your experience with us us a good one. Please accept our apologies for the difficulty sleeping. In the future, please don't hesitate to let us know about any issues you may be having. We have maintenance on-site 24 hours a day who would be happy to assist you. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again soon!

Summary: It is very near to Disneyland that you can walk back to hotel for lunch and nap during the hottest time of the day and come back for more at around 5 pm to closing. Pedestrian crossing to park is just in front of the hotel.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear our location made your trip easy. Hopefully we can see you again soon!

Summary: This hotel was the perfect location for our trip to Disneyland. We woke up, had free breakfast, then walked across the street to Disneyland. The woke home was short too! The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. We’ll definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us! We're so happy to hear your stay was an enjoyable one. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again soon!

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet, Friendly, & The Closest You Can Get To Disneyland!!
Summary: This was the perfect spot to stay for enjoying a few days in Disneyland.  Very friendly staff, and very clean.  Also, surprisingly quite considering all the families coming and going to the Park.  Comfortable beds, and pleasant pool/hot tub.  The also provide a worthy "grab & go" breakfast buffet which you can take back to your room, or pack into the Park.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're so happy to hear your stay was comfortable and enjoyable. We hope to see you next time your vacation plans take you to the Resort area!

Summary: I loved how conveniently close this hotel was to Disneyland ! The staff is friendly it was quiet and the check-in and check- out process was smooth and there were no issues. I will definitely come back
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our staff! We're glad to hear your stay was enjoyable and our location worked well for your family. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: While it's an older building, the room was clean with nice bedding and bed.  We enjoyed the pool and hot tub and were lucky to have a room with a big window facing the Disneyland entrance.  The grab and go breakfast setup was nice to take to the park entrance line and snack on during the day - yogurt, cereal, coffee, pastries, orange juice, bottled water, oat bars, etc.  Parking is only $15 if you don't mind leaving by 3 pm.  And walking right across the street to the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure is amazing - shortest walk to the park, especially while the Disney trams are down.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us! We're so glad our location was convenient for you and that our breakfast fueled you for your Disney day. We hope to see you again next time you visit the Anaheim area.

Summary: This is our go to hotel for our family vacation. We love the location and the continental breakfast they serve every morning of our stay. It makes it easy with 3 kids. They charge 15 per day to park your car. If you have more than 1 car you have to park off site because of the limited parking at this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us! We work hard to ensure all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again soon!

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay but WARNING about parking charges and policies
Summary: Our usual place to stay near DL was not yet back in business (due to COVID and a refurb), so we decided to try a spot across the street from the DL entrance. This place had decent reviews and the price was acceptable (but felt high, based on our other experiences in the past few years). The destination/location is great. Can't get any closer to the entrance, so that was awesome. The room itself was fine; nothing too special. Everything worked, it was clean, beds were decent, room staff good, etc. The breakfast was outside and had a number of choices. It was probably better pre-COVID but this was okay.  My main complaint is against their HORRIBLE parking policies and charges. I did read that they charged for parking, but it's worse than that. So if you are considering this place,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you gave us to implement improvements to ensure we offer a better experience for guests in the future. I hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.

Summary: Literally across the street and closest off-site hotel, getting to Disney was a breeze. We walked to Downtown Disney the night we arrive and just walked across the street in the morning for rope drop.  As another review mentioned, you can only leave your car parked in the lot until 3 pm day of checkout. I liked not having to worry with getting into parking garage first thing in the morning. We walked across in the morning and then when it was time to change parks, we went and moved the car. Breezed right in for parking.  Hotel itself was ok. Price seemed a bit high to me, but I’m sure the location and convenience to Disney is a large portion of the rate. Room was spacious and clean. Breakfast is provided, but still grab and go. Only downside, I request to be away from the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're glad that our proximity to the parks worked out well for you. Our apologies that we were not able to honor your request for your room location. We hope to have another chance to serve you next time you visit the Resort area!

Summary Heading: BEWARE if you’re driving home after Disneyland!
Summary: Only get to park until 3- DON’T stay here if you’re driving home after visiting Disneyland! We booked this hotel to try to make our Disney stay more convenient. Well, that didn’t work out. We arrived the evening before our stay thinking we could walk over to the park in the morning and drive home after. Unfortunately, they won’t allow us to keep our car in the lot while we’re at the park. We have to move it by 3:00. So I guess tomorrow we have to take a break in the middle of our Disney day to move our car. So sad and disappointed. If I had known that we would have just woken up early and parked in the parking structure. Hotel is fine- nothing great but seems clean and is very close to the park entrance. Front desk said pool is open but we haven’t used it.  Would be fine if you
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are sorry to hear about your concerns regarding our parking. We are constantly striving to improve our guest experience and will utilize your feedback to better serve our guests in the future. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back next time you visit the Resort area.

Summary: We stayed here for three nights during our visits to Disneyland.  Comfortable bed. Good WiFi connection.  The shower and toilet were old but worked fine.  Due to COVID-19 there was no regular housekeeping service but whenever we needed new towels  or toiletries they were promptly delivered.  The breakfast served by the pool which included packaged sandwiches, cereal, pastries, yogurt, milk, fruit, coffee, etc.  Overall, it was a good place for us to stay. We will come back again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location for a Disneyland Trip!
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel is conveniently located right across from the Disneyland entrance making getting to/from the park a breeze. Staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and fairly spacious. It can be a little noisy in the morning since you are by Harbor Blvd but if your main focus is going to the parks, you can’t beat the convenience of this location! I would stay here again for that reason alone!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Literally across the street! And clean!
Summary: This hotel is the closest to Disneyland. Literally across the street on Harbor. We enjoyed a clean lobby, elevator, and rooms. Parking is a bit limited, but they asked if we had a car ahead of time. We did, and had no trouble parking. But maybe once things get really busy, it may be harder. The room was nice and microwave and mini fridge was nice also.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was ok for sleeping and can't beat the location.  First time without a stroller and my daughter was able to walk to the hotel and the park no problem.  For us the AC was so noisy you couldn't hear anything but the AC unit.  My husband slept with ear plugs.  It also left the room wet, like the carpet.  The bathroom was also really small.  I couldn't have both girls brush there teeth at the same time.  It was ok but I think I'd try someplace else next time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nasty, smelly, musty rooms, they can’t even stock you extra toilet paper and towels, rude and noisy neighbors and when you call to complain the hotel does nothing.  Specifically, Hannah, an employee, was beyond rude  and snarky acting like we should pack up after a long day in the park and move rooms if we didn’t like it.  Move the noisy rude people.  When you ask for a manager, they claim they are any until the middle of the following week.  Really?  Also, had neighbors coughing all night like they had Covid and hotel doesn’t care.  Good luck if you stay here!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel right across the street from Disneyland Park.
Summary: Our family went to Disneyland parks to enjoy the limited capacity after they reopened and chose this hotel for the proximity. It’s right across the street and was very convenient. Front desk staff very courteous and helpful. We stayed in a larger suite which was clean-the refrigerator was a little loud but not an issue  since it gave us some white noise during the night- air conditioner worked well- there is no housekeeping services in the room during the stay but that was fine they were prompt at giving us towels and other items that we requested. There is no hot meal service for breakfast unfortunately, but there’s a grab and go breakfast. Highly recommend for the Value and proximity to the park can’t be beat. Parking is available for a small daily fee which is the standard in
Manager Response: none

Summary: They did not honor our room request. They were rude at check in. No WiFi code or breakfast info was given. Pool use was not allowed. Price is the same despite lack of amenities. Terrible customer service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean and we were provided great service. It wasn’t a fancy/luxury hotel but the beds were comfortable. The pull out sofa bed was the only uncomfortable bed. The staff was great and they even let us stay parked after check out until Disney closed. We are sooooo thankful for that!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent, but not what I've come to expect from Best Western properties
Summary: I travel several times throughout the year and typically stay at Best Western properties because their rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfasts are good, and the overall value is usually excellent.  Some Best Western properties are even (far) nicer than more expensive, full service hotels.  Although this particular BW was decent overall, (except for the beds, which in our opinion were uncomfortable), there was nothing remarkable about the property, (other than it's proximity to Disneyland), and the cost was much more than I would have expected from a comparable motel.  Parking was also at a premium.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here over night before going to Disneyland. Every time our neighbors turned on the water it made a horrible loud noise (like TV static but loud!). My 6 year old kept getting woken up all night. I tried to sleep with a pillow over my head. Our very expensive trip to Disneyland was pretty much ruined by the fact that none of us slept. Try going to Disneyland with a sleep deprived 6yo! The breakfast was not as good as other hotels during COVID. There was a lot of hall noise coming in the room but I find this to be true with a lot of the neighboring Disney hotels. Staff was super friendly thought.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This location is perfect for guests going to the disneyland resort, it’s within walking distance. The staff is super friendly, rooms are up to date and super comfortable. Free breakfast, what more could you ask for.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. I felt safe staying here. The hotel is right across the street from Disneyland so that was great! Would recommend to family and friends. Staying here again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: For a stress-free experience stay here!  Especially with those with strollers. No need  to run to catch tram or shuttle and break down stroller. And take out sleeping child. This hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland archway entrance. Dining is close by. Yes, Even McDonald’s! For our choosy little ones.Happy kids! Happy Parents! Even grand parents with disability would enjoy this location. No need to have them walk to the park to order wheelchair. You can call hotel and get the phone number to order wheelchair in advance. There is a fee for wheelchair. Wheelchair will be in the lobby. Ready to take to room.  Now everyone is Happy and set for a Magical Time!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay, with the location ideal for Disneyland Resort. They checked us in quick. We got a room with a parking spot right by our door. This was much apricated as I'm 7 months pregnant and the more efficient with my walking the better. Our only complaint is the air conditioner made odd sounds when not fan was not running.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have 2 stars for the staff. They were friendly, check in and check out was a breeze however the room made me cringe. The fridge were not wiped clean, I was putting water bottles and saw old food Mark's on the inside of the fridge. Thankgoodness I always pack my own bathroom necessities whenever I travel, when I moved the ones from the room, some of the soap, lotions and shampoos were used. You would think with the pandemic going on, they will clean the room thoroughly. I always want to stay here when we visit Disneyland but they were always fully booked. This time we were able to snatch a room but it was disappointing. I will not go back. There are a lot other places to stay across from Disneyland that's much nicer and cleaner and more affordable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love the convenience of this hotel. It's so nice to be right across the street from Disney. The rooms were taped after cleaning so you know once it's cleaned, you are the only family to enter the room. Maid service was not offered during our stay, due to covid, but any extra amenities needed were just a call away. The room was very clean and the staff was friendly. Our family attended for A Touch of Disney and from the looks of it we were one of five families on the property. Totally worth the price!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: THE closet hotel to the front gate of Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Park Place Inn & Mini Suites, last year for four nights for a trip to Disneyland.  We looked at a number of “front gate” hotels on the same street, both in terms of price, value, and reviews.  We ultimately chose this hotel for the following reasons:  -	Location:  This hotel is literally across the street from the entrance to Disneyland (although the crosswalk for Harbor Blvd is not quite in front of the hotel proper).  It is THE closest hotel to the front gate of Disneyland.  Just view it in Google maps, you will see that the front door of this hotel is the closest to the crosswalk to get to Disneyland. -	Branding:  Although Best Western hotels are all independently owned and operated, the Best Western branding does afford a certain level of value
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the BEST thing I have done when making reservations, the hotel is literally in front of the entrance to Disney, you can't get any closer then that. The room was nice and roomy, we did have 2 queen beds and a sofa, with plenty of room for a crib and the stroller, plus all the stuff laying around. It also had a small microwave, small fridge and coffee maker. The bathroom was small, but really, you are only there for a bit, so it didn't bother us. The free breakfast next door was ok, I mean, nothing out of this world, but it was free, sooo. The only thing i didn't like was that the laundry room was getting repaired and we were unable to use it, which we really needed after several days of being on the road. I will be staying again in the future when we are able to return
Manager Response: none

Summary: Completely forgot to finish my review.  We stayed here just before they and Disneyland closed.  This hotel was fantastic.  We had a party of 5.  We felt the room was large enough for all of us.  The hotel is literally across the street from the entry point for Disneyland.  I have been to Disney World many times, and I cannot say how nice it was to not have to wait on a bus to get back to my hotel.  Even when we were tired, we felt the walk was not that bad.  The breakfast in the morning is good and has a lot of seating. Only suggestion would be less pepper on the potatoes.  We ate there every morning and it was always the same.  Front desk was always helpful and friendly. Whether check in or check out and even when one of our group forgot their card and she went to the front
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved this Best Western! 3 of us adults and 1 child stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. The room was great for us! The pull out couch plus 2 queen beds was just right. The walk to Disneyland is so short and even closer than a few of the on property hotels. Staff were friendly and super willing to help us store our luggage so we could get extra hours at Disneyland after checking out. I really liked the shutters in the windows in the room so you could really block out light from the outside. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great Dland stay right outside gate. Nice breakfast and very clean. Nice rooms and very nice staff. Not sure why anyone would stay anywhere else or pay more when visiting Dland. Parking is easy and the pool is enclosed from elements.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value and super close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is our go to spot when we go to Disneyland. Its right across the street. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean. It accommodates my family of 5 easily in one room with lots of space. We will definitely be staying there again.

Summary: This is your typical Best Western, which I really enjoy!  They offer a great continental breakfast and the location is literally the best of all the hotels other then the Grand Californian.  There is a decent pool and jacuzzi so you can take breaks during the day.  I literally can't say enough about the awesome location of this hotel to Disney!

Summary: Best value best location best breakfast. Best Best Western ever!! I will always stay here whenever I go to Disneyland. Summary: Not fancy, clean, great breakfast, and across the street from Disneyland.  Literally across the street.  This is the closest hotel to the parks.  We had sixteen people with two adjoining rooms  which added even more fun to our vacation.  The locations as so great!

Summary: I've always chosen Best Western for any travel my family does. The friendly staff, comfort and hotel amenities exceeds any and all expectations. Complimentary breakfast is wonderful, with so many items to choose from.

Summary: The closest hotel needed when we walked over 27kms in 14 hours at Disneyland. so glad we stayed here. if just going to Disneyland this hotel ticks all the boxes.With a 10 year old the three of us enjoyed being opposite the main entrance to Disneyland  and easy walk to food (take away or restaurants) if a safe room is needed close to Disneyland and with breakfast we recommend.

Summary: This hotel is directly across from the entrance to Disneyland. At a casual pace, it took us 5min to walk to the bag inspection area. The pool and hot tub was really nice to relax in.  The breakfast is buffet style at captain kids, in the same parking lot as the hotel. Includes amazing French toast, pancakes, potatoes, eggs, oatmeal, bagels, toast, muffins, fruit, juices and so much more. It saves alot of time and money having breakfast there.  The little store inside the hotel lobby has all kinds of Disney stuff to purchase and very good prices. They sell water for $2 a bottle compared to $4.20 at disneyland, so grab a couple to bring into disneyland.  The walls arw really thin, but I didnt start hearing noise until abiut 7am, so not a big deal. If you want to sleep in, I would

Summary: Was very satisfied with the room. It was right across from where i needed to be..staff an overall experience was excellent.will definitely be staying there on my next trip.woukd recommend this for a stay to anyone

Summary Heading: As close to Disney as you can get and not be on property
Summary: We've stayed at several of the Harbor Blvd hotels over the years on trips to Disneyland, but this was really quite nice.  The rooms were comfortable, in really good shape, and about as quiet as we've experienced, given the human traffic in and around this place. The beds were nice and firm, and yet comfortable at that same time.  The towels were large, but not particularly fluffy but did the job. The internet connection was very good, but the television wasn't perfect.  While we didn't spend a lot of time in the room, the television is a Spectrum internet provider and there were some drops and long mysterious gaps when trying to change channels.  But we weren't there for the TV so it wasn't a big deal.  Everything else in the room works very well.  The folks at the front desk

Summary Heading: Great hotel across the street from Disney.
Summary: Reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the area, free breakfast, clean rooms, and excellent staff. We stay here whenever we visit Disneyland. The hotel is right across the street from the main Disney entrance. It's a mere 5 minute walk to either park.

Summary Heading: Great for mid-day break from Disney.
Summary: My favorite part about this hotel is how close it is to Disneyland. We spent 5 days back to back in the Parks from open to close. But with small children and my 74 year old father, we needed a break in middle to recharge. It's not too far of a walk for old or young to grab lunch, swim, or take a nap.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times as I frequent Disneyland.  The location is ideal.  This stay on Saturday was the most disappointing stay ever and will be my last time staying there.  One of the reasons why I stay there is I come down from Northern California when the park first opens up.  I am able to check in, leave my car and come back later when my room is available.  I was not able to leave my car (first time in 45 visits that I have ever had to park there) , I had to park about a mile away  in over flow parking and pay 20 each time I left the parking, in addition to the 10 for the night.  (we had to pay 120 for parking for the overflow that was not expected) The hotel claims you can show the overflow parking the hotel receipt to the parking to pay the one time
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know of your concerns. Unfortunately, our parking policy is strictly one vehicle per reservation. Any extra vehicles would have to park offsite at the Anaheim Gardenwalk for $20 per day if you show proof of stay. This parking policy has been the policy since previous management. We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and your feedback will help us to better assist the rest of our guests. Thank you again and we hope that you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: The best place to stay and closest place to the park and even closer than staying on property. Might be pricier but you appreciate the closeness when you have already walked 10 miles in the park! Clean and worth it!!

Summary: Brilliant stay and close to Disneyland. Very convenient and well worth the price paid. Good variety for breakfast and the reception staff were very accommodating and helpful. Good with a late check in.

Summary: Very close to Disney. Plenty of food choices near by to choice from to eat. Walgreen down the street 3 blocks. Very clean and friendly staff. Uber or lyft in to save on parking. Breakfast was good with a good variety. The pool was cold  and the sheets need to be softer, but over all a good place

Summary: This hotel has much going for it!  The rooms were newly refurbished, and amazingly clean.  The location is perfect!  Literally across the street from the park.  Front desk helpful.  Didn't get to enjoy the breakfast as we had to get in line by 7 to get in the park to get on the NEW RIDE of course (which we did and it was amazing).  Only two downsides...one is the parking, I had to pay to park there for one night, but both days I had to move my car.  I couldn't park in the hotel on check in day til late in the day so had to pay the $25 parking in the Toy Story lot. Then the second day had to be out of the hotel parking lot by 3 so had to move my car again onto Disney property for another $25....and had to leave the parks both days to do that in the middle of the day.  I

Summary: We stayed here for three days at Disneyland, based on its location and the recommendation of a friend. It was significantly cheaper than the Disney hotels and just as close for two of them! Plus it included breakfast and inexpensive parking. The rooms were clean and we were able to easily sleep our family of five. We picked our days at Disneyland based on when we could get enough nights here at this hotel and I would definitely do it again!

Summary: Other than a Disney hotel, you can't get much closer to the happiest place on earth. There is a pool and hot tub to enjoy and relax. We got soaked on splash moutain went back to the room, changed and were back to the fun in no time. Awesome.

Summary: Love this hotel , very close walking distance to Disneyland . Appreciated the elevator to reach the upper levels. Great  Hot Breakfest . Very clean and love the spacious bathroom. I’ve learned you can’t gonwrong with Best Western !

Summary Heading: Best place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: Located directly across the street from DL, this BW is always our go to. The staff is friendly, the hotel clean and comfortable. The breakfast which is served next door does have a wide variety of pre packaged food such as muffins, powdered eggs, bacon, etc with juice and coffee. Some fresh fruit as well. This is a family friendly hotel, so there are a lot of families who stay here. For the most part the rooms are well insulated, so noise isn't usually a problem.

Summary Heading: Overall Value for a Disney Stay is Great
Summary: This hotel is literally a 5 minute walk to the Gate entrance.  Add that it was very clean, nicely decorated and had multiple amenities such as a fridge, microwave, WiFi, secure parking and a good breakfast ~ you can't really go wrong.  If I had any criticism, it's that it is not a QUIET place to stay.  There's a lot of early activity for families going to Disneyland (think strollers and small children running and traversing the exterior hallways) but that's in no way the hotel's fault.  Overall, this was a great value for my 2-Day Disneyland trip, and I would book it again.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney, friendly staff, not very modern, a few minor issues
Summary: PROS: - Staff was very nice and accommodating. - It's literally right across from Disneyland Resort. You only have to cross the crosswalk and you're there. Can't get any closer unless you're in the Grand Californian - Buffet breakfast was good, with plenty of variety and decent tasting food.  CONS: - I didn't complain because we were barely there for a night, but the cabinet door under the sink was supposed to be screwed shut and wasn't. The screw was there but not through the door to the cabinet, and of course my son opened it. It was filthy underneath with green and brown dry stuff (possibly mold) and smelled up the room a bit. - Bath/shower faucet is difficult to figure out, and there are no instructions. - Bathroom fan was very loud, and not optional if you want the light

The beds are very comfortable. There are lots out electrical outlets to charge phones and tablets. The closet was spacious with lots of hangers. The breakfast buffet had lots of choices. Summary: I enjoyed this hotel as every room had its own entrance and a great little pool. Located right across the street from disneyland so easy to come and go. Included breakfast with pretty good selection of items. Very clean and the staff were super friendly. I recommend this hotel as a great, easy going, family hotel. One recommendation is to check parking costs and availability if you have a vehicle. We had a special rate which we found out after checking in, did not include parking and the closest parking lot was 15 min walk and 30.00 a day. I was told I would get a discount but when I went to grab my car, there was no one working (which looked like this was normal during the daytime hours) so got no discount. Just call hotel to double check.

Summary Heading: A motel not a hotel, but your feet will thank you!
Summary: Location! Location! Location! I wanted to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, my family vetoed me and wanted to stay here to save money to do other things at Disney (such as Goofy’s Kitchen) and because they wanted to be closer to the park.  This is one time I will admit I was wrong!  The truth is, at the end of a Disneyland day, you just need somewhere to lay your head so you can do it all again the next day!  This hotel was clean on the inside, had plenty of hot water; was literally a 5 minute walk to the Disney GATES not downtown Disney like some hotels try and fool you with!  Breakfast was included, which again was nothing to write home about, but it provided us with energy for the parks, and again saved that precious cash!  With 2 queen beds and 1 sofa bed we only needed 1 room
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall, the place was great because of the proximity to Disneyland. It was quiet & the beds were comfortable. That’s all I really care about. The breakfast was mediocre but exactly what I would expect and sufficient for a pre-park fuel up. The only con I have is that the hair dryer cord was too short and kept falling out of the outlet while I was trying to dry my hair. Annoying but not a big deal. And the bathroom light switches were outside the bathroom (so is the vanity). Which is fine unless you’re sleeping with 5 other people and have to go the bathroom/wash hands in the middle of the night. Definitely not a deal breaker, but something to keep in mind if you have very light sleepers.

Summary Heading: Met and exceeded our special needs
Summary: Our room was comfortable, clean and spacious. I am disabled and required extra space to accommodate an exlectric scooter for Disneyland, and grab bars in the bathroom. Summary: Don’t take more than one vehicle. You are only allowed one per room. If you do you have to park your second vehicle away from the hotel and pay an extra $30 . The only pro is the distance of the theme park. Still they over charge just for that convenience.

Summary: We recently stayed here. There were 6 of us.  We had 2 queen bed and couch pull out.  Everything was very comfortable and plenty of room. I called down to the front desk 9:30pm mind you, and they knew exactly what to do and got us a private car to get us to the airport on time.  Big Kudos!!!! We will always stay at these properties from now on!!!

Summary Heading: Not a hotel if you have any accessibility needs
Summary: Horrible parking, narrow walkways and cut outs makes wheelchair use difficult.  No access for the complementary breakfast.   Breakfast food is upstairs next to the hotel.  You must have someone with you to be able to go upstairs and get your food (hope they know what you like)    there  is also NO bathroom at the breakfast downstairs!!!!   only upstairs.   Overflow parking (second car) is off site and did not honor the hotels discounted rate.   Hard beds.  Older rooms, clean but run down.   All noise from outside and adjoining  rooms can be heard clearly.   Good thing is the hotel is right across from the walk way entrance into the parks. Summary: You can't beat the location -- it's closer than some of the actual Disneyland hotels. We've stayed before and really enjoyed our stay, but our most recent stay will probably be our last. The AC didn't cool the room, and had a loud rattle when it was on. The bathroom fan rattled as well, so we couldn't turn it on if any member of our party was sleeping. And the noise in the pipes when nearby rooms would turn on their water woke us up. (I promise, we're usually really sound sleepers -- I was surprised at how loud it all was.) Also, if papery sheets bother you, you won't love these beds. I really wanted to love our stay, because we've stayed before and it's super convenient to Disneyland. But next time we'll probably try the Tropicana or another nearby place.

The location is of course close to the entrance which is nice at the end of a late night but there are many on that side that charge way less and have a better pool, food, no charge on parking, etc. Best Western normal standards don't apply here..

Summary: Someone posted "location, location, location". The rooms have been updated in furnishings, more modern feel, but the bones of each room are the typical motel set up.  We spent 7 nights here, though and for our needs it was perfect! We had 5 adults (3 17-21 age kids & ourselves) in the mini suite for a week and enjoyed it. The beds and bedding were very very comfortable. After spending 10 to 14 hours at Disneyland, crashing here was amazing! My family used the pool and hot tub & enjoyed it too.  By the way, this motel offers complimentary breakfast from Captain Kidd's next door...it was really good! Coffee was hot and flavorful too. That saved us $70 to $100 for breakfast every day!!  Unless we win the lottery & stay on the resort property, we won't stay anywhere else from now

Summary: We reserved two doubles and a sofa bed. Perfect sleeping scenario for us with two tall teenagers. The room is basic, but very clean. We were surprised there is no safe in the room. The positives are the location in proximity to the main entry of Disneyland or California Adventure Parks which are directly across the street. No shuttles to wait for, no need for a rental car. Our whole stay revolves around the two parks so we are all set. I would stay here again.

Checking in was very easy and I opted for express checkout,  The hotel also allows you to leave your car in the parking lot til 3pm on the day you check out. Room was spacious with 2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper.  Room came with a full breakfast that included eggs, potatoes, sausage, pancakes, waffles, assorted muffins, cereal, bread & bagels. Summary: Our family usually stays at a Best Western whenever we can and especially the Park Place Inn when we vacation at Disneyland.  The hotel is right across the street from the park.  It's a short walk to the gates and we love the breakfast in the morning.  Very clean, convenient and friendly staff.   The rooms have microwaves and a fridge which are essential when traveling with kids.

Summary: Standard budget room, clean and quiet and a good value. Breakfast was nice, nothing fancy but a good basic meal. The area seems safe and is quiet and the staff helpful. Will consider using the hotel for our next road trip!

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: This is hands-down the best hotel to stay with your family for Disneyland. You get so tired and want to rest during the day- it's so easy to go back and forth and it's nearby so many restaurants- fast and sit-down!

Summary Heading: This 'motel' is as good as many 'hotels'
Summary: Location location location!   You can see the Disneyland entrance sign from the hotel and it’s literally across the road which makes it a few minutes walk to the turnstiles. The room was very nice, clean and large with lots of space for a family of four. The beds were super comfortable.  The service everywhere was great (especially the front desk) and the onsite laundry was a great addition. The pool was nice enough but small and the breakfast next door was plentiful and kept us all going until lunchtime which was great.  The hotel was a short walk away from Downtown Disney, lots of restaurants, a few 24 hour pharmacies, a 7/11 and quite a few souvenir shops that were much cheaper than buying inside the theme parks. Also the ‘Outlets by Orange’ were only a short taxi ride away
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary Heading: Closest Hotel to Disneyland outside the gates. They got us on parking 2 vehicles.
Summary: Probably the closest off site hotel to Disneyland and California Adventure. The only complaint I have is that I specifically called about a second vehicle, because they only allow 1 vehicle to stay on hotel property for 10.00 a day. I wanted to make sure there would be some other parking available. I was reassured that there was a parking area and that all we had to do was unload our luggage and items at the hotel and park at this lot and it was about a 10 min walk back to the hotel. The lady I spoke with led me to believe that this was their extra parking for their hotel when in fact it is not. It is a privately owned parking garage. When we came to check in we were told it was 30.00 a day to park. So we were paying 40.00 a day to park both vehicles. We were there for 4 days
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary Heading: Disneyland is Just a Crosswalk Away!
Summary: So incredibly glad we chose this hotel for our Disneyland trip! It was just across the road from the main Disneyland entrance - a 5 minute walk tops. Rooms were clean and decently sized and they offered a nice breakfast buffet. Really a much better value than paying the on-resort prices!

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland but Needs Work
Summary: The room was nice, spacious, and clean.  Beds were OK.  Hotel was the closest to Disneyland without staying on property.  Decent value for the money.  Main issues were with the cooling unit and the bathroom toilet.  We stayed during the first week of August so it was fairly hot most days.  The cooling unit needed to be on and running constantly but it never fully cooled the room down.  It was a very clammy feeling and the ventilation wasn't very good.  The toilet is a traditional round seat and very close to the wall.  We are used to the elongated toilets which are much more comfortable.  It was also very close to the wall and I had to sit at an angle just to not hit the toilet paper holders with my legs.  Parking was convenient but there were a lot of smokers outside which was

Summary: First off, if you are looking for a good neighbor hotel that won't break your budget, look no further than this place! It is RIGHT across the street from the parks and offers a comfortable room and a full hot buffet style breakfast that can please even the pickiest of eaters! The pool and hot tub were awesome as well as the laundry facility and souvenirs are WAY cheaper here too with the discount! The staff were warm and inviting and the rooms were very clean! You bet our family will be back! :)

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay to go to Disneyland
Summary: We had a mini suite for our family of 4 so we didn't feel cramped in the space and everyone got a bed.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  Staff was very nice and accomodating.    The location to the Disneyland Park entrance was perfect, directly across the street!  Loved that the breakfast included so we could eat quickly and get our day started early.
