Summary: The location is great! We were so tired after a hot and long walking around disney so we just walked back to the hotel to rest and it’s right infront about a 3min walk! The breakfast is good! And room is clean, the staff are so nice! I’m definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Why are you going to Anaheim?
Summary: Looking at all the other hotels in the Anaheim area I see a lot of flashy gimicks.  But why are you going to Anaheim?  There is only one reason, and that is DisneyLand.  This hotel is exactly ACROSS the street from Disney.  You cannot be any closer except for spending double to stay on property.  Let me put it this way...  There is a crosswalk to the security/bus section of Disney.  On the other side of that crosswalk leads you to the restaurant owned by the hotel where you get an awesome continental breakfast buffet which is connected to the hotel.  Don't understand how close yet?  My room faced the parks and I was able to see the fireworks from my window.  Besides the awesome location, the staff was great, wifi worked as promise and easy to log onto, the showers had great
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are going to Disneyland.  The hotel staff was extremely professional and helpful, especially Giovanni who assisted in my check in. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.  The continental breakfast was delicious and had a huge selection of food to offer. This hotel is directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance. An easy walk to both Disney parks and downtown Disney. I'm thankful I chose to stay in this hotel,  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is great. All of the staff were very kind. The hotel was kept clean and the rooms have been updated in the past few years. The location is amazing! Literally right across the street from Disneyland. The only things they could improve on  would be putting in a larger pool and having in room safes. The pool was small and crowded since it was so hot during our stay. They do not have in room safes but do have lock boxes in the lobby that you can use at no charge. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is THE premier location for a non-Disney hotel.  It's actually closer to the park entrance than Disneyland Hotel.  The rooms themselves were pretty standard, clean and up to date.  The bathrooms could have used a spruce, but were functional and clean.  The breakfast was good, full buffet with waffles, french toast, eggs and meats plus the usual pastries, doughnuts, yogurt, ect.  We would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: My boyfriend and I decided to take a trip to Disneyland to see the new Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge. I decided to book at Best Western because they are across the street (literally). I knew we did not feel like walking far back to our room after a long day at the park. I booked three months in advance, just an FYI they fill up quickly. Upon arrival, we were checked-in on time (3pm), no issues checking in. We got a King mini suit on the lower level (nice!). Everything was in working condition and clean.  We stayed for three nights, It was tough getting some sleep at night because our neighbors above and next to us have children who were running, jumping, and screaming up until 1am. Not worth complaining, because we all know there is nothing that can be done (you know what I mean).
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: This location is outstanding and worth the money. The hotel itself has a few issues though - the air conditioner was really loud & woke us up a few times at night. Also the walls are very thin. You may not want to get up at 7am for an early park opening, but your neighbours will, and you’ll hear every detail about their park plans before they go. You’ll also hear them using the sink, toilet & shower. That being said, the breakfast next door is a good way to start the day, and the staff is very friendly. I’d stay here over a Disney hotel any day...
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We stayed here for just one night last year when we visited Legoland and Disneyland. It was easy and convenient and very close to the entrance of the park - which was great except that we could only leave our car until 3 pm (reasonable) and planned to stay at the park until late. So we had to park in the regular Disney parking lot which defeated the purpose of staying in a close hotel. The room was nice and clean, but the two double beds were not big enough for the three of us! Breakfast upstairs was good - my daughter and husband enjoyed it. I would stay here again if I were staying for multiple nights and wanted to be close the the parks.

Summary: In planning a July 4th vacation to Disneyland, I was so excited to stay here only to be disappointed by meager expectations.  First, the location is ideally located across from the Disneyland entrance.  It’s an awesome benefit after a long day.  However, the rooms and security leave something to be desired.  On one night, a trespasser had climbed the roof and began screaming at pedestrians and hotel guests.  Additionally, vagrants would walk around the premises.  My biggest complaint is that the rooms are not quite modern.  Bathrooms are undersized as door was two feet from the front edge of toilet.  There are no curtains in the rooms.  Slatted windows allow too much light in from street and exterior lighting.  HVAC had holes to expose outside.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know of your concerns.For the safety of our guests, we do have security overnight. We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and your feedback will help us to better assist the rest of our guests. Thank you again and we hope that you give us another chance in the future.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney with Breakfast included - WINNING!
Summary: This hotel is super close to Disney which made coming and going to the park a breeze. Its a little more expensive, in the end $20 more a night than the neighboring hotels, but the location and the fact that it included breakfast was totally worth it. Now, lets talk about the Breakfast. It was LEGIT. Yogurt, coffee, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, a variety of eggs (scrambled, egg pattys both regular and egg white) sausage both pork and turkey, fruit, muffins, pastries, doughnuts, milk, variety of juices, coffee, pancakes, french toast, and waffles. Since its buffet it made it easy to get in and out fast. For the price difference for 4 people to eat was unbeatable. I WILL be staying here again.

Summary: This little property, located right across the street from Disneyland, was very pleasantly surprising. When my husband told me we were staying at a Best Western, I thought he was joking! Much closer than the Spring Hill Suites (so close, that when we or the kids got tired, we could pop over for a quick rest, then hit the parks again). Rooms were clean and quite large. They were quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. Great air conditioning. There is laundry on property, which I used.  Breakfast is across the driveway at a little restaurant, and it was nothing special, but the staff was very friendly and it was very clean.

Summary: We made this our home away from home during our recent Disneyland vacation. I booked the hotel and tickets through getaway today travel. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to go to Disneyland who doesn’t want to pay Disney resort sky high prices.

Summary Heading: You can not beat the location
Summary: This is our first time to the BW Plus Park Place but the second property we stayed at while here in Anaheim in April/May and the location is fantastic. We were with a lauge group so we were at the back of the property (but we had no issue with that) The pool is small but ample. The service staff are amazing, fast and friendly. The property itself is old and the rooms dark and quite tired but we were here due to the location, onsite laundry facilites and included breakfast. It didnt disapoint. We frequent Anaheim ever two years from NZ and have been in many a hotel around here and the surrounding area but due to the above this is be one of our go to's now.   *We also loved watching the Fireworks from the top floor :)   Thanks BW for a great week in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We work hard to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay and we appreciate your feedback very much. We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We stay at this hotel every time we visit Disneyland. It is conveniently located across from entrance of Disneyland  which is less than a 5 minute walk. It is perfect when traveling with young children so we can go back to the room for them to rest without having to worry about shuttles and what not.  Also, they offer breakfast next door at Captain Kidd's which has a good variety. I would definitely recommend this hotel as i have been using it for the past 8 years.

Summary: Great hotel choice for anyone planning on visiting Disneyland.  Short of the Grand Californian, I don't think you can get closer to the park.  The breakfast features a wide selection of items that will get you ready for your day in the park.

Summary: My boyfriend and I wanted a place to stay close to the park and we chose this hotel for the first time. We didn’t have to wait in long shuttle lines at the end of the day.  This hotel is even closer than Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier Hotel which are Disney Resort hotels.    We opted for a 2 Queen Mini Suite and loved it!!  We like the additional space in a room and there was plenty.   Rooms are recently remodeled and very nice.   The beds are somewhat firm, but comfortable.   The pillows are big and plush and very comfy as well.   We stayed 4 nights and had no problems sleeping.

We had trouble using the app for the washing machines as our phones are Australian so couldn’t access the correct App Store from which to download the app (took a while to figure that one out!), but the front desk staff kindly swapped some change for us.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for your Disneyland trip
Summary: After planning a last minute Disneyland trip with our family, we wanted to ensure that we made the most of our time. So when looking for a hotel room, we wanted to stay close. After staying at a few rental properties that required us to either drive to the park or Uber to the park, our first priority was to find somewhere close.  This hotel provided all of the comfort that we needed to enjoy our day at the park. When we hear of people booking a 'cheap hotel' near the park and accompany their reservation with 'it doesn't need to be nice, we will only sleep there,' it is kind of a hard selling point... well, this hotel was not only cheap(er) and super convenient, but it provided our family with all of the comfort and amenities that we could have asked for.  The check-in was easy,

Summary: We like to stay at this hotel because of its proximity to the Disney park. We have a member of our family who has health issues and the proximity allows them to take breaks and rest but still enjoy the parks with the rest of the family. The hotel staff is very accommodating to their health needs and the size of the rooms is wonderful and their wheelchair does not interfere with movement around the room.

Summary: Great location for Disneyland!  Closest hotel to the park!  After a long day of walking Disney, it was really nice to be so close.  The breakfast options were good each morning.  We were able to open and close the park.  My hubs was able to take a break because it was so close.  GREAT LOCATION and GREAT VALUE!

Summary: This property is directly across the street from the Entrance to Downtown Disney area and only about a 6 minute walk to the Entrances to Disneyland and California Adventure park.  The rooms are very clean and well kept and appear to have been recently updated.  There are a few dining options suitable for children (iHop and Captain Kid and Dennys right next door.  The price is very reasonable for a location within a very easy walk into the parks.

Summary: I have stayed at 6 different hotels near Disneyland over the years. This was definitely at the top of my list! Location is perfect, directly across from the entrance. Breakfast was included with many options. Rooms were clean and the grounds/pool were kept tidy and maintained. All staff I encountered were pleasant and efficient. We had absolutely no issues. I was able to reserve early without a deposit and paid in full upon arrival with no surprise charges or holds. Our family of five was comfortable in the room with two beds and a pullout sofa. We also appreciated the fridge and microwave. One of my favorite features were the shutter/blinds in the room which were a million times better than the traditional dusty old hotel drapes, and allowed for privacy as well as natural light
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased to read that we are at the top of your list for hotels in the area! Your comments, compliments, and recommendation are greatly appreciated and we look forward to your return.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: High cost and inflexible parking rules
Summary: At $240+ this is a very high price for a regular king size bed room. At an extra $10 for parking for the night, with a strict deadline of 3pm, this is unlike many other hotels in the area.  Staff was unwilling to extend parking deadline by 2 hours to 5pm.  We decided to drive out in the morning, park at Disneyland for an extra $25 for the whole day and then stay through the evening, before leaving LA.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry the parking accommodations did not meet with your needs.  Check out is at 11 am and we do provide a complimentary 4 hour parking extension until 3 pm on the day of departure.  Due to high demand, limited parking, and to ensure all our guests are given equal consideration in accessibility to our parking, we do need guests to move their vehicles after the 4 hour extension expires.  The information is provided on our website and in our email confirmations to avoid any disappointment upon arrival. Again, I am sorry this did not meet with your needs however, if your needs should change during future travels, I hope will consider staying with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Great Location for Family and Groups
Summary: Stayed here with a traveling band group for Disneyland Performing Arts. The location when handling logistics with a large group could not be beat. Cleanliness was great. Beds comfy. I would not hesitate to recommend this location.

Summary Heading: Can't get any closer to Disney
Summary: The staff here were extremely pleasant and professional.  Rooms were very nice with extremely comfortable beds and pillows. We were able to walk to Disney main gates within 5 minutes.  Very safe area. Will stay here again on my next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: You can't get any closer to the entrance to the parks. I gave this a 4 for location, otherwise it would be a 3/3 1/2. It is a motel set up. Everything is very clean. no complaints about cleanliness at all in room, grounds or pool area. Front desk people are very friendly. I got my room as soon as I arrived which was very nice. I booked this hotel strictly for location. Breakfast was ok. I did call for an extra blanket at night and couldn't wait up long enough for it to arrive so I cancelled it. An extra blanket or 2 in the room would be a suggestion. And there is no safe, which I would have liked to have for passports, extra cash, etc.

Summary: Loved that this location was right across the street from Disneyland. The breakfast had a good selection which helped cut down on costs. The only issue was that there was only one working elevator. This created a problem in the mornings when housekeeping staff were working.

Summary: Overall distance to the parks and restaurants were key. I literally walked across the street to get to the parks. Breakfast was provided and very decent so I didn't have to spend any money on breakfast. Plus there's a restaurant literally a quick hop away if I wanted anything else.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney gates, great breakfast
Summary: This was our first stay at this Best Western near Disney. This hotel is closer than paradise pier and the Disneyland hotel. Breakfast starts at 6:30 so you can line up early for park entry. Tons of hot and cold choices. Great basic accommodations for my family of 6.  Kind, responsive staff. Cons-- small pool that gets crowded-- no hooks to hang bathing suits to dry, no hooks to hang towels to be reused. Pull out couch not the best but little kids didn't care. Not a deal breaker. We will definitely check this one out again. It was so nice to just cross the street and get to our room.

Summary: I love staying at this Best Western location and the rooms have been updated nicely.  I have never had a problem staying here, meaning if something came up the staff were super friendly and quick to resolve it!

Summary Heading: Pretty good. Some room repairs needed
Summary: The closest hotel to Disneyland. Even closer than Disneyland hotel and Paradise Pier hotel. Air conditioner was too loud (needs repair), grout needed redone in the shower, and there was a strange wet spot on the carpet in front of the sink (leak?). Great breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great property and close to parks!
Summary: The hotel is literally right across the street from the "Welcome to Disneyland" sign. Super convenient in the morning and evening after a long day.   Very clean, seems to be a little more expensive than some of the other hotels in the area but worth it, especially when I went which seems to be off-season and cheaper. Also fills up fast since it's so close to the entrance to the parks. Room was clean, we were on the second floor overlooking the main road so it was a little bright and noisy, but we could hear the fireworks and the AC in the room was loud enough to cover up the noise (I like white noise when I sleep so this was okay). Would stay here again as long as it's not peak season, because if it is you can save ~$50-100 a night and stay a little farther from the entrance.

Summary: This hotel is right across from Disneyland. The staff was friendly and professional. There are plenty of places to eat nearby and a four minute walk till you are in the park. I highly recommend that you stay in this hotel.

Summary: This hotel was great, clean, great complementary breakfast, including oatmeal, cereal, eggs, waffles, yogurt....Also outdoor pool and spa. Directly across street from park entrance, we will  stay again!

Summary: The perfect hotel for budget conscious families looking for the convenience of staying directly across the park entrance.   We stayed at the hotel for 4 days in late March. The AC in the room could’ve been better, & the beds weren’t too comfortable. My husband and I had stiff necks. Services were great though. But overall I would stay here again.

Food was fresh - some fruit and all the classic American breakfast options, dining room was clean - guests filling their plates and bags to take food out of the buffet an eye opener though!  Will definitely return to this hotel for our next Disneyland trip!

Summary: This was first time staying at this Best Western location and it won’t be the last time! You cannot beat the location of being right across from the entrance to Disneyland. I enjoyed my stay and can’t wait to return! Breakfast was wonderful and many options. I highly recommend this if you have a family or even traveling by yourself! Our room was very spacious and the bed was comfortable. Pool and hotub were also available after a long day at the parks. The wonderful people at the front desk held our luggage before our room was ready and after our stay so we couldn enjoy Downtown Disney before leaving to fly home. I throughly enjoyed my stay and cannot wait to return! Thank you!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here several times and will stay again.  It is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  Can't get much closer unless you stay at a Disney hotel.  We feel that the prices are reasonable for a hotel so close to Disneyland.  We love the breakfast buffet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from a 3 night stay.  The property was in the perfect location for a trip to Disneyland.  I was concerned about parking based on some other reviews but it was fine.  We were on the second floor but didn't hear a noise from any of the rooms around us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland, super convienient, reasonable rates. My 5th time staying here when I come to Disneyland. Easy to walk to to take a short break from walking all day in the parks. Totally recommend staying here!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great location it is directly across from Disneyland.  The staff is very nice and helpful with all questions.   The breakfast is very nice and there was something of everyone in our party, (ie: cereal, bagels, eggs, pancakes, breakfast meat and more.   I would recommend the hotel and location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Closest hotel to Disneyland resort. I've chosen to stay in this hotel over the years due to excellent service, location and convenience. Breakfast is a nice added bonus. I  will definitely be returning.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I picked this hotel because of the location and free breakfast. Location is great but the breakfast was horrible. Frozen waffles and instant oatmeal was a huge disappointment. Sleeper sofa was so uncomfortable my 10 year old said she'd rather sleep on the floor! Bedding was cheap and light and there were only 2 washers and dryers in the facility that I waited hours to do laundry.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay.  We do hope you will stay with us again.  With that in mind I would like to let you know that if at anytime you are uncomfortable in your room, please let us know and we will be happy to assist you.  Unfortunately, not knowing your name I am unable to check the sofa bed that was in your room.  While we do only have two washers and dryers, we do also offer two different laundry services so you are not having to spend vacation time doing laundry. While I understand you did not enjoy the waffles and oatmeal, we do offer a wide variety of other options.  Again, we do hope we will see you again and do hope you enjoyed your time at Disneyland.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Had a standard double queen room. Room had been recently “renovated”, which was new paint, carpet, and furniture.  Room was very clean and of average comfort. Hotel was quiet enough. Definitely no bells and whistles, but no complaints. Free breakfast next door was nice but very crowded. Biggest plus is how close this hotel is to the park...you can’t get any closer without staying in a Disney hotel. Actually, I think Park Place is closer to the entrance gates than the Disneyland hotel. Price is reasonable (relative to other hotels in the vicinity), especially since it is close enough that you don’t have to pay for the daily shuttle to the park. Great option for families who may need to take an afternoon break/nap before heading back to the park.  Have booked another stay for next
Manager Response: none

Summary: It’s a 3 star Best Western but just across the street from Disneyland’s park entrance. The closest hotel you can get from the entrance. Has a good breakfast for a 3 stars Best Western. Again, location, location, location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location and Great staff. Best location for all you're Disneyland,  California Adventureland and Downtown Disney visits. The staff is willing to do whatever they need to to make your stay great. We have stayed here for over 20 years.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Aside from the very limited parking option times on check-in day, we came to the hotel on our one-night stay after a full day of Disneyland. The staff was friendly and on the surface, the hotel seemed OK as did our room. The problem we had was with the heater. It was a very cold night in Anaheim on our stay last night and after we got settled in the room we turned on the heater and WOW WAS IT LOUD!!!!! It was like a giant diesel engine firing up every time the heat came on. It was so loud it drowned out the volume of the television and even though we were beyond exhausted we couldn't sleep with the heater on it was so loud. So we heated up the room as best we could and shut it off, only to have a freezing room in the morning. Seriously, Space Mountain was as quiet as the library
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry you had an issue with the heater and do wish we had been informed so we could have addressed the concern immediately.  I do hope you will consider staying with us again.  Please feel free to reach out to me for assistance on a future reservation.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Proximity to Disneyland is the only thing this property has going for it.  We have 2 young children and we stayed here to avoid waiting for a parking shuttle to and from Disneyland and the convenience of walking back and forth when the boys needed a nap.  We woke up early, drove 2 hours to get to the hotel to park and walk across to Disneyland.  Unfortunately, upon arrival, we were told there was no parking available and that we would have to return in the afternoon.  However, as we left, we counted 9 open spots.  When we went back in, to point this out, we were told any spaces available were reserved for staff.  (So the guests are inconvenienced? ).  So, I dropped Mom off with the kids and drove to park.  Shuttled back to Disneyland etc.  When the boys started to get cranky and
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your concerns.  Our parking begins at 1 pm the day of arrival, space permitting and our guaranteed check in time is at 3:00 pm.  On the day of departure we do provide a courtesy 4 hour extension of parking until 3:00 pm.  On a daily basis, multiple guests arrive hours prior to the guaranteed parking and check in times and unfortunately need to be turned away, as the multiple early arrivals would occupy the spots for our currently registered guests who are entitled to a space.  We do also share the lot with the restaurant which is entitled to a number of parking spaces. We do regret the number of guests we have to turn away each day as we very much wish we could accommodate Disney parking.  However the policy is need to provide equal consideration to all of our guests while registered at our hotel. I am very sorry these restrictions caused a disruption to your visit.  I hope this explanation helps you understand the need for the restrictions. While these restrictions did not meet with your travel needs this visit, if your plans differ during future travels, I do hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: We stayed here for christmas week at disneyland. The hotel is right across the street.  We loved the place and everyone was nice and welcoming. The rooms were clean and breakfast was better than many. Will stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stay at the best western park and place inn(the one almost in front of the Disneyland parks entrance) overall it was a very clean and nice place to stay. Obliviously we went to Disney for most of the trip but when it came to rest and relax this place made us feel refreshed for the next day. Beds were comfy(we had a queen size bed) a/c and heater worked well. The best part was that it was only a short walking distance to the entrance which saved of a lot of walking and cardio!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The breakfast was delicious and had a large variety. It was like a restaurant buffet. The rooms were comfortable and well-kept. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating to our group's needs. The hotel's proximity to the Disneyland parks is also helpful!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our third time staying here. Right across the street from the main Disneyland entrance so it’s a very short walk into the park. Hotel has very nice rooms with comfortable beds. The free breakfast is really good as well. The only two things I’d give a thumbs down to is the blinds on the windows let some light in at night which is bad for those who need it very dark to sleep, and the breakfast room Is upstairs with no elevator so not handicapped accessible.
Manager Response: none

Summary: They were professional in all areas from check in, breakfast, and housekeeping. The breakfast was hot and great.The location was just across the street from the park. We will be returning every time from now on.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Parking is Highway Robbery and they wouldn’t let us out when we accidentally parked there
Summary: We wanted to go to IHOP and accidentally turned in to this lot.  We didn’t realize it would be $25 an hour to park.  They said the signs are marked, which they weren’t.  When we went in to ask they were so rude.  I would never stay here!  I will tell everyone I know notnto stay or park here.  What awful customer service.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that you were upset by the charge for almost two hours of parking. The large sign at the entry to the parking lot where the ticket for the gate is obtained, does state that the lot is for hotel and Captain Kidd's Restaurant parking only and the non guest prices are listed. Due to being directly across the street from the main pedestrian entrance to Disneyland and the large volume of guests who attempt to use our limited parking for businesses in the area, the parking is strictly enforced in order to ensure we have spaces available for our hotel and Captain Kidd's guests. If we had been contacted immediately upon your entry into our driveway or parking lot, we would have been more than happy to direct you to the proper parking area for the IHOP Restaurant to avoid any parking fees.

Summary: The best hotel option for proximity to Disneyland and for the price.  Only a 5 minute walk to the front gates.  Breakfast options were good. Nice staff, clean rooms, quiet location.  Definitely recommend!

Summary: If you are thinking of taking the Family on a Disney holiday "You cannot get closer to Disney without actually being on their Properties... literally across the street!! Awsome"!!  Get a good start on the Disney day with their buffet breakfast!

Summary: Friendly staff, clean rooms. Best location to Disneyland and full breakfast included. Very pleased with everything at this hotel. Restaurants located within steps to restaurant. Also has a heated pool and hot tub.

Summary Heading: Best Value Near Disneyland You Can Get!
Summary: This hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland. The room we got was quiet and clean. It was also clear the hotel was recently remodeled and cleaned up. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever used at a Best Western. I was very impressed by the value (even at $200 a night) this hotel offered. (Especially since a Disney Hotel is $400-$900 a night)

Summary Heading: Great hotel at a great location for visiting Disneyland
Summary: We had a total of 8 rooms for 18 people for a 5 night vacation to Disneyland.  The staff was great in helping us check-in, have a place for our bags, and helped replace a dead battery in a smoke alarm.  The breakfast was a great way to start our days and the housekeeping was great with our stuff in our rooms.  They even organized our daughters stuffed animals on her bed for her.  We've stayed here before and will be back again.  Location is the best for a visit to the Disneyland parks, literally right across the street.

Summary: The staff were very helpful, breakfast was good, rooms were clean and comfortable, and the location was idea. Mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker make a holiday  more affordable for a family and are appreciated.

Summary: This hotel is so close to Disneyland, you just have to cross the street and your there! The rooms are clean and i loved the decor and set up of the rooms. I stayed here with my family for our Disney trip and i did not want to leave.

Summary: Best Western Plus Park Place Inn and Mini Suites is our "GO TO" hotel when visiting Disneyland.  The location is perfect and the rooms are consistently clean and comfy.  We usually travel with family and the buffet breakfast that is included is always enjoyed by all.

Summary: This hotel is awesome if you just want to park and go.  The parking does have strict guidelines but they can be worth it.   We have stayed here several times and have not had any issues.  They have a great breakfast also.   Will stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Surprisingly Disappointed in Customer Service This Visit
Summary: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel and while all aspects of this hotel and my entire stay was as before (very nice), I could not get a special request granted that was to get the same room # I had on my last visit. I just feel that when a reservation is placed 6 months in advance a special request should be able to be worked out even though the fine print says that special requests are not guaranteed. I have the same request for two rooms that I have reserved for May 2019. I will see what happens. My overall rating is based on my entire visit, but I have to give a terrible rating on service on being non-accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location of visiting Disneyland. Shuttles stop in front of hotel which was another highlight. Nice size rooms with refrigerator and microwave. FREE breakfast helped to keep cost down. Food wasn't too bad either. We'll probably be returning to this hotel for our future Disneyland vacations.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I went here over a Sunday-Tuesday in November. My wife and I drive from the Bay Area in California to Anaheim which is about 6 hours. We arrived at 6am on the day of our check in and were told we could not park in the lot because there was no parking. I drove through the lot and found no less than 20 spots available. I ended up paying $20 to park at the hotel next door for the day which was a lot more convenient anyway. The room was nice just very stuffy and the walls were typically thin. It was a good value for the location but be aware that you will not be able to park before your check in time and you must move your vehicle before 3pm on your check out day or face $25 per hour fee. Very skimpy on parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry the parking restrictions did not meet with your needs.  Check-in time as well as parking is not guaranteed until 3 pm the day of arrival.  We do begin offering parking at 1 pm day of arrival and offer a complimentary 4 hour extension until 3 pm the day of departure.  During your visit our hotel was full as was our parking which is shared with the restaurant guests and staff as well as the hotel staff.  While some spots may have appeared available, those spots were reserved for currently registered guests as well as the restaurant employees and guests, and hotel staff that had yet to arrive.  We sincerely wish we could offer our guests all day parking while visiting Disneyland.  Unfortunately, the large volume of guests wishing this accommodation and our limited parking, does not allow this to be a feasible option.  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us, and if your needs should change, I do hope you will consider staying with us.

Summary Heading: Quiet, and so close to Disney entrance!
Summary: We had a great stay! The room was clean, smelled clean which for my sensitive smeller is a huge bonus! We had a larger room with a pull out sofa. Perfect size for our family. It seems the lay out of the the rooms makes it seem much more quiet as we only had neighbors on one side but love the nice touch by the hotel in placing a “quiet zone” sign at the front of the hotel where rooms begin. Check in was a breeze and they had no problem checking us in much earlier than standard since the room was ready! Love that!   Breakfast was standard but staff was very friendly. We just wish it wasn’t over at Captain Kid’s. That is our only negative. If that even counts haha.   We are devoted Stovall property fans and Park Place is a great property. Ridiculously close to the Disneyland Harbor
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You're just a crosswalk away from the "Happiest Place On Earth".
Summary: This is the closest hotel to Disneyland, that isn't a Disney property.  Clean, affordable, family friendly..Those are just a few of the benefits of staying here. My family has stayed here on many occasions and will stay here many more times. The staff is friendly, helpful and courteous. The rooms are large and comfortable, as are the beds. The restroom is a bit small, but with that said, the shower has good water pressure and the shower head is high enough for me to stand under without having to bend down (I'm 6' 2" tall). Housekeeping does a great job at keeping your room cleaned and vacuumed each day and are very pleasant.  Breakfast daily is not dry cereal, a piece of fruit or bread, it's an actual buffet. Located across from the lobby is the entrance to Captain Kidd's Buffet
Manager Response: none

Summary: By motor hotel (motel) standards, this is a good one. It's great for a family visiting Disneyland as it is DIRECTLY across the street from the entrance plaza. Walk out the door, walk to the crosswalk, cross, walk past the shuttle buses and you are in the Disneyland/California Adventure entrance plaza! The motel itself is clean, service is friendly and efficient. Breakfast is across the driveway at a buffet restaurant; the motel has exclusive use of the upstairs for breakfast buffet. The wifi worked excellently! What would have given it 5 stars: the vending machines actually working, the a/c being more efficient, the breakfast being on site so we could go in our pajamas, the towels being softer. The room was spacious and the beds were comfortable...we all slept like rocks! There

Summary: We booked this hotel based on previous stays and its location directly across the street from Disneyland. Check-in was friendly and quick which was nice after traveling all day. We even received a call from the front desk shortly after getting to our room making sure we had everything we needed...unexpected but greatly appreciated! Room was clean and comfortable. Check-out was a breeze. Already planning to stay here again next year!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent service from start to finish
Summary: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We had a group of 18 ranging from 4 years old to 75 and it suited everyone. The location is perfect, the amenities are good, the breakfast good to fuel a day at the parks. The most amazing thing though is the staff! We arrived well before check in time hoping to just drop our bags but they were able to shuffle a few things and accommodate us straight away. In an amazing act of honesty and kindness, on my last day I had somehow dropped an envelope with a fairly large amount of cash in the trash in the room. I assumed someone else from my group had it and didn't even notice it missing. The lady in charge of cleaning the room turned it in, the hotel manager tried to contact me and finally found me as I was waiting in the lobby. I was so
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved being so close, but it was too noisy to sleep well
Summary: We really loved being so close, but the rooms have walls that are apparently as thin as paper.  We could hear the guests above us turning on their sink, flushing, walking, turning on water etc... People were hard pressed to remember to walk pass the rooms quietly and were routinely woken up from people talking loudly outside our room in the morning (6-7am or late at night).  I wish they had more signage reminding people of the quiet hours.  The room was updated and nicer then expected- the bed was "ok" but after long days walking we slept- the biggest issue was the noise from other guests.  The breakfast was ok- but I couldn't get over all the bad Captain Kidd reviews and all the coughing and sniffling I heard when I walked in there so we didn't eat there as planned.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed recently in standard room. 2 double beds with my daughter 20 and son 10 years old. Very clean modern room. Nice dinner options close by   Reception was crazy busy at check in so patience required. Staff v helpful and held our bags after chk our so we could enjoy another full day at Disney. Will definitely stay again. Cheers b

Summary: The hotel was beautiful,  very comfortable,  large rooms.  My problem was we got the hotel to walk across the street to Disneyland and the day we checked in they were accommodating and let us park the car early when we arrived around 10 am. But the next morning when we wanted to jump up get breakfast and get into the park early they said we had to move the car by 3 or be charged 25$ per hour.  So my husband had to leave us in the park and go back to the hotel and move the car.  Next time I would find another hotel that let's you leave your car.  That was the whole reason we got that hotel.  Next time we'll get a cheaper hotel farther away if we have to drive anyway.  It defeats the purpose.

Summary Heading: The best place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Everything about the hotel was great the staff was amazing the rooms were lovely and is directly across the street from Disneyland.  They also offer a full breakfast and free and dependable Wi-Fi. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary: This hotel is across the street from the maingate of Disneyland, about a 5 minute walk to the park.  Easy to go back and forth from the hotel to the park. This is an excellent hotel and we enjoyed a wonderful stay.

Summary: The rooms have been updated and are really nice.  I love staying here when we go to DisneyLand because its such a short walk to our rooms after spending all day in the parks with young grandchildren who are usually worn out.

Summary: This is a great hotel right across the street from DL. The bed is comfortable and the towels are of good quality. There are a lot of breakfast options. Summary: I’ve stayed at a ton of hotels surrounding Disneyland. This stay was by far the best!!! Location to park, price, emmentities, and the staff made it so magical! I will not be staying anywhere else from here on out.

We would comment that the pool is a little small but adequate for cooling off and a little

Summary Heading: My new favorite hotel in Disney area!
Summary: Totally remodeled rooms. Amazing beds and huge room,  easy gated parking and free buffet breakfast. Wonderful staff. Hotel is right in front of entrance to Disneyland. Loved having area with sofa to relax. Has microwave and refrigerator which was so nice.

Summary: I have always wanted to stay at this hotel to go to Disneyland because it is right across the street. It’s closer to the park than sons of the Disney hotels. Summary: I booked this hotel because Disney property was sold out, and we were ubering for our entire trip. I needed a place within walking distance of the park. Summary: This hotel is right at the entrance of Disneyland, when I say right at the entrance I mean, right at the entrance! No waiting for shuttles or cars to pick you up, you can walk to your hotel at whatever time you want to change or rest, it's very convenient! The rooms are big, clean and comfortable. Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our recent trip to Disneyland and very much enjoyed our stay.  Our room was clean, beds were comfortable, and staff were very helpful and friendly.  The buffet breakfast is amazing!  We enjoyed sausage, scrambled eggs, potatoes, bagels, English muffins, pastries, yogurt, bananas, apples, juice, coffee, and more.  Definitely filled us up for a busy day at Disneyland.  The hotel is located right at the entrance to Disneyland so it is a great location.  We enjoyed our afternoon breaks in the pool.  Will definitely be staying here again!

Summary: The rooms are nice with very comfortable beds.  There is a small pool that a few people use between walks to Disneyland.  Otherwise, it's nothing special.....except....It's Directly Across the Street!  Fast check in, good TV.....I'd skip the breakfast though.  We had it our first day but ate in the park the rest of the mornings.  Breakfast is upstairs in a buffet restaurant next door and it just isn't good.  OK for bagels, cereal, coffee, but the so-called eggs and meats and sweets aren't good.  Still, this is the only hotel I'd consider with children since the location makes it a winner.

Summary: Hotel was right across the street from Disneyland which made it so convenient to take a break and relax. Also the pool and hot tub was clean and well maintained. The free breakfast was great and had many choices of food options!

They did hold on to our luggage for us at least.

Summary: We have stayed at Park Place a number of times over the past 10 years and have always been very satisfied. That's why we keep coming back. Hopefully, we'll be back again in the future. If we are going to Disneyland/California Adventure, Park Place is our preference.
