Summary: We go to Disneyland every year in October and have stayed at all the neighboring motels. This year we decided to get to Disneyland as close as possible. The Best Western Plus Park Inn is literally right across the street from the park - 5 minute walk. The check in was fantastic. We arrived at 2 pm and our room was ready and we were checked in immediately by the super friendly staff. I loved the location of our room - on the ground floor, right by the pool, but also very quiet. The rooms offer a fridge and a microwave. The bathrooms are small, but have better quality shampoos, conditioner, and soaps (better quality than other motels or low budget hotels).  The rooms are a decent size and look like they have been recently updated, however they are a bit too dark and have too much
Manager Response: none

Summary: Truly is the closest place to Disneyland without being a Disney hotel. Rooms are nice, but pack a lunch for the elevators; they are really slow. It was very quiet. The hotel breakfast is pretty much standard. It is on the upper level of the restaurant next door. You might check before-hand if there is an elevator to the breakfast; I only saw stairs. I don't have much price comparison to go by, but for my 4 nights it was just under $1000, including the $10 a night parking.The staff was very nice, check-in was easy, and I would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: BW is so close to Disneyland you could smell the churros 5 min walk to front gate. Very nice receptionist easy check out and you could get late check out until 12pm and stay park In there parking lot until 3pm the day of departure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed here for 4 nights.  The hotel staff were great and the room was clean.  Breakfast was awesome with lots of choices.  The reason for the 4 stars was that we were unfortunate enough to get a room on the bottom floor pretty close to the office (107)  You could hear lots of talking with everybody walking by at night.  I don't think the walls are very insulated.  The first night we could hear every word the people in the room next to us were saying....they had a sick child and we heard him/her coughing all night.  We will probably stay here again, but, ask for an upper floor room.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Just not our kind of place
Summary: We stayed one night prior to flying home from vacation. On a positive note, I can say that the room was clean. Our room was located pretty far in the back. We came in just as it was turning dark and there were no lights on going to our room. Located on the first floor and walking through the parking lot to get there was a bit unnerving. There was a lot of noise throughout the night and the room above us was noisy, sounded like a child running around.  I wish I could say it was better, but I have to be honest. The room had that old motel smell, hard to describe.  The rooms did appear to be refreshed and redecorated but it still did not cover up the fact that it has been around for a while. The amount we paid was way too high for the quality. We have stayed in many other hotels
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking time to write a review. I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us. Please know that if at any time you are uncomfortable in your room, please let us know so we can offer remedies such as a new room in a different location, or asking guests to be courteous to others. I realize you were here for only one night and may not have wanted to bother with a change. However, your comfort is our priority and we would have assisted you however possible.  I do hope if you are in the area, you will give us another chance.  Thank you and take care

Summary: This is our second time staying here. The rooms are clean and a good size with plenty of room to move around without feel ontop of each other.  We love the location to the parks and the staff we met were all friendly. Our only complaint would be the pillows were uncomfortable
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the accommodations as well as the staff.  I do apologize that you did not enjoy the pillows. Please feel free to contact the front desk during your next visit to see if we have pillows that you will find more comfortable. Your comments and compliments are much appreciated and we hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care

Summary: Hotel was just mediocre.  The Paradise Pier is much nicer and similar in price once you pay their parking fees.  Plan on leaving same day you check out.  If not they charge you $25 per HOUR to leave your car there until you leave.  There response was we don’t have enough parking but but there were dozens of empty spaces.  This may be true peak season but not year round.  Stay somewhere else better ways to spend my money.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am sorry the parking did not meet with your needs. We do offer parking beginning at 1 pm the day of arrival and provide a four hour complimentary parking extension until 3 pm the day of departure.  Our hotel is full year round due to our location across from the main entrance of the Disney Resort.  Unfortunately our parking lot is not of sufficient size to accommodate the many multiple requests for extended parking for Disney as well as the registered or arriving hotel guests who are entitled to space. I understand these restrictions did not meet with your needs this trip, but if your travel plans differ during a future visit, I do hope you will consider staying with us again.  Thank you and take care

Summary: The best thing about this motel is the proximity to Disneyland. The free breakfast is quite good with a good variety of items including coffee and juice. It can get busy but that just means fresh items restocked quickly. The dining area is a little small though and we struggled to get a table one morning. Rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day. The rooms however, are dark and the bathroom extremely small. Beds and pillows are comfortable but the sofa bed was very springy, thin and hard.  Staff at front desk were not the most welcoming that I’ve encountered but they get the job done. If you need a safe for your valuables, there is a box you can use behind the front desk. Don’t lose the key or it will cost you dearly (as we were warned). The pool is nothing exciting and
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  I do apologize if the staff was not as welcoming and friendly to your expectations as well our expectations. Please note we have ordered foam toppings for our new sofa beds which should help immensely with the comfort. We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care

Summary Heading: Clean, across the street to Disneyland Resort
Summary: The room was clean, the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was good. We stayed 8 days and had the breakfast each day. There is enough variety so we didn't tire of it. Nice to be so close to park
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the accommodations as well as the breakfast.  Your comments and compliments are greatly appreciated and we hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care

Summary: BW is located directly across the street from the entrance gates to the Disney parks. The room we had was a family room with two double beds and a sofa bed. All beds comfortable and the rooms clean. The rooms come with free breakfast which isn’t amazing but enough to get you through the morning for Disney park. Only issue is the bathroom fan was extremely noisy but nothing to complain to staff about. The staff were friendly and accommodating when needed. Highly recommend for families visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the location and accommodations of the hotel.  We greatly appreciate your comments, compliments, and recommendation.  We hope we will see you again soon.  Thank you and take care

Summary: I've been staying at this place for 5 years now. It's located really close to Disneyland. I've never had a bad time there but this stay was the best yet. I will and have told many people about this place. Now the cats out of the bag lol.
Manager Response: Thank you for making us your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland.  I am very pleased your experience has always been positive and during this trip we exceeded your expectations.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care

Summary: Location is very good across the road from Disneyland but there are other hotels I would look at first people. The staff here are so rude. They don’t even assist with baggage, the front desk staff are so lazy and the cleaning staff are virtually robots. We left a tip for one of the cleaners $5 and she complained it was not enough!!!!!!  Will never return to this place it’s such a dive. Many hotels in the area would be much better.
Manager Response: I am very sorry if you felt any of our staff were rude.  We are a limited service hotel and do not have bell service.  The front desk staff do not leave the front desk in order to be available to guests upon arrival in the lobby and to answer phone calls from guests.  However, if available and assistance is needed we will contact available personnel to assist you with your bags. I would very much like to know which room you occupied so I can speak with the housekeeper.  A tip is not required and  I do know our housekeepers are very appreciative of any that is received.  Please feel free to reach out to me to discuss your concerns regarding our hotel.  I would very much like the opportunity to answer your questions and alleviate any concerns or misunderstandings.  Thank you

Summary: Love this location, great staff and right across from Disneyland very convenient. Nice freshly refreshed rooms, gated parking. I have stayed here multiple times and have yet to have a bad experience here because the staff is always welcoming and makes me feel like family not just a guest.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoy having you stay with us and I am pleased the staff makes you feel like family.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and look forward to your next visit. Thank you and take care

Summary: My family has been staying here every year not only for the convenient location to Disneyland but for the fabulous rooms and suites. We experience excellent customer service with each and every visit..
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoy having you as a guest of the hotel and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  I am very pleased you receive a consistent, enjoyable experience when you stay with us.  We look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This is my hotel of choice when coming to Disneyland. You can't beat the location, crosswalk to Disney is right in front of the hotel. Our room appeared to have recently been remodeled and was very clean and comfortable but I would take my own pillow next time as I like them less firm. Sheets were a little scratchy but towels were fluffy. Gift shop hours is more like gift shop hour and you never knew when it was but the prices were reasonable when we found it open.
Manager Response: Thank you for make us your hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland.  I greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  Please note our gift shop is open every day from 8 am to 130 pm and Monday through Saturday from 330 - 9 pm.  I do apologize a member of the staff was unavailable for a couple of evenings when you were staying with us. We look forward to seeing you during your next visit to Disneyland.  Thank you and take care

Summary: Great hotel right across the road from Disneyland. Rooms are very clean and a decent size with nice comfy beds, free breakfast too. They also have a pool and spa there as well. Staff were very friendly and helpful
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed from Aug 16th to the 23rd. The rooms are updated friendly staff nice pool. Right across from Disneyland. Food was ok they need more different hot food. The same thing everyday sucks. Ihop and dennys close by. Would stay here again but eat at other places. You can't go wrong
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love how close this hotel is to the Parks and the updated suites are really nice for families.  Unfortunately, housekeeping didn't come in the morning and we often returned to the room in the afternoon, so we didn't get any housekeeping for the 4 nights we stayed there.  It wasn't a huge deal, but I do like to have my bed made and the bathroom straightened when I'm staying a hotel.  I will stay there again because of the proximity to the Parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a pleasant stay at this motel with helpful staff available. The hotel was clean and wifi was good. It was close to Disneyland which was convenient. The only thing that I wasn’t happy with was the breakfast .
Manager Response: none

Summary: We love this Best Western. The location is perfect for easy access to Disneyland. The breakfast has variety and the kids enjoy their options. Every stay the staff has been friendly and helpful. On our last stay we had a tire go flat on the stroller and one of the maintenance workers pulled out a compressor and helped inflate the tire.
Manager Response: none

Summary: No better way to go that right outside the gates and for far less than the bigger hotels. Everything was nice and clean and they have a nice hot continental breakfast, not just cold snacks and cereal. Friendly staff. Parking is a little tight but not a bother for all the other niceties. I'd definitely stay here again. So worth not hassling with DL Parking and with a 5 minutes walk from the gates you can change easily change and/or drop things off if need be rather than rent lockers.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had two connecting suites for a family of six, two queen beds and a sofa bed in each.  The rooms were huge!  Housekeeping does an exceptional job keeping things in great shape.  We have stayed at all three Disney Resort hotels and would come back to this place in a heartbeat.  Breakfast was included and very good.  Location cannot be beat.  We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Western Plus PPI - Family Disneyland Trip
Summary: Spent a week at the hotel last week with my family. Our room was right in front of the pool which got pretty loud at times. Hotel convenient right across from the 2 Disneyland parks and downtown Disney. Staff is nice. Breakfast at Captain Kidd's next door is a bonus. Had an issue with my eyeglasses being broken by housekeeping which I didn't report but my fault for not bringing a case. Had a great time with the family and the hotel being across the street saved us a lot of time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just had our family reunion at Disneyland and decided to stay at the Best Western Park Place Inn right across the street from the two amusement parks. With 21 of us heading out the door each morning it was great to start off the day with a good breakfast at Captain Kids Restaurant which was part of staying at the Park Place Inn. Being so close was wonderful as half way through the day when it really got hot, we just went back to the hotel and jumped into the pool. There were several restaurants to choose from for dinner and some not even a block away from the hotel. After refuelling we would all head back to the park, only a 5 minute walk, for more rides and the fireworks. Great Vacation, Great Breakfast, Great Nights Sleep, and all at a great price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Back again on a solo trip to Disneyland.  This is my go to place.  I also have reservations for a month from now for my husband and me, then again for a Christmas trip.  I plan way ahead and always choose this hotel.  The front desk will store your bags on day one if the room isn’t ready.  I always fly in early so I don’t expect a room yet.  I go play and come back to rest in the afternoon and the room is waiting.  Very friendly front desk staff, clean room, good shampoo and conditioner which I like and don’t have to bring from home.  Free breakfast is fine, saves a $50 breakfast at the park!  I usually just get a donut and pastry and be on my way.  Nice cool air conditioner, comfortable sleep, I’ll always stay here if I can.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel looks modern and very clean ! Great staff at check in and even when calling prior. Breakfast is great and has everything you need for adults and kids. Very Very Close to Disneyland ! Make sure to book direct with Best Western to make sure you get what you want and earn points if reward member,
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location to Disneyland can't be beat!  It comes with complimentary breakfast buffet, which is was fine.  nothing special.  We had a room facing the park, and the traffic noise was quite loud and the air conditioner was very loud when it turned on.  We chose this hotel due to its location to the park.  We were able to go back to the hotel mid afternoon to take a break.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Spacious room and so close to Disneyland
Summary: This place is so close to the parks, you basically walk out of the hotel cross the road and you are at the park , Handy at the end of the night for tired little feet and also handy as Dads can take the kids home and mums can check out all the shops and not have to walk to far to get to the hotel room. The rooms are very spacious with lots of room for suitcases and shopping.The breakfast was plentiful and various foods to choose for and filled up our stomach for a day of adventures. From previous reviews we requested a room towards to back of the hotel and the rooms were so quiet and the beds so comfortable , we were on the 3rd floor and had a perfect view of the night time fireworks. Would definitely stay here again and recommend this place
Manager Response: none

Summary: I visited with extended family on this particular trip and this location was perfect.  They moved us to adjoining suites so we were all close together when we arrived, which was very helpful.  The service was amazing, anything we needed we got.  The proximity to Disneyland was incredibly helpful for those of us that were very tired and needed to get back from the park fairly quickly at times for breaks.  The breakfast was very good with lots of hot and cold options, and the rooms were more spacious than most hotel breakfast rooms I have been in.  The suites were kept very clean, not too cluttered with furniture (there is a straight walkway down the middle of the room with no awkward navigating around things), and there is a lot of counter space by the sink.  This is not a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great value for what we paid per night. The location cannot be beat unless you're staying at the Grand Floridian. Even closer to the parks than the Disneyland Resort. Directly across the street you run into the security lines and park entrances.  Stayed three nights. From the moment we arrived, all the way to check out, the staff was great. I can't say enough about the people working at the front desk. I wish I remembered their names. Early in the morning or late at night, they were always pleasant and accommodating with a smile. We had A LOT of luggage and they stored it all for us early in the morning before we checked in so that we could go straight to the parks for rope drop. They arranged transportation to the airport when we left and made sure it arrived on time.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a recent trip to Disneyland and were very happy. The location was perfect (right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland). The breakfast was convenient and had a good selection. Our room was quiet (a previous trip at a different hotel our room faced I-5 and was SO loud we couldn't sleep!), clean, and spacious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with plans to visit Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are always looking for Best Western’s because I feel like they have a great rewards program. I was please to see that this hotel was at THE best location off the park. The room itself was clean, all in working order, had a refrigerator and microwave, however, my bed was not very comfortable. That would be the only negative. It is definitely time for the mattress to be replaced. Otherwise, we had a easy check in, decent “basic” hotel breakfast across the parking lot, and we would definitely stay again. Oh, as far as parking goes, I could see it being difficult, but we found a spot late in the evening (11pm to be exact). They did send an email a few days before directly from the hotel asking if we will be arriving with a vehicle so that they may reserve a parking spot. So maybe
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Reasonable prices hotel walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: My family stayed August 11th to 16th 2018  in a 2 bed queen . The location is convenient being the closest hotel to Disneyland and California adventure parks. Parking was $10 a night and guest are only allowed to park from 11am on arrival day to 3 PM departure day . The included breakfast is at captain kidd's next door at the upstairs section.They have the widest variety of food at any best western I have ever been too...tasty too.Rooms were cleaned on time and although we did not spe.d much time in the small pool it was adequate .I would definitely stay here next time I visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed the proximity to Disneyland! The hotel was super clean and comfortable! We have an 8 year old so it was nice to come and swim and take breaks from Disney which is right across the street ! Also the pool is small but it was never crowded. We have stayed at Disneyland hotel and the difference is of course cost and no room service or drinks at the pool, or Disney decor but you can get that in the park. If you want room service and drinks by the pool this is not that hotel. This hotel is however closer to the front gates of both Disney and California adventure but the lines on this side were long to get through security. I’m sure it’s like that on both sides.  We enjoyed our stay for the fraction of what you pay for Disney Hotel. Thank you it was a great stay!!!! We will
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: So close to the park! But beware of parking situation.
Summary: When they say walking distance, they really mean it! If you’re going to Disneyland, this is a fantastic place to stay! Room was comfortable and staff was friendly. Parking is a little bit of an issue if you have more than one car—my fiancé and I shared a room with another couple who drove separately and they only allow one car per room. Free breakfast buffet was a huge plus!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here with my wife and 3 kids, and it's all about the location, short walk to front gates of both Disney parks, no messing with shuttles or parking. Booked as part of a package through Disney so our tickets were waiting for us on check in. Staff friendly and helpful. When organising transfer to airport it was taken care of no problem. Room was clean and large (2 queen suite). Would highly recommend especially if your spending all day in the parks. Only downside was the included breakfast which was poor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is good, staff were nice and room fairly decent for a BW. Parking is limited, small spaces and only available from 1pm on arrival day. We were given room 102 at the front of the property, ground floor near to reception which was handy for Disney. However on going to bed around midnight we were woken constantly throughout the night by guests arriving to check in. Arrival check in was outside our room, we slept terribly. BW should not put anyone in this room or others nearby. For the cost and what is supposed to be a decent hotel chain I expected more. This is my third BW and last. I'll stick to more reputable chains in future.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us and did not rest comfortably.  If we had been notified of your concerns at any time during your stay, we could definitely have addressed them to ensure you had a comfortable night's rest.  I do hope you do not let this experience negatively effect your perception of all Best Westerns and do hope you will choose to stay with us again. While many of our guests do enjoy the rooms at the front of the property, I do understand it is not the preference for all.  If you wish to stay with us again, please advise our staff of your preferences during the reservation process and we can offer suggestions for room type and location that may meet your needs.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: My family and I stayed here July 24th-July 30th. We got a 2 queen bed suite with a sofa bed. My wife and I ALWAYS check the sheets before laying in them to be sure they are clean/ have no bugs etc. both beds were fine. My wife and I were sharing a room with MIL and my wife’s grandmother but they arrived a day after us.  On our second day (our first Disney day) we headed out early in and while at Disney my MIL and law arrived. But the time she got in the room the beds had already been made she was really tired from the trip so she decided to take a nap as she was undoing the sheets to lay down she saw a big thing of blood on the sheets. When my wife and I got back to the room for a mid day rest my MIL asked my wife if she was on her time of the month My was confused replied no
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to assist you with your concern during your visit.  Please know concerns of this nature are highly unusual and certainly something we take very seriously.  Because the room was a stay over it was necessary to share you concerns with our housekeeping staff to determine any error and make corrections.  And we thank you for allowing us to immediately correct the situation and offer compensation for any interruption in your stay.  Regardless of how the sheet became dirty it is always our goal to handle any situation efficiently and respectfully with our guests.  I hope you will not allow this isolated incident to reflect poorly on Best Western overall.

Summary: I would have overlooked this hotel because I always filter my searches to include hotels with free parking. This was chosen by my Disney travel agent, and I was very pleasantly surprised. Parking is only $10 a night, and the hotel is right across the street from Disneyland. Literally right across the street. And, there are lots of hotels along that road, but this hotel is the closest one to the crosswalk you take to the Disneyland area. We didn't even use our car the whole time we stayed there. The staff is friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast is served at the buffet restaurant next door, so there are lots of choices, and lots of seating. I would stay at this hotel again, and I would recommend it to everyone who is planning to visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were a group of 5 rooms, staying for 2 nights on a CA Adventure and Disneyland trip and had a great stay. Breakfast is served from 6:30 am to 10am every morning upstairs in the building/restaurant next door. The breakfast itself was pretty yummy, ranging from the typical eggs, meats, pastries, fruits, but one day we had waffles, and the next we had french toast sticks which was a fun, and tasty surprise! Nice to know it’s not all the same thing every day. I stayed in the King Suite room with a King bed & pull out couch. Beds are not the best, and the sofa bed, as usual, was not very comfortable. Parking is an extra charge but they give you until 3pm the day you check out to move your car which is great! Everything was very clean, the housekeepers were very friendly and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect Location, less than perfect hotel
Summary: Probably one of the best located hotels you could find but the hotel has quite a bit to improve. Although they claim that the rooms are renovated we found ours to look and feel a bit dingy and worn. Our bathroom extractor fan made a noise of a generator (to be fair we never complained about it, too tired to have maintenance in the evening), the water pressure in the shower was weak  and the tap was wobbly.  On the plus side the fridge and microwave were good, the breakfasts were good and having parking @ $10 a day was useful (although finding parking late in the day can be problematic.  We had an issue with checkout time that Kelly, the Assistant Manager put down to a misunderstanding which I accept.  All in all you'll be too pooped after a day in the parks to need more than the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Best Western Plus Park Place Inn for (3) nights with our family while taking in Disneyland. Could not ask for a closer place to stay. Excellent rooms, excellent morning breakfast buffet with all the normal items plus a lot more. Rooms were large & quiet and the beds were very comfortable. Excellent  for families on vacation.  .
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent locations makes up for flaws
Summary: Been here twice and although there are better hotels near the park, this one has a location that just can’t be beat. Literally across the street. That alone is worth it to me. Aside from that, the hotel is clean and spacious enough to fit all your kids and shoes and luggage and shopping bags. I love that there is a fridge and microwave. There are also drawers for clothes. The breakfast is decent. And I personally like the waffle towels.   Down side: sheets are crazy scratchy. Bed is squeaky, like it has a mattress cover that squeaks. The supplied shampoo and conditioner is useless. Seriously, they don’t work. And the room itself is noisy. The fridge is loud. The air is loud.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is clean, the staff is professional and courteous, the rooms are comfortable, free breakfast is offered, and the location is ideal for anyone going to Disneyland. We had no complaints with this choice!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything about our stay was awesome.  Parking.  Right across the street from Disneyland.  The room service.  Loved the beds and pillows.  The breakfast was great.  Our family was very happy with our stay and will want to stay again.  Next time we will try to get a unit down stairs.  Stairs are hard on our Dad.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay at our hotel including the location and the service provided.  We look forward to a future visit from you and your family.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Fantastic location! It's right across the street from Disneyland. The rooms are updated, clean, and a good size. The complimentary breakfast buffet was great. There was a good variety of food to choose from. It had fresh fruit, pancakes, eggs, bagels, toast, coffee, orange juice, milk, cereal, yogurt and more. The only reason I would not give them a five is due to the small pool.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location was most excellent! Across the street and a few minutes walk, you’re at the security checkpoint for the Disney parks. Beds were comfortable. Breakfast potatoes were a bit dry and salty but the breakfast was good overall. I would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We choose this hotel because of how close to Disneyland it is.  What we realized was that the rooms were clean and a very good size for a family of four.  Plus they are alternative dinning option within walking distance of our room.  I would definitely stay there again if we go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for three nights with my two sons, got adjoining rooms, and we were all happy with the experience. The staff was extra great, the location couldn't be beat, and our rooms were clean, comfortable, spacious, and affordable. Ok, there was a rattling air conditioner in one of the rooms, and the free breakfast (offered next door with vouchers) was pretty gross, but I'm not going to dock points for those issues. I'd definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When: June 2018 Why:  Going to Disneyland for a few days Pros: This hotel is a fantastic location for a Disneyland visit.  The hotel is right across from Disneyland and actually closer to the entrance of Disneyland than the Disneyland hotel.   The rooms are comfortable and a good size for 2 people.  The price includes a breakfast which is served upstairs next door and is plentiful, and good quality.   Cons: Parking is an extra cost, but all local hotels are the same.  The WiFi is weaker towards the rear of the hotel. Tip/Comment: Ask for a room on the bottom floor (which is floor 1) and closer to the front of the hotel.  Try and park close to your room, the pathways around the hotel are not wide and you will need to roll your bags through the car park from and to your car.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've lost count now how many times we've stayed at this Best Western.  It's always our first choice of hotels when visiting Disney.  As annual pass holders to Disney, we probably visit the park at least 5 times annually .  The location is perfect, right across the street from the parks and close to a few other restaurants such as IHop.  The hotel is clean and the rooms are large.  The mini fridge and microwave are super helpful.  The bed is as comfortable or more comfortable than some higher end resorts.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  There is a breakfast included every morning and it boasts quite an assortment of food.  Hot items, such as eggs, ham, pancakes and cold items that include bagels, cereal and whole fruit are always offered.  This Best Western is a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay, especially if going to disneyland, but even so because restaurants all within walking distance.  I've stayed 2 different times so far and planning a 3rd stay the end of the year, 2018
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have just spent 6 nights at this hotel for Disney trip. Location is fantastic short walk across to Disney, this was great as we came back for lunch and a swim during the really hot middle part of the day. We would then head back over for an evening at the parks. Staff were friendly and room was clean. Breakfast was good with enough choices to keep family happy. Our only issue was the size of the "queen" beds which were tiny. Apart from that we had a good time here.

Summary: Stayed for 6 nights during a visit to Disneyland, and the location was perfect! After a long day in the park it was lovey to just walk across the street and into our room. The room was clean and good in size. Nice to have free breakfast included. Also very convenient that the Disneyland Resort Express to/from the airport stops right outside the hotel. Will stay here again!

Summary Heading: ABOUT AS CLOSE AS YOU CAN GET TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: We stayed here with our children and grandchildren for 5 nights. We really wanted to be as close to Disneyland as possible, so we could spend most of our time there and not have to travel any distance before and after. This hotel worked perfectly for us. It is quite literally straight across the street from the entrance to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, and California Adventure Park.   The rooms were spacious and perfectly clean, the beds comfortable the air-conditioning cold, (essential as we were there for the heatwave). Parking was onsite, and free breakfast was right next door at Captain Kidds Buffet.   It's an 'American Breakfast' so includes ham, eggs, meat patties, fruit, cereal, just about everything you could wish for.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel before and they have upgraded there rooms since we have been there they are nice. I just have to one thing to say to noisy people banging up above you but other then that its great hotel staff in friendly and caring understanding and if you have a problem they get it fixed fast.  we will stay here again

Summary: Excellent service from check in to check out!  Room was very clean and comfy!  Housekeeper was sweet and arranged kids' stuffed animals so they were excited to find them after being gone all day.   Perfect location for visiting Disney... super convenient!

Summary: This hotel is across the street from Disney, is close to lots of restaurants and shops (including the all important CVS!), and you can watch the nightly fireworks. The rooms are clean and modern, the internet is fast, and the breakfast is wonderful. We’d stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great price, clean rooms and close to the parks

That's not necessary here since there are many hotels nearby and all within walking distance.  You can save quite a bit of money on lodging if you are ones to rarely use the pool and spend most of your time in the parks like we do.  The difference in price for our trip was a savings of $1,500+ compared to the lowest priced Disney hotel.  The room we had was a great size and updated and had two queen beds, as well as a couch.. We also had a microwave and mini fridge, which was great.  We usually walked next door to a convenience store to purchase water and

Summary: This hotel is the perfect stop for a Disneyland trip! We would leave in the middle of the day and come back and take a break in the hotel and then head back in the early evening. It was nice being able to just walk across the street!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Choice for Disneyland Stay
Summary: Between the convenient location to Disneyland, the friendly staff, the decor, comfort and cleanliness of the room, I would stay here again in a heartbeat and I would highly recommend this hotel! It only took 5 minutes to walk to the parks, if that, and no more than 10 minutes to Downtown Disney. And, I felt safe walking alone because all I had to do was walk across one street and I was on the grounds of Disneyland the entire time. Fantastic stay!!!

Summary: This was our second trip to Disneyland where we chose to stay at the Best Western.  It is so close to the entrance, and it was nice to see the rooms upgraded!  My only complaint would be that the hide-a-bed mattress was very uncomfortable!!  Breakfast was great until the last day we were there. A lot of the food was not being replaced even though there were still many people in the room waiting to eat.  Housekeeping was very accommodating, as several mornings we did not leave the room in time to get it cleaned and towels replaced.  The front desk helped out with replacement keys when we locked ourselves out of the room, and also helped to get us a shuttle to the airport on our last day. We will be back on our next trip!

Summary Heading: right across the street from Disneyland

Summary Heading: Great updated room next to the park
Summary: The real reason we stay here is the distance. At the end of the day, no one wants to walk any farther and we are glad it is so close. It is close enough to take a quick break or run back for something forgotten. If we can’t stay at the resort, we stay here. I was glad to see an updated room with new tile in the bathroom. The sink is outside the bathroom, which is nice for getting ready. The beds are comfortable (except the sofa bed), pillows and towels are nice, and is always clean. We stayed six nights on a recent visit and check in and office staff were kind and accommodating. Breakfast is ok, not great, but has quite a few options, especially the breakfast sandwich you can take with you. This is a great place to stay if you can’t stay onsite.

The only thing I wish was different was that the beds had softer sheets.

Summary Heading: Trading off great location for not-so-great hotel
Summary: This hotel is basically an old motor lodge. We had a mini-suite which was quite large with a tiny bathroom. The fan in the bathroom sounded like a jet engine. The free breakfast buffet at the hotel across the parking lot was awful.  BUT... it's literally across the street from the entrances to the two Disney parks. After a long day of standing and walking, the short commute home was great.  I honestly can't say that I would recommend this hotel if it was located anywhere else. But it might be worth it to you for the location.

Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review. As a courtesy we do allow guests to begin parking at 1 pm the day of arrival and remain in the lot until 3:00 pm the day of departure. I am very sorry these restrictions did not meet with your needs. Summary: There is a major flaw in the operation of this hotel. Families don’t show up to Disneyland at 2 in the afternoon. Therefore visiting Disneyland becomes ALL about, of all things, parking.  We chose the Best Western Plus Park Place Mini Suites for this very same reason. To be close enough to get to the gates first thing in the morning and, of course, the advantage of parking close. We were vigilant in our research of the parking advantage and have never encountered a hotel at Disneyland, especially one across the street, that didn't offer parking.  But parking is not allowed at this particular location until 1pm on the day customers are
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your comments and concerns.  Unfortunately our parking lot is only of sufficient size to house our current hotel guests.  Due to our location directly across from Disneyland, there is a high volume of requests for parking. Due to limited availability and to ensure all guests entitled to parking receive the same accessibility to our parking, restrictions are required. Check-in at our hotel is at 3:00 pm and departure is at 11 am. We do provide parking to our hotel guests beginning at 1 pm the day of arrival with an additional 4 hours of complimentary parking until 3 pm the day of departure.  After 3:00 pm we need to ensure we have availability for our arriving and currently registered guests.  Unfortunately due to the high volume and demand of the area and limited public parking options available, reliable opportunities for overflow parking do not exist. Our guests are guaranteed parking while a registered guest at our hotel.  In the interest of best customer service practices, we avoid creating circumstances which would require our registered guests, who are entitled to a parking space onsite, to have to find parking offsite in order to accommodate those who wish to be in our parking lot while a guest of Disneyland. I am pleased to hear you were able to find a neighboring hotel that was able to accommodate you during this visit. While I do understand the disappointment this may present for some visitors to the area, we do need to consider all guests of the hotel and ensure we are providing the same opportunity and accessibility to our facilities. Disneyland does provide parking for their guests and there is a parking structure about a 15 minute walk that does have hourly parking and is able at times to provide overnight parking at $24/day based upon availability.  I am very sorry this resulted in a negative experience during your visit, but do hope the explanation does provide you with a better understanding of our attempts to best accommodate and provide the same courtesies to all of our guests.

Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry the carpet was dirty in your room. Summary Heading: Great property but the breakfast experience is reliably lacking.

Seating is often scarce.  They weirdly pull out their trash can and have it sitting out in the open as you exit the room which is only stair accessible.  Decor needs some help, why they don't put up a few Disney prints for guests to enjoy I have no idea these details would change the feeling in the room to busy from harried, but they haven't changed a thing since my last review.

There's the bed and then a couch and sofa chairs. The bathroom is slightly roomier then other hotels as well. The lighting above the exterior bathroom sink is much better than the other Best Western a few blocks down. Breakfast is offered through the restaurant next door. It's a full hot spread buffet style offering. Summary: Convenient to Disneyland and nearby restaurants. Room clean and good service. Black-out blinds kept the bright light out. Staff very helpful. No in-room safe, but lock-box in lobby worked perfectly. Bedding clean but scratchy and stiff. Coffee maker too small for 4 adults. Breakfast was satisfactory, good selection, good coffee, but skip the orange juice. Didn't use pool. We'll definitely stay again, but will ask for softer bedding. We will recommend to friends.

Summary: I really hate giving some an average rating but this is what the hotel was. It wasn't amazing and it wasn't horrible. The location is what makes the property. It was clean enough for me and my family. The breakfast was nice to have included but it was not quality food. My kids were totally fine with it so that's all that mattered to us in the end. Would I stay there again? Probably. We've stayed at several other hotels along the street in front of Disneyland and there are definitely nicer options.

Summary: I just concluded a seven-night stay.  Our room was near the front of the property, and there was a good deal of noise from traffic on the street and people passing by our room.  On the day I was leaving, I requested two additional hours of parking to accommodate the time of my flight out of town.  After dealing with a discourteous front desk worker and a manager, my request was denied, which I felt was poor customer service.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry you felt we were discourteous in being unable to meet your request at the time it was made. When considering requests I do have to ensure that all guests are being provided the same courtesy and consideration for the use of the amenities and facilities of the hotel. We have very limited parking. As explained when the request was made, we provide a four hour complimentary extension until 3:00 pm day the day of check out knowing many guests do enjoy the extra time. However we do ask our guests to leave by 3:00 pm to make room for our arriving guests. An additional 2 hours added to the four hour complimentary extension would then be infringing on the parking availability for our current guests and our incoming guests (who are guaranteed a spot at 3:00 pm). While given certain situations, exceptions may be made on the day of check out.  However, as mentioned, I could not provide an answer for the availability on the preceding day.  I do hope you enjoyed your visit to the area and I am very sorry it ended on a negative note.

Summary: This is our fourth year staying at the Best Western Park Place Inn for our annual trip to Disneyland with our family group of 9. We love the proximity to the park. The walk to and from the park is shorter and easier that the walk from the park to one of the Disney hotels. The rooms all have mini-fridges, microwaves, and coffee makers. The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly. The hotel is so close to the park that it makes it easy to bring the kids back for an afternoon rest break and swim before walking back to the park for the evening. We know we will have a place to park our cars. There are quite a few kid friendly restaurant choices within walking distance of the hotel for times we didn't feel like eating in the park.

Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review. I am truly sorry to hear that these restrictions did not fit your travel needs, however it may be helpful to know that there is always available parking at the nearby Disney parking lot as well as a nearby parking structure located a short walk from the hotel. They placed the handicap accessible room on the 3rd floor in the room the furthest possible from the elevator. When mentioning the poor choice of location for a handicap room to the front desk she told me the placement was to make sure we were by the STAIRS...  keep in mind I am standing there with my walker obviously upset after having gone to my room and the key not working and then having to walk clear back to the elevator then all the way
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with us, they are extremely helpful in allowing us to understand how we may better serve our guests going forward.  Please know that although you had reserved the semi handicap room we do also offer fully accessible rooms on our ground floor near the lobby.  With this in mind, I hope that you will give us a second chance to host you as our guest.  Please accept our offer of a 15% discount on your next visit with us.  Your comments have been duly noted and considered.

The decor, the entire room is sooo amazing! All I said when I walked in was WOW! I mean I felt like I was at a brand new hotel. Best western you out did yourself! The hotel itself is amazing and so is the staff. And the location is ridiculously so close to theme parks. This is why we stay here over and over again!!

Clean and spacious rooms and comfy beds - but definitely dated and on the dark side. Breakfast was included and this dining room has been updated. Coin laundry was on site and they also have a basic convenience/souvenir shop. We didn't use any of the other facilities. Staff were very friendly and helpful, they arranged a lovely driver to take us to Anaheim station when we departed. Great value for money!

Summary Heading: Be aware! Cannot park at the motel until 1 PM !!
Summary: This motel is decent, consistent with Best Western quality.  Location is perfect, directly across the street from Disneyland.  HOWEVER... be aware that their policy has changed and they no longer allow you to park at the motel in the morning of the day of arrival. Parking is not available until 1 PM.  If you plan to be at Disneyland to enjoy the park in the morning, you will have to park about a mile away at the Disneyland parking lot (at a rate of $20) and shuttle to Disneyland, then move your vehicle to the motel parking lot after 1 PM (for $10 more).  Sadly for us this is a deal breaker for future stays at this motel.  Note that neighboring motels (like the Tropicana Inn) do allow you to park your vehicle in the morning when staying at their property, saving the inconvenience
Manager Response: The parking policy has been in place for several years.  However we found by being lenient, the sheer volume of guests wishing to park early in the morning prior to check in, was taking away parking from our current in-house guests to whom we must give first consideration for parking.  This necessitated the enforcement of the parking restrictions.  Unfortunately our parking lot is just not large enough to accommodate the volume of guests who like to arrive early for a day at Disneyland and stay late after check out.  I am truly sorry these restrictions are not in line with your needs your needs.  I do appreciate your comments and compliments.  If your needs change, I hope you will again consider us during your visit to the Disneyland Resort Area

Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I do apologize for any misunderstanding. At check, payment is required in full and credit card or cash is accepted. I am sorry there was a fluctuation in the Canadian Exchange rate while you were staying with us.  Unfortunately you would need to contact your credit institution for any compensation as we cannot be responsible for the fluctuations.  As requested we did issue a credit for the amount charged at check in when we received your cash payment at check out. Summary: We arrived at 9am, we cannot at least park our vehicle, and we have to park at Downtown Disney for 2 hours. I pre-register that time and came back to the hotel at 11am where we were able to park the car. No room available for us. We walked around Disney, and at around 1pm, I called the hotel and I was advised that there were no room available still until around 2pm. We decided to head back to the hotel and sit at the lobby hoping they would get the hint. My husband talked to the manager at 2pm, (as they checked in at least 2 groups already) and told my husband that our room will not be ready by now 3pm. Very disappointing. To top our awesome experience, we were placed on 1st floor, pool on one side, laundrymat on the other side and ice machine across from our room.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.   Unfortunately, due to the popularity of our location and its convenience to Disneyland we have found that many of our guests prefer to arrive early and stay late creating a necessity for parking restrictions, for the convenience of all guests. As always parking is guaranteed upon arrival at 3:00 pm through 3:00 pm date of departure. However, when available we can offer parking as early as 1:00 pm.  Rooms are guaranteed to be ready at 3 pm.  I do understand you witnessed other guests being checked in.  The guests you observed receiving keys were in a different room type from what you had reserved and we had some of those rooms ready.  I am truly sorry that restrictions during your stay were not conducive with your needs.  I do hope your experience will not reflect on Best Western as a whole and will continue to use Best Western for your travel needs.  Thank you and take care.

With a park hopper ticket you can easily come back and rest or swim in the pool then return to the park refreshed .  Book early, and I mean months ahead and you will not be disappointed.  They offer a breakfast in the restaurant just next door.  I love this place.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and sharing why people should book here first.  It was wonderful to read that you enjoyed the upgrades to the rooms.  I hope you had fun at  spring training.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We have stayed here several times it is our go to hotel while we go to Disneyland it's location is worth the cost of the room and with the new updates it's even better reveille not stay anywhere else while in Southern California
Manager Response: Thank you for making us your go to hotel while visiting Disneyland.  It was wonderful to read that you enjoyed the new updates.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care

Summary: This hotel is as close to Disneyland as you can get without staying on Disney property. It is right across the street from the entrance. The free breakfast buffet was also a big hit with our family. The rooms were clean and reasonably priced.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the location and breakfast.  Your comments and compliments are greatly appreciated and we hope to see you again.  Thank you and take care

Summary: My family and I have stayed at this hotel at least twice a year for the past 4 years, in not more, this location has the best walking distance you can get! The biggest downfall is their newest policy about not being able to use the parking lot prior to check-in. This is the first stay, out of all our visits, when we arrive at 8 am, as usual, to visit Disneyland that the check-in staff would not allow us to park on their property prior to 1pm. Even though we completed our check-in paper work to check in at 3 pm they would not give us a parking pass to park, they made us drive and park in the Disneyland parking structure and then return at 3 pm to be able to park on the hotel property. It was the worst customer service by the check-in staff I have ever received. So beware that if
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visits to Disneyland.  We do greatly appreciate our repeat guests.  I am sorry that the parking was not ideal for your visit.  Unfortunately, our parking is very limited and we did have to make changes to ensure all of our guests have a parking space available while they are a registered guest.  We truly would like to be able to accommodate vehicles while our guests are enjoying their time at Disneyland.  However, due to our location and the volume of guests trying to park for Disneyland we do have to restrict parking to 1 pm the day of arrival and 3 pm the day of departure.  I do hope this will not prevent you from staying with us again and that we will see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel twice in our last Disney visits and it doesn't disappoint. Close to the Park, a decent value, free breakfast, and the hotel is well run and kept up. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms with 2 queens are just right for four people. I especially liked the bed firmness; slept well. We did have noisy neighbors above us, but he staff took care of that for us. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the breakfast, location, accommodations, and hotel staff. Thank you for giving us the opportunity to correct the situation with the noisy neighbors above you.  Your comments and compliments are greatly appreciated and we look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: First, this place is right on the crosswalk to get to Disneyland. It doesn't get any closer.   The rest: the beds are firm, which is ok. But the pillows are huge and don't give. It's like a log wrapped in paper towels. A selection of pillows would be nice. Maybe a few thin pillows in the mix???  The room has lots of space and lots of mirrors which is good for families of plus4. But the overall impression is that it's very motel-ish. Nothing fancy like a Courtyard. And I'm usually not big into fancy, but the motel feel is tough to swallow for 3+nights.And you will pay for parking somewhere in the $teens.   As for the food, I was worried since it's on the top floor of Captain Kidd's. And we all know how they're reviewed. But this breakfast was pretty good. Lots of decent
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  Thank you for sharing what you liked and what would have improved your stay.  We will use your comments to improve our offerings to our guests.  We are currently remodeling all of our rooms and will be making additional improvements this year.  We do hope you will come and see us again soon to enjoy the improvements we are currently making for our guests.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Wanted to stay near Disneyland to take my grandkids . They had lots of fun , it was there first time going. The room was just right clean, had a good breakfast, and it was walking distance to Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay and I hope the grand kids had a unforgettable first visit to Disneyland.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope we will see you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel March 5 - 9, 2017.  It was a spacious room, two beds and a pull out couch.  The lighting was not great but manageable, there were two lights in the bathroom in which I wished one of them did not have the fan attached (too much noise for my liking when giving my 2 year old a bath). There are some complaints about the breakfast that is included that I've read, however, in my opinion it was great, lots of choice, cereal, bread, English muffins and bagels to toast, fruit, hot items, the pancakes were not fluffy, that was my only complaint but there were so many more options, I ended up making a sausage, egg and toasted English muffin every morning (swapping for ham every second day).    I'd definitely go back, it's cross the street to the Disneyland entrance,
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  Thank you for sharing what made us a great hotel.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the accommodations, breakfast, and location of our hotel.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Best access good for small kids pullout sofa only
Summary: Loved renting scooter from soaring when this lobby was sold out of scooters. I was able charge it in lobby over night. Completely new remodeled, it's not perfect however it was way better for sa me price hotel I paid down the street, we just had to walk across the street to disneyland. If the price I'd $129 -I would stay again. Parking is limited to one per room.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  We do hope you will stay with us again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Recommended to Anyone, It is Great!
Summary: From the Room to the Service to the Location It Is Fabulous, I would stay at all times. The staff is Very Friendly and informative. I enjoyed EVERYTHING about this stay. I think the staff deserves a raise. I like the fact that I could print out my air services. The little gift shop also has many items at a good price. The pool and hot tub was very clean and nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fantastic hotel. You couldn't want closer. Its across the street... no really it is.   Big rooms very clean, comfy big beds, spacious bathroom, spotlessly clean, but small towels, but plenty of them. Shower knob felt loose so had them check it the next day and was fixed.   Great free WiFi, great location, opposite Disneyland main entrance, next door to IHOP, Denny and other shops and restaurants.   Included in the room a coffee machine, a full size fridge, plenty of plug points and even USB charging at different places in the room.  Seating area, and housekeeping changed towels daily even if you didn't want them too
Manager Response: none

Summary: If this hotel were located anywhere else, I'd rate it a 3 but since the whole point of staying here is it's location to Disney, it gets a bump to a 4.  It is THE closest hotel if you want to walk to Disneyland - straight across the street from the Disney entrance. Other pluses are inexpensive parking ($10/day), free breakfast and a room with a microwave, coffee maker and fridge.  We got one of the newly renovated rooms and it was very nicely decorated and had everything we needed.  It's a great location if you just want to sleep after having a full day at Disneyland.  That said, it still isn't a place at which I'd want to spend a lot of time otherwise.  The room is very long and narrow, with one window at the end where the door is.  This makes for a dark room and it always felt
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our hotel room was remodeled, as well as the rest of the facility.  They have done a very nice job updating this hotel and it was a tremendously good value for the price.  The breakfast offered many choices to choose from and the distance to Disneyland main gate is the best part of the experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are not looking for a luxury 4* hotel, I would say this is a basic hotel to go for if visiting Disneyland. There is no fuss at all cause it's about less than 10 mins walk from our room to the Disneyland entrance with two kids age 5 and 7. The best part is that when you are done for the day, you are back to your room before anyone else. It was so convenient that we decided to skip the busy crowd at the resort during busy Saturday afternoon to recharge and went back to the park in the evening.    The room itself has all the basic amenities, not high quality but good enough to serve their purpose. We stay in a one king size bedroom with a sofa bed. Quality of the king size bed is fine, but the sofa bed is more on the soft side. There are microwave and fridge in the room. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location of this hotel is absolutely incredible being right across from Disneyland. The continental breakfast is perfect and makes it very affordable especially for families. The quality of the rooms is awesome especially having a microwave and fridge. I would definitely recommend staying at the Best Western Park Place!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was pleased with our room and overall stay. I had requested the top floor(3rd) and even though we arrived at 8:30 pm was happy to know they accommodated us, they are renovating the other rooms currently but that never affected our stay or sleep-comfy beds, clean room, and quiet- could not have been closer to the park, love that we didn't have to walk any farther or past bus stops etc-we will stay again
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location of this hotel was amazing and the value was exceptional. We almost stayed at a Disney resort and I am so glad we didn't. We were closer to the parks, breakfast was included and it was considerably cheaper. The staff was friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Even though we encounter an issue the GM Carol was very accommodating and resolved any problems we had! We will definitely be back on our next trip to Disneyland! Great location, can't wait til all the rooms are finished renovations in April!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disneyland and convention center
Summary: Stayed for a conference.  Breakfast was great!  It is nice to have a full hot breakfast before a conference. Disneyland entrance is right across the street which if I was going would be ideal.  Staff was courteous.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a ground floor room newly renovated.   It was nice. Annoying that tea and coffee facilities are basic, no cutlery, no kettle, just a coffee brewer that is no better than instant coffee.  There's a microwave but no plates?  Huh, is this a US thing?  Breakfast was provided next door above an all you can eat buffet.  Our driver recommended us not eat there as previous guests were sick.  We gave it a go as we had already paid for it.  The paper plates and plastic cutlery gave away the quality.    The staff were really pleasant to deal with. Location is great for Disneyland, right opposite the entrance.   Would i stay again? Yes if going to Disneyland, but would be more self sufficient.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our FAVORITE "good Neighbor" hotel, to stay at when we can when we visit Disneyland! It is a bit pricey, and they DO sell out quickly, but its worth it!! They have Cheap parking ($10/night), FREE breakfast, Not the "best" but it is good and saves you a little money so you don't have to eat right away in the Park... VERY clean, and FRIENDLY Staff, to us that is important! We love the fact you Literally walk out of your room, cross the street and boom, you are there at the park!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Cant say enough great things about this hotel!!! Amazing location to the park.It was so nice not to have to walk forever after a long day at the park. Breakfast was fabulous and had a variety of options to have for breakfast. Rooms were good as well. We stayed in a room that hasn't been redone as of yet but it was still a great room. Friends of ours were in the renovated rooms and they looked fabulous as well! Hot tub and pool were nice, only thing is we wished the hot tub was open a little bit later so we could enjoy some relaxing after a long day at the park but other than that an amazing stay! We will definitely stay at this hotel again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were outdated, had bad smell, sticky gross things on table surfaces, wifi didn't work on 1st floor, toilets had issues flushing, but breakfast was included and Disney was right across the street
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry you did not fully enjoy your stay.  We are currently remodeling all of our rooms and should be completed by the first week of May.  I hope you will come back and stay with us again and enjoy all the improvements we have made to our hotel.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Your credit card machine always asks for pin -  only hotel ever to ask - itvis credit card. Other staff at this hotel have work around. Antonio refused to find out how to fixI stayed at a Hilton instead.
Manager Response: I am very sorry you were unable to stay with us.   I would like to address your concerns but unfortunately I do not understand the issue.  Our credit card machine does not ask for a pin.  I would like to understand what your concerns are so I can full address the issues.  Please feel free to contact the hotel and speak with any management.  Thank you and take care

Summary: Perfect hotel...right across from park. Room was clean and comfortable....nothing fancy but fancy wasn't needed....perfect for people who need a place to crash after a long day at the park. Truly a great place for the price and location. Staff was helpful and very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here before and it was dirty then, we were told thy would be renovating then. ( 2015) so it's an excuse . Read other reviews !!! My daughter coughed the whole night , and broke out in a skin rash. ( she does not have sensitive skin!!!) We went to the doctor and got an epi pen just incase.  We bought baby laundry soap and washed the hotel bedding and towels she used .  I started to cough by day 4. We only coughed in the room and her rash was bad when she would wake up.  The carpet is so filthy here ,but I can overlook this , however the top of the couch had 1/4 inch of grime and dust and the furniture was so sticky ??? When u would put anything down on it it would stick like glue ?? Almost like the varnish was wet but it wasn't .  It's not the managers fault!!!!!
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for allowing me to assist you during your stay.  Unfortunately since we began remodeling our rooms on January 31st, not all rooms are available.  We do strive to meet all of our guests’ requests because we do want all of our guests to enjoy their time at our hotel.  If we are unable to fully satisfy the request we do offer alternatives. It was my pleasure to assist you with your concerns throughout your stay and to help rectify any misunderstandings . I am again very sorry for any miscommunication on what services were required for your room and I am very happy I was able to help you rectify that situation and provide you with 1000 bonus points.  After the servicing issue was corrected and I was next notified of your daughter’s rash which you believed was caused by the bleach used to clean the sheets, it was my pleasure to further assist you in making additional adjustments to the servicing of your room. When I was made aware on the day of departure of your full 8 night stay that you were still not fully satisfied with your room, it was my pleasure to offer and provide you with 50% off your last night. I do hope your daughter is feeling much better and that you enjoyed all your activities during your visit to the area. Thank you and take care.

Summary: The suite was nicely furnished, King size bed and sofa sleeper.  The hotel had a hot breakfast available. It is directly across street from entrance to Disney parks!!  Hotel check in a breeze. Nice staff. If going to area, this would be a #1 pick for us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel has the prime position for visiting Disneyland, straight across the road 50metres. The hotel staff were always very helpful and courteous, we had a room on the bottom floor right down the end (well away from road noise). although the room was a bit dated, all you wanted to do when you got back was have a shower and sleep. several good food places quite close that wont break the bank (IHOP, DENNYS)
Manager Response: none

Summary: What genius would build a 190+ room hotel with 140 parking spots? Guess how that works! Get there early and don't move your car or you will be one of the lucky ones that have to park 6 blocks away and pay the extra $25 a day at the nearest public parking structure.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I did notice the opportunity to park one car here was provided as advertised.  Our policy of offering nearby parking for additional vehicles was offered.  However, I am sorry it was not conducive to your situation. Due to the popularity of this location we are required to restrict the parking to one vehicle per room.  Thank you and take care.l

Summary: The main reason for selecting this hotel is a person can leave their car at the hotel and not be concerned with parking as the main entrance is a short walk across the street.  The breakfast is another plus.  An excellent continental breakfast is served which included eggs and sausage as well.  We have stayed here during previous visits and will probably return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent value and hotel experience. Hotel is being renovated so within a year it will be like a new hotel. The location is excellent right across the street from Disneyland so the walk is less than 5 minutes to the main entrance.

Summary Heading: Serif excellent, rooms old and dated
Summary: Room seemed very dark and dated but staff was very helpful and we had no issues at all. The breakfast that was included was disappointing as the eggs were performed and rubbery and it was generally bland food.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was just OK, but the location was GREAT!  We have stayed at LOTS of hotels while at Disney, and this one is easily the closest to the front gate of the park (great if you have young children, or old grandparents). After walking 12 miles one day (we checked) it was sooo nice to be able to walk right across the street and be back in our room. The room, on the other hand...meh. The bedding was absolutely awful...thin blankets and both blankets and sheets were very rough and scratchy. The room decor definitely needs updating (I think they are just getting ready to refurb, so that will be good), and our air conditioning/heater unit didn't seem to really work. The free breakfast next door was the same every morning, but the breakfast room was large and food was presented
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been here a few times and haven't been disappointed at any time. It is a wonderful alternative to staying on Disney property. More affordable with lots of amenities that can be found on their website. Located right across the street from the resort with a friendly staff and free breakfast makes this a place we will continue to stay at in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights - family of 4 (2 Teenagers). Check-in was fairly quick & painless. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had 2 queen beds & a sleeper sofa. There was tea/coffee making facility & a small fridge.  They have breakfast available for free at the restaurant next door. Nothing fancy but enough choice for everyone- scrambled eggs, sausage, muffins & other pastries, toast (make your own), cereal, fruit. The hotel is directly across the road from the Disneyland entrance. Very convenient. There are a variety of restaurants/fast food places nearby. We were able to leave our luggage with them when we checked out, while we spent our last afternoon at Disneyland.

Summary: As convenient to Disneyland as you can get. Rooms are completely up to date, but very clean and functional. Breakfast had a great variety and everything was prepared appropriately. Would highly recommend this for family trips to Disneyland.

Summary: Excelent excelent location.  Few steps for the park.  Good room not tied.  Need modernization.  Good bathroom. Parking paid $10 per daybut good. Breakfast few options but goid and good service.   I would return.

Summary: Perfect location! The hotel is right across from Disneyland. The rooms are clean and the price is good for the location. I have been to this hotel many times and will be a return guest for many years. The only thing that was not good is the sleeper sofa bed was uncomfortable for my daughter. I just know next time to get the room with 2 queens.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pretty good place to stay for Disneyland vacation
Summary: The location couldn't be better for a Disneyland vacation. We stayed six nights. The beds were pretty comfortable. The staff did a great job cleaning. The only thing that wasn't awesome was the age of the room (and furniture)... it was a dated room. A remodel of the room would have had me give all five stars.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean and closest hotel to Disneyland around!
Summary: Friendly staff.. clean... decent breakfast and perfect location for visiting Disneyland. The beds could be a bit softer but overall very pleasant place to stay. We had three rooms and our whole family was pleased.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love the convenience of this hotel when I go to Disneyland. It is right across the street. They have a great breakfast, and the staff are always very friendly. This is always my first choice in a hotel.

Summary: Closeness to Disneyland is the reason for this hotels success!  Kind staff, clean room and a hot breakfast.  Not a fancy room and a funny smell in the elevator but not a far walk from the park. We will come again.

Summary: Check in was seamless, staff was friendly and gift shop was great- they had a nice selection of Disney products at a much better cost than you'd find in Disney. Rooms were clean and comfortable and I really appreciated the wonderfully close proximity to the parks after a long day with 2 young kids. We had a few hiccups with our stroller upon arriving and Gilbert from the Maintenance Department was so great to assist us with at least trying to help us fix the completely flat tire. After a pump-up failed, he offered to grab us a can of fix-a-flat at the store and bring it by the next morning- such a nice gesture! We didn't take him up on it though, because we were feeling like we needed to replace the entire tube, ugh! Thanks anyway, Gilbert! Thank goodness my husband found a
