Summary Heading: Location alone gives this place top marks
Summary: Location location location. If you visiting Disney and choose not to stay in a Disney hotel, this is without a doubt your best bet. Walk across the road and you are there. The staff are friendly and the included buffet breakfast is awesome compared to other versions of the hotel chain. You can also come back and take a small rest, swim or bite to eat at nearby eateries without the high price tag of Disney restaurants before heading back for more fun. I will without any hesitation recommend this hotel and will most certainly stay here again if revisiting anytime soon.

Summary Heading: Super close to Disney but very noisy
Summary: About as close as you can get to Disney. Breakfast was included and there was a large selection. All 4 of us struggled with the noise all 4 nights from the people in the rooms next to us with crying and screaming children. As well, families would speak and shout to each other in the hallways when coming back from the fireworks around 9:30pm and in the mornings before breakfast when my family was trying to sleep. Rooms aren't very soundproof. Perhaps we could have requested a 'quiet' zone area of the hotel if that was a possibility??
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am sorry your were disturbed by other guests.  Rooms past the pool do have less foot traffic and we can put in a request for you during your next visit.  We do hope we will see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Best location for a value hotel at Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is directly across the street from the main Disneyland entrance.  You can't get any closer than this.  Having the free breakfast saves time and money.  It's decent and the staff are very friendly.  The rooms are decorated in a modern style and there's lots of room for a family with kids.  The only negative is the very small pool.

Summary: We try to stay here any time we're not staying at one of the Disney hotels. It's the closest and they have a pretty good breakfast. There were enough working outlets that we were fine and Im sure they would have moved us or addressed it if we had asked. The breakfast is typical, but convenient and offers hot items and whole fruit, which is nice. The rooms have a fridge and microwave, which is also convenient. For a room that is close to the parks with basic amenities, this is a great choice. We will probably stay here again.

Summary: Stayed here in October 2015. The rooms are HUGE.  The room would have easily slept six with two queen beds and a sofa bed.  Nice big vanity. We pre-requested a room on the top floor and got one.  A very positive experience.  We would stay here again.

Summary: We went on a family trip to Disneyland. We rented two rooms. I was very dissapointed that there was no coffee in the lobby, after coming back from a day and night of walking a coffee would have been nice. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.

Summary: We decided to go to Disneyland a day early, and booked this hotel at the last minute.  What a pleasant surprise it was! Disneyland is a easy 1 block walk, and best of all, it was a really reasonable price.  Would stay there again.

Summary: Disneyland is land-locked so most motels are fairly close. Definitely closer than anything near Disney World. So we picked a Best Western because a chain and "free" breakfast that is usually good. This one was also. Other than that it was a basic Best Western with outdoor corridors. Parking is very tight! And also $10 per vehicle. We may stay again but there are other places that looked fun to try also.

There was residue from a sticker that had been on one of the dressers but you could tell that housekeeping had tried hard to remove as much as they could. The room smelled clean which is always nice. The breakfast was good. Best to get there early to avoid crowds. There was a decent selection of breads, cereals, oats, muffins, fruit, hot eggs, meat and potatoes. Summary: Stayed here two weekends in June. It is literally right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. The buffet breakfast that is included is substantial and good. The room was a decent size and the beds so comfy after a long day at Disney. Parking is 10 dollars a night. You can sit out front of the hotel and watch the nightly fireworks display. The only downside to this place is the pool. There is absolutely no ambiance to it.  It is on the smaller side and almost completely in the shade by 3pm. If they would even add plants it would help make this feel more resort like. Other than that, it was a great value for the price.  (150/night)

Summary Heading: You can't go wrong with this hotel!
Summary: We love the Park Place Inn.  I hate to give it such positive reviews because it is already difficult getting a reservation!  We enjoy the convenient location to the park.  It is quicker to get to the hotel from the entrance of either DIsneyland or California Adventure, than it is to get from the back of either park to the front gate.  We like to check in the night before our Disney days start, get some food and snacks from Target just down the road about a mile, and then visit Downtown Disney (within 15 minute walk to the back of Downtown Disney).  Then we head back to our hotel, and comfy beds, to get ready for our adventure!  The breakfasts are superb.  Hot food, make your own Sausage/Egg/Cheese/Ham Muffins, yogurts, cereals, pastries, fruit, drinks.  Then head to the park!

Summary Heading: Affordable, clean and convenient choice near Disney
Summary: After doing much research on the hotels in the Disney area, we decided to stay here on our recent 3 day trip to Disneyland.  We were extremely satisfied with our decision!  The staff was helpful and accommodating.  We dropped our luggage and car seats at the hotel prior to check in on our 1st day in the area to head to the parks, which made things super convenient for us.  They also were very responsive any time we had a question or request for the room.  The location was key---so close to the park entrances, making it easy to get to the parks easily in the morning without waking up at the crack of dawn and also making it possible to take a break in the afternoon without losing hours out of our day traveling back and forth to the room.  The rooms were very large and clean--more

Summary: This was a great hotel to stay at for our honeymoon at Disneyland. Everything was nice and clean and all the staff there was friendly and helpful. Parking can be a little tight for larger vehicles but it's the same parking as every hotel in the area. The room layout with the king bed was very nice. The breakfast is next door and upstairs in the Captain Kidd buffet. They had a great breakfast selection and a delicious mango juice. Overall a great hotel to stay in. It's the closest hotel to Disneyland, you cross the crosswalk right in front of the hotel and it's about a 2 minute walk straight ahead to the park entrance. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Disneyland or other areas of Anaheim. Make sure to sign up for the rewards program and use a AAA

Summary Heading: Great location and close to Disneyland
Summary: My trip to Disneyland started off rocky. The other Best Western had cancelled my reservations by mistake and they were able to hook me up with this Best Western which was closer to the park and about the same price.  The breakfast that is included in the price of the hotel is located on the second floor of Captain Kidd's buffet. I  know some people complain about the breakfast but truly, you are paying for a room that includes breakfast with Disneyland across the street. It is a good value. Our room was near the stairs which did get noisy at times when other patrons returned from they day back to the hotel but overall, my son and I could go back to our room and rest when we needed to during our trip. The staff there were nice and helpful.  Highly recommend.

Summary: Couldn't ask for a better location, straight across from the entrance to the park. The breakfast offered a good range of healthy options and "treats" which made both Mom and the kids happy.  The staff were wonderful.  We had booked two nights and then made better than anticipated progress driving from Sedona.  They not only were able to provide the extra night, they offered a good discount. Also helped with sorting our Disney tickets (as we were there an extra day!) and planning our final days navigation of LA.  Super.

We are very close to Disneyland at less than a five minute walk, if not waiting for the traffic signal directly in front of our hotel.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope you will come and stay with us again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland, just walk across the street.  Wouldn't recommend if going for business, unless going to Disney.  Noisy from outside, a lot of kids and rolling suitcases. lol  But, love the convenience of so close to Disneyland and great breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you stay with us and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  We definitely hope to be seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Hotel was close to the park and very clean, they even had 24 hour maintenance which was nice. The room was also a kot bigger than i thought it would be. Will definitely be staying here again in the future!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  Thank you for sharing what you enjoyed about the hotel and why you will be staying with us again.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and look forward to seeing you again.  We hope you will enjoy the newly remodeled rooms that will be available towards the end of the year.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This hotel is so easy to get into Disneyland.  The customer service is wonderful.  The breakfast has nice selection but the fruit was just ok..  I will always try to stay at this motel when I go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We appreciate reading how much you enjoyed your stay with us.  Thank you for your comments and compliments.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This stay was part of our first big family vacation. I chose the Best Western because it was right across from Disneyland and I heard it was a good place to stay. During the check in the staff who assisted me was very helpful and friendly. As she checked us in, she let me know about the continental breakfast that was included and made sure I knew the best time go get there. Our room was nice and clean, the beds were OKAY, but the pillows were just not comfortable at all, they sunk right in and stayed flat the whole time. The breakfast was free so we took advantage of that. It was good and I was glad we got there early because it got pretty packed around 7 and if you get there too late, there is no where to sit.  I have no complaints about our stay and I will be  staying here
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We appreciate you sharing what you enjoyed about your stay and where we can improve.  I am pleased you were able to take advantage of the breakfast and that our staff was able to assist with timing so you could get the most out of your stay.  Thank you for your comments and compliments.  We look forward to seeing you next year.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: My husband and I travelled from Australia  and stayed 8 nights with my daughter's family of 5 and my son's family of 6. We had 3 rooms side by side on the middle floor which adeqately slept the children with 2 queen and a double sofa bed/lounge in each room. The rooms were clean and we were given plenty of towels, toiletries,coffee/tea etc. Travelling so far with 7 children the laundry facilities next to the swimming pool were great. The breakfast was all we needed to start the day and we took a piece of fruit with us for later in the day. The biggest bonus was being across the road from the Disney entrance and we would return to the hotel for a rest with the children before returning later in the day. We have no complaints. All the staff we spoke to were pleasant and courteous
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  I am very pleased we could help make your family's trip to the Disney relaxing and memorable.  Thank you for letting us know which amenities benefited you during your stay as well as for all of your comments and compliments.  I do hope you will be able to come and stay with us again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This is the closest hotel to the Disney parks; walk across the road and you are there. Good value, acceptable breakfast with lots of options, and rooms are decently comfortable. Staff are very good and caring attitude.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the location, breakfast, accommodations, and your interactions with the staff.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Was a good place to stay for the money. I would not pay more than I did. Room was clean upon arrival but not cleaned very well throughout our stay. Breakfast was just average but better than sitting down and paying in a restaurant. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Very noisy with industrial trucks coming and going in early morning ours and an over abundance of birds chirping really really early. Something I am sure can not be helped. Overall happy with stay. Good bang for your buck on a budget.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry we did not exceed your expectations.  We will be remodeling our rooms beginning at the end of August.  I hope you will come and visit us again so we may have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Just walk across the road and your in Disney that's how close you are. I was a bit worried about staying here as it was a motel but it was fine. We arrived at 9am, checked in and they stored our bags until our room was ready at 3. They have free wifi around the complex and in your room. We had cars parked outside our door, can't say I heard them. Breakfast was free, you got a choice of cereal, toast, bagels, fruit, pastries and cooked items. Breakfast was in the restaurant upstairs next door. The room itself was spacious with a sofa, tv, large bed, bathroom, plenty of electric sockets. The bed was comfortable  There was a small pool but we never used it. We got up early every morning to get to the parks but why oh why did the cleaning cart have to go by our window at 6 am each
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay with us and greatly appreciate you sharing what you liked about our hotel.  We hope we will be seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: great location have stayed here numerous times. always clean pleasant and a helpful staff.  Breakfast can be loud, but fun...coffee always good.   For the cost a great value....easy walk to Disenyland, California Adventure, and downtown Disney
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoy having you stay with us and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments. We look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay  if  going to Dinseyland
Summary: great location   fair price    free small buffet breakfast  ...   restaurant right  across the side street of hotel....    (restaurant  was not that good for the dinner buffet... seemed short of staff...  had to  ask for plates and "beg"  for silverware,  not a great night for dinner there)    BUT  hotel  is  very good....   very friendly....   pool....   gift shop....  and  SOOO  close to  entrance of Disneyland....
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review. We appreciate your comments and compliments and sharing what you enjoyed.  We do lease out the upstairs of the restaurant for our breakfast.  We do not run the actual restaurant.  We hope we will see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Very uncomfortable sofa bed. Lock on door needed a repair. Bathroom faucet and sink faucet needed repairs. Put a sign out so people know, maid service will be done before 5pm, not noon. Was not aware of your policy till we returned to the room around 3:30 pm and called.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We will have all new rooms in November of this year.  I am sorry if any of items in your room were not functioning correctly.  I do hope the situation was addressed promptly for you.  Our very hard working housekeepers have 199 rooms to clean daily between the hours of 8am and 4pm. These include guests staying over and checked out rooms.  We do focus on cleaning the checked out rooms first so they can be ready for the days arrivals.  However, if you need your room ready for afternoon rests we can place a request with housekeeping.  I hope you will come and stay with us again

Summary: The service, cleanliness, breakfast , friendliness cannot be beat.It is a family favorite place to stay when we trvel to Anaheim.. The staff are very curteous and we have come to have full trust and comfort when we stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us when you visit Anaheim.  We enjoy having you as our guest and look forward to your next visit.  Your comments and compliments are greatly appreciated.  We will see you soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We were able to get a room at the very last minute.  It was clean and ready for check in.  Perfect for a place to sleep! Room was clean, had mini fridge and microwave. Good water pressure and hot water.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased we were able to accommodate you and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  We hope you will come back and see us again soon.  Thank you and take care

Summary Heading: Great location at a great price
Summary: Great place to stay right  next to the entrance to Disneyland. Inexpensive rooms with a decent breakfast included. Great for families. AC wasn't working but the weather was cool at the time. Pool is very small. Handy laundry area. Pleasant staff.
Manager Response: Thank you fro choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and greatly appreciate all of your comments and compliments.  We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: The location is what you stay here for..Right across the street from Disneyland and a quick walk..Rooms are just average ..they are clean and the bed is very comfortable..The pull out sofa is not so great, but worked out fine for an 8 year old. The pool is quite small and not a really great looking area either but kids still had a fun time swimming. Breakfast is not Fab ,but it's adequate ..weird egg patties every day and sausage or ham and potatoes for the hot items also waffle or pancakes.. Yogurt, bagels,fruit etc it's enough to start your day .. It's not a fancy place by any means ,but when we go to Disneyland we aren't in the room anyway until late to sleep and can't really see spending $450+ /night at a Disney property just to sleep..this place is so easy to get to if you
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  We have all new rooms coming in November 2016.  We hope you will enjoy the improvements.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: we couldn't stay in the hotel we had booked for our vacation it was too bad. Best Western made it happen during a marathon weekend no less. They were so kind and the hotel was clean and lots of room the free breakfast was great ,it gave us a great start to the day !!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to share your experience.  I am very pleased we were able to help you out of a jam. We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope you will stay with us again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This hotel has a great location but it is starting to get tired.  Good thing is they are starting to do some upgrades. Last year was their breakfast area which looks great.  Rooms need the over haul now.  Sofa Beds are garbage and not comfy so please be aware.  We are booked to stay again next year so heard that they are starting to renovate the rooms so I hope that means new sofa beds because that maybe a deal breaker for next time as we are a family who needs that 3rd sleeping area. Queen beds are great!  Also another not the pool area can be shady and they also need a bit of TLC so hoping that is in the works at some time.

Summary: hotel is in a great location for visiting Disney attractions, pretty much average for all else. Breakfast buffet is handy. Beds comfy, but pillows are hard and thick. If you are hoping for some relaxing pool time, best to pick another hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  Your comments and compliments are appreciated and will help us improve our service. Summary: We just stayed at the Best Western for the past 5 nights to attend The Disneyland Tink Races and I would recommend it to anyone that wants to visit Disneyland. It is SO nice and convenient to the parks (you are right across the street) and eateries. All are in walking distance. We were even able to watch the fireworks from our hotel window and out front of the hotel. This is our second time staying here and will surely be back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time at the Tinker Bell events.  We will begin remodeling our rooms late August and should be completed mid November.  We hope you will come and see us again soon and enjoy the new updates.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope to see you soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Excellent Choice by Disneyland Main Entrance
Summary: The location of this resort is excellent, literally across the street from Disneyland's main entrance. We stayed here for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon and found it very accessible for the race, Expo, theme parks and DT Disney. The hotel is also conveniently located on the ART and has many shopping and dining venues available within 1-2 blocks, including Panera, Tony Roma, McDonald!s, CVS and Gardenwalk. The room was cety clean with an enormous, flat screen tv; remodelled bath with plenty of hot water, en-suite vanity, full closet with mirror and sofa sleeper. Staff were friendly and fabulous; they will hold your bags until your room is ready abd even after check out if you're planning last day visits to the park. Breakfast was great - always eggs, meat (ham or sausage), fried
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  First, I hope you had a great time at the Tinkerbell Half Marathon.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay with us, including the location, accommodations, and amenities.  Your comments and compliments are greatly appreciated.  We will be remodeling all of our beginning at the end of August 2016 to provide an even greater experience.  We should be done around the middle of November.  Please come and see us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Good Value and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here on the last night of our Disneyland trip, as the Grand Californian was sold out due to the Marathon Weekend. We had requested a room on the first floor but instead were given a room on the 3rd floor, furthest from the elevators. We had asked the staff at the front desk for directions back to the Alamo in Downtown Disney so we could drop off our rental and none of them even knew there was an Alamo located there. The room was very clean but the furniture was a bit worn. Wifi worked very well. Can't beat the location to Disneyland. It's literally across the street. If you are looking for an alternative to the Disneyland Resort hotels, this would be it.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased that overall you enjoyed your stay.  We do try to meet all of our guests requests whenever possible.  We did have your request you entered when making the reservation online for a room near the lobby.  Unfortunately that request did not mention the first floor.  We did however, put you directly over the lobby.  I did also personally print out the directions for you to the Alamo Car Rental. We do greatly appreciate your comments and compliments. They will help us improve our service.  Please come and stay with us again.  Our rooms will be remodeled beginning in August and work should be completed before the start of the holiday season.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We love to stay here on our visits to Anaheim, great value and great location for surrounding area.  We love to walk across to Disneyland and have a break during the day in our motel before going back for the night entertainment.  We love going to the Garden Walk and CVS while there and even a trip to Walmart.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us when visiting Anaheim.  We enjoy having you as our guest and appreciate your comments and compliments.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Very pleased with the staff and overall appearance of the hotel. The room furniture had its wear and tear. Few small items needed repair. Super close to Disney, ideal place to stay with the family. I would highly recommend the location, especially when planning a trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Myself and my husband, our son, his wife and their two children rented two connecting rooms and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The easy walk to the Disney locations,and the free breakfast were great. The kids enjoyed going back and forth between the two rooms and if one was napping we could comfortably hang out in the adjoining room. The location was the best possible.
Manager Response: none

Summary: BWPP was a great value. We had a 1 King with the sofa pullout. We stayed 2 nights and had no problems.   Parking was a breeze, and multiple elevators on property was nice. Breakfast was decent. Nothing extraordinary, but at least they had protein options such as eggs, ham, and yogurt (it looked like they may sometimes offer Oatmeal too since there were toppings for oatmeal, but we didn't see any oatmeal the morning we ate breakfast there).   BWPP is 1 of the 2 closest hotels to the crosswalk to the Disneyland Transit area. The decor is pretty outdated, but I don't care about that. I care about cleanliness (check), comfort (check), & location (triple check!)  The pull out sofa bed was NOT comfortable, but they rarely are, it was was perfectly fine for my 5 year old daughter. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: Across the street from Disneyland and California Adventure Park entrances. Rooms are spacious and clean, while staff is very friendly. Your stay comes with a breakfast buffet. We also stayed at Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel, which was double the price without the breakfast, and same distance to the Parks. BW Park Place Inn is a much better deal!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay, very clean, breakfast was convenient, and so close to Disneyland and CA Adventure entrance gates, we could walk to and from, and could easily take breaks during the day, going back to hotel for a rest.  Will stay here from now on when going to Disneyland!

Summary: The location was amazing since I was there to go to Disneyland. I just had to walk across the street and I was there. The cost and amenities were great. Very affordable. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Summary: the room was clean, quiet, very large and roomy, the beds were comfortable, no outside noise on third floor, nice easy, quick walk to the parks, good breakfast selection, friendly staff. only con really was the toilet paper.  sorry, i've stayed in enough hotels and i don't ever remember the tp being that bad

Summary: All of the reviews are spot on. Clean, comfortable, across the street from the park. We stayed March 27th to April 1st. Room number was 278. A few things about this room: the window looks out over Harbor Blvd. Thought it might be noisy with all of the foot and car traffic, but it wasn't really noticeable. You can see the crosswalk to get onto Disney property from your window. There is a soda machine and an ice machine outside of the room, but I don't think most guests knew about it because it wasn't used very much. You COULD hear the ice machine loud and clear when someone used it, but again, it wasn't used much. The lobby is 2 stories tall. Nice thing about the room is you don't have neighbors on your left (when looking out the window) because of the lobby. Didn't hear any
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent staff, very comfortable rooms.  Breakfast was good and the kids loved it.  Directly across from Disneyland.  We had a family suite on 3rd floor and it was fine even though with children, we preferred bottom floor.  Overall experience was a great time at Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Location, closest hotel to Disneyland!
Summary: This is the third time we stay at this hotel in a year. We decided to try other hotels next door but nothing compares to this hotel. The rooms are clean and large. My kids love the banana muffins they have for breakfast. The best part is that its right across from Disneyland. We will stay here again. The only thing we did not like is that the WIFI quicks you out and the $10 parking fee. Besides that, this is the only hotel we will stay at if visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Fantastic stay for our family trip
Summary: All the staff working here are fantastic.  From the grounds people to the cleaning staff to the front desk staff.  Everyone was super friendly and very helpful.  I would strongly recommend  you stay here.

Summary: I was very impressed with how well this property is run and maintained, considering all of the traffic due to it's proximity to Disneyland.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was clean, comfortable and did not appear to be trashed by all the families that stay there for Disneyland.  I had a leaky faucet that was fixed right away and I thought the cleaning staff maintained a cheerful and friendly attitude, even though I could tell they work very hard and have to endure a lot of inconsiderate guests.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Whenever we go to Disneyland Resort, we try to stay here because of the great location in relations to the resort.  It is literally right across the street, which helps after a tiring day of running around the park.  Another plus about this hotel is that the rooms have frigs and microwaves.  The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of 5 rating is that they now charge you to park your car.  The cost was $10 per day and it seems like a little thing compared to all the money spent at Disneyland, but it feels like they are nickel and diming.  Overall, I would stay at this place again.

Summary: Unless you pay the big bucks and stay in the Disney resort hotels, there is no other hotel that is more convenient to Disneyland.  Rooms are typical motel rooms, but clean and well laid out.  Breakfast buffet is listed as continental breakfast, but it is so much more.  Had cooked eggs, meat (ham/sausage), fried potatoes and pancakes/waffles/french toast, as well as doughnuts, muffins, choice of cereals, etc.  Our motel of choice when visiting Disneyland.

Other than that, this is a great LOCATION to stay for the parks.  The only other hotel closer is the Grand Californian that is IN the park. Already making plans for another stay - just hope they will do away with the additional parking fee.

Summary: My family and I stayed here for a week just recently, and I loved this motel. The pool is small but my kids loved it, husband loved the hot tub, there's a shower there, laundry facilities, plenty of vending machines, and a bathroom in the pool area.   The breakfast is next door on the second level of captain kidd's restaurant, and there was plenty of variety for a continental breakfast. It was kept clean and stocked. The microwave was very handy to have as we always brought back leftovers and the mini fridge worked really well. The little freezer even froze a bottle of

Summary: The hotel is very nice and has lots of amenities.  The only downfall is their WiFi.  It kept kicking me off and I had to keep logging in. Very close to Disneyland which is why we decided to stay at this property.  If's defiantly worth the little extra money.

Summary: This is our second year staying at this hotel for a Disneyland trip. We love the convenience of the easy walk to the park. We love that there is parking available ($10/day). Summary: We stayed for five nights last week to make our daughter's dream's come true by visiting the 'happiest place on earth' Disneyland. Summary: This place was walking distance to Disneyland. It is so convenient to not have to deal with Disney traffic when the park closes! Other than that, the rooms are clean and spacious. This is the only place I will use from now on when going to Disneyland.

Summary: It is a true pleasure to stay in this hotel, it is my choice each and every trip. Staff have always been friendly and helpful, breakfast choices get better and better every time, I am very happy with the price and I always recommend it to everyone!

Summary: The hotel was clean and comfortable.  The people very nice and accommodating.  The best part - across the street from Disneyland.  We walked out the main gate and crossed the street. Summary: Had a good time at Disney Land.  Hotel was comfortable and very convenient (across the street) to the Disney Land / California Adventure entrance. Summary Heading: Convenient to Disneyland, great place to stay.
Summary: Our family of 6 stayed here for 5 nights and were very pleased with our stay. Staff were friendly, the room was clean and the kids loved the pool.  We had two double beds and one sofa bed which accommodated us all.  Breakfast next door was fantastic and included in our stay but by far the best thing was we were right across the road from the entrance to Disneyland. This made our stay very convenient not having to use shuttles or walking far. We were able to come and go as we pleased as it was only a short walk. Would definitely use this hotel again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: All good, perfect location directly across the street from both Disney parks. Free breakfast is quite good in restaurant next door. Good sized rooms, parking next to room (extra fee). Small outdoor pool and hot tub.

Summary: If you want to stay right across the street from Disneyland this is the place. You walk across the street and your at Disney. Great suite rooms at a great price. Pool on site. Lots of parking for cars no RV's
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was traveling with a school group of Special Needs High School Students.  Not only was Best Western Plus Park Place Inn very understanding, generous and accomodative, they made our stay very pleasurable. They even made sure to put us in rooms that were all in a row with connecting rooms as well.  This proved to be very beneficial in helping our students and each other out when needed. Offering a full Continental Breakfast at Captain Kidd next door, made it very convenient and fast for our group of 17 individuals.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff at this hotel go out of their way to help....you would think they were family.  The room was clean and had everything we needed and more.  The location was perfect for going to Disneyland.  I will definitely stay again when I come back to the area.

Summary: breakfast was great with lots of hot food options and decent coffee and location to disneyland was outstanding with a  very easy 2 min walk to the gate staff was polite and professional  room was what we expected, clean and functional felt is was kind of expensive for outdoor motel style rooms had to pay for parking but they had a car gate and pass to enter and exit which made it feel safer.  did not use the pool area

Summary: This is a moderately priced hotel that is a great alternative to the Disney hotels. It does not have the Disney atmosphere but is well worth the stay. Though it is not on Disney property, it is very convenient to Disneyland and California Adventure. It is right across the street from the Disney bus and shuttle entrance. The staff was very kind and helpful. The rooms were very clean and large enough to accommodate our needs. The room we stayed had a mini-fridge, mini-microwave, and mini-coffee maker.  It has a restaurant next door and offers a free buffet breakfast each morning you stay there. The food was very mediocre. All in all, the hotel is well worth the price.

Summary: I've stayed here twice in the last few months, and have not been disappointed either time. Staff is friendly and helpful.  Rooms are clean.  Beds are comfortable. Walking across the street to Disneyland is worth the price alone!

Summary: We are a family of 4 and stayed in a room with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa bed for 6 nights.Our room was quiet, clean and the beds were comfortable. It was great to be so close to Disneyland - we easily returned to our room for breaks. The stay included breakfast which was adequate (potatoes, eggs, ham or sausages, bagels, cereal, fruit, yogurt etc). This was convenient and added value to our stay. Would stay here again.

Summary: Brought our granddaughter to Disneyland.  This hotel is right across the street,  we were given 1st floor rooms right at the front of the property.  I think we were closer than actually staying on Disney property for a lot less money.  Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice, but rooms need a facelift
Summary: My daughter and I had a comfortable stay. The rooms could use a bit of updating, but were very clean. GREAT breakfast. The price was reasonable. And, it was great to be so close to Disney! We walked each day.

The breakfast was great variety.  The pool area is a little small but good enough to cool off and relax in during the day for a break from DL.  The location is perfect!  No waiting for a bus and could walk across to DL and back to the hotel for a midday break.  Will stay again!

Summary: Fantastic hotel across the street from disneyland. It a shorter walk to disneyland entrance from this hotel than others.  There are 24 hour eating establishments next door as well.  The breakfast is quick, efficient, and very adequate.

Summary Heading: This is best than staying at a Disney hotel!!!

And all of them are just across the street from this hotel!! I mean, even the people staying at Disney Resorts need to walk more or to grab some kind of transportation to get there. If you stay here, you´ll get the basics, at a very reasonable price, pool, free breakfast, free wifi and free parking included, lots of options to eat super close to the hotel, and just a few steps from the gates of these 3 main attractions. We loved staying there!!

But other than that, we have no complaints. The beds are mostly comfortable, bathroom clean, included breakfast is great, parking suitable, clean pool. No complaints actually. The hotel is right at the crosswalk to go to Disneyland making it very convenient. The suite we had was very spacious and clean. The beds were very comfortable and clean as well. Summary: Decent price and very convenient location, across the street from Disneyland. There is a Denny's, a McDonald's, and a Tony Roma's, within the block. Also a drug store down the street.  Parking is a little tight if driving bigger veichele, but free with room. We gave ours to my in-laws who drove down with a trailer and we're staying at Orangeland RV park.  Free breakfast with room. It was decent, waffles, toast, bagels, bacon, sausage, eggs, yogurt, milk, juice, coffee, tea, cereal, and few more.  Small fridge and microwave in room. Also had air conditioning. Pool and hot tub were clean and useable.  Only downside was that the beds were double size, would have preferred queen.  Overall decent price, close location and clean rooms. I would use this hotel again.

Summary: This is one of the closest places to Disneyland. Right across the cross walk.  We have stayed there 3 times in the last year. The place is always clean and comfortable. My family loves it. It does come with breakfast. It is not that great. After couple days we go two hotels up to McDonald's.

All at a very competitive price.  It also includes complimentary breakfast but stick to the fruits and bagel/toast/pastries - the eggs and meat are pretty bad but what do you expect for free food?  All in all you get quite a lot for what you pay.

(and i mean across the road, it could NOT be closer).  When we came back in the afternoon our room was ready and we headed up. 3rd level overlooking the pool. There is a lift so no lugging your bags up stairs which was great. Great room, 2 double beds, table and chairs, tv, mini fridge, and microwave couldn't ask for more. The noise from the pool was non existent and it was fairly hot when we were there.The bathroom was adequate
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I greatly appreciate you sharing your experience at our hotel. Yet you need to book BWPPI with reasonable expectations. This is a satisfactory motel for those just looking for a place to sleep/rest in-between jaunts to the Disneyland Resort. You won't get room service, fancy headboards that light up, early morning access to the parks, amazing water slides and pools, and all the other "special" benefits of staying on-site in a Disney hotel.  We had a very disappointing stay at the Disneyland Hotel on our

Summary: Room was very nice and clean. All of the staff was very helpful and professional. The breakfast was huge and well worth the cost of the motel. Little noisy during fireworks but what the heck.. we were in Disneyland. Would definitely stay here again!

There are numerous restaurants within walking distance and a city and tour bus stop right out front. The breakfast is typical for this hotel but does have a selection for everybody. It is nice to have a free breakfast before heading into the Parks for the day, especially with a family.

Summary: We booked the hotel during a major convention, and the ones we typically lodge at were fully booked. The hotel was disappointing, but the rate was reasonable ($140/night).   The staff are great for the most part. The rooms and facilitated are extremely dated. Tub faucet was difficult to use (almost called customer service about it), the furniture is tacky (faux bamboo decor). Mold is seen on tile grout. Lighting is awful (compact fluorescent bulbs). People come for the location though (myself included).   They do, however, have free wifi, fridge, microwave, and coffee makers in the room. Still, looking forward to the return home.

Summary: We just recently went on our first Disneyland family vacation and I am so glad that we stayed at the Best Western Plus! This will forever be our go-to place to stay when taking future Disneyland trips. Definitely recommend.

This is definitely a plus since I didn't see very many taxis. It is right across the street from disney.  The room was not bad but I've stayed in other budget hotels that had much better rooms for the same price. There is a basic breakfast included as well as free wi-fi but the wi-fi only worked well the first couple days. I wasn't able to connect during the last 3 days of my trip, which was not cool since I was there on business.  In terms of value for money, this hotel delivers.  the only negative, there was an error on my bill which I was never able to resolve despite repeated calls to the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family goes to Disneyland every year. We found this hotel about 3 years ago and have not stayed anywhere else since! For location this cant be beat!! We always have a clean room and the hot breakfast is always a nice touch! The outside of the hotel recently had some upgrades done which look very nice. If you are wanting a clean room close to Disneyland this is the place!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We say at the Best Western Plus just across the street from Disneyland/California Park. This is fantastic location for park access. Staff was very helpful an took great care of us. We will defiantly stay here in the future. I highly recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am extremely pleased that you had a fantastic experience.  Your comments, compliments, and recommendation are greatly appreciated.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: The location was top notch and the breakfast was nice on the pocket book.  The staff from check in to check out were very accommodating.  They even helped with Papa's rental scooter from another company. They helped track our super shuttle down as well.  Above and beyond if you ask me!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and helping you and your family in way we could.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope to see you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Stayed here 7 nights and loved it!!! Right across the street from the Disneyland entrance was a plus. Rental car place in lobby and centrally located to anything you could need on South Harbor Blvd. But more than that. it was the people that worked here. Everyone was always so nice and spoke in the walkways. The front desk staff was great about letting us take our "first look" photos in the lobby on our wedding day, and even when we were waiting for the shuttle upon checkout I was sharing pictures with the front desk staff from the wedding day and they were genuinely interested. Complimentary breakfast was great too. I cannot wait to come back and stay at this hotel.

Summary: Best place to stay if you're going to Disneyland. Right across the street from entrance. Includes a fairly complete breakfast. Nice pool and spa to relax in after a full day at Disneyland. We stay here every time we go to Disneyland.

Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland. The location was great, the value is excellent, and the staff was incredible. The rooms are clean but a little dated. Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone visiting Disneyland..

Summary: Location was great - right across the street from Disneyland - walking distance to many restaurant and eateries - great price and breakfast was included. Already booked to stay here again in May for the Disney Tinker Bell races.

Summary: We've stayed in a few other locations when going to Disneyland and we always end up complaining at the end of the trip about how long it takes to get to the park, so this time we booked something right across the street. Staff was nice but the real big downside was the cleanliness of the rooms. There was cobwebs on the lights above the sink area, dust and dirt in the corners and on lampshades and Tv and the rug was disgusting and had was coming loose from the floor not to mention the water damage issues in the bathroom,. This gets a higher rating because it's so close to the park and besides walking into the room to sleep we had little use for
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very sorry for the issues with your room. Summary: We only stay at the Park Place Inn when going to Disneyland.  The rooms are exceptionally clean, the staff goes out of their way to make sure we are comfortable, and the FREE hot breakfast is awesome!  Just walk across the street and you are in the Happiest Place on Earth!

Summary: I really liked how close this hotel was to Disneyland.  The staff was accommodating and generally friendly.  The breakfast was well laid out and there was a lot of room for many stations and many guests.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and appreciate your comments and compliments.  We hope you will come back and see us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: I have stayed at Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier our families previous visits to Disneyland. I wanted to save money and try staying across the street. I have read all the reviews most of them are awsome and a few made me worry. I can tell you there is nothing to worry about at this hotel. It is a 5 min walk to the gate great for coming back in the middle of the day. I had no problems with anything. Wifi great room was nice and clean no bugs any where inside or out. the room decor is fine . We stayed in a 2 queen beds with a pull out sofa couch . Lots of room for me 2 young kids. Pool is small but with toddlers they dont care hot  tub was nice and relaxing at the end of the day. Would stay here again .  I saved over 1000 dollars staying at this hotel instead of Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments. Summary: The proximity to Disneyland is the hotel's biggest "plus".  The breakfast was ample with good variety.  The rooms were comfortable and well-appointed.  However, the air conditioner was so noisy we preferred to have the room warm rather than to have the AC run continuously.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  I am sorry the air conditioner was too loud.  I hope we were notified while you were here so we could address the issue.  The A/C units should only provide a low hum.  If anything other than that, our maintenance can address it.  We hope you will come and stay with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Excellent hotel accommodations. Room was very clean, Extremely convenient location right across from the entrance to Disneyland park resort, as close to the gate as you can get. I was however, quite put off by the experience of having discovered an error in my billing. I was charged three nights instead of the two that we actually stayed and would not have even known had I not checked my credit card balance that morning electronically. I was miles away and had to return to try to get it all straightened out. The explanation I was given was confusing and I had to ask for clarification three times. I never did quite understand why. In addition to to that, the night desk person had me down for just one night instead of the two that I had reserved well in advance the day I checked
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed the accommodations and location.  I am sorry there was some confusion with your billing.  There was no error in the billing.  When you checked in, your credit card was authorized for the room and tax plus $30.00 for incidentals.  When you checked out,  the card was processed for the actual amount owed. So what you were seeing was the original authorization processed and then the actual charge that went through. They were actually one in the same, it just was not reflecting as such when you checked your balance that morning.  The credit card company fully processed the final transaction, reconciling the authorization with the charge.  When you originally made your reservation, which was not made directly through the hotel, it was set up as two separate reservations. This why the gentleman who checked you in did not realize right away that you were here for two nights. I do hope you see this posting and understand what occurred.  We would like for you to come and stay with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Best Place To Stay In Disneyland Area
Summary: This is our new favorite place in Disneyland.  It's the closest hotel to Disneyland and it was just a beautiful retreat after a long day in the park.  Just FYI, they charge a $10.00 day fee if you bring a vehicle.   We took the shuttle so no fee. If you decide to leave your car at the hotel on your checkout day and go into the park there is a $25.00 an hour fee.  So make sure you move your car.  And you will have no surprises.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased we have become your new favorite place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We prefer the Best Western when visiting Disneyland due to its location and reasonable prices for spacious rooms. It's always clean and relatively quiet. We booked two king rooms for our group and requested connecting rooms. Our request was met. The king bed was very comfortable, but the sofa bed that my 2 year old slept on was not. He was fine with it, but I wouldn't have wanted to sleep on the thin mattress. But what can you expect from a hotel sofa sleeper? Bathroom was clean, and the water was always hot with plenty of pressure. The only noises we heard were people walking by outside and the occasional heavy footsteps above us, and we were on the first floor as all the king rooms are. The only other minor complain I had was that I'm glad that we had access to another room as
Manager Response: none

Summary: Best Western Park Place Inn is convenient for our Disneyland vacations. It is very welcoming, helpful,and courteous,  Beds are comfortable, rooms very clean, remodeled dining area  offers a wide variety of great breakfast items, included in the hotel price. Staff is WONDERFUL and they go out of their way to make our BEST Western Park Place stay always the BEST ever.

Summary: First stay here, and will do again.  Room sizes are good, quiet rooms and comfortable beds.  Best location and I think even closer than staying in a Disney hotel. Summary Heading: Best Western Plus Park Place Inn

Parking reasonable at $10/day.  Front desk very helpful and friendly.  Low flow shower head, but understand need to conserve water.  Will stay here if visiting again.

Summary: You could not find a hotel that was closer to Disneyland without staying in one of their over-priced resorts.  This Best Western is the one right across the streets from the park entrance where the shuttle buses drop you off.  The room was spacious, the breakfast was pretty good, and they let us park our vehicle there for the whole 2 days we were in Disneyland not just from check-in until check-out, without extra fees (we had to request but they were very accommodating).

Summary: great room for 6 people, right across the street from disneyland, free breakfast has lots of choices, warm clean pool, nice hot tub... fresh clean room every day, quiet,,, couldn't ask for more... great affordable family trip...

Summary: This Inn is by far the closest Inn/Hotel to the entrances to Disneyland and California Adventure. Cross right at the light and  a short walk to the ticket area and entrance to Downtown Disney. There are plenty of places to eat IHOP and Denny's nearby as well.

Summary Heading: THE place to stay when visiting Mickey
Summary: My wife and I haven’t been to Disneyland for 14 years.  Our son and daughter-in-law, and granddaughter, are regular visitors and suggested we stay where they do, the Best Western Park Place Inn and Mini-Suites.  So we did for 8 days.  It was an excellent choice.  First, is the location.  Yes, some wise business person said the basics for success were location, location, location.  This property has that in spades.  Walk half a block and you are at the Disneyland gates.  It is very easy to slip back to the room for a break in the action before returning to the park totally recharged.  Second, has to be the staff.  Everyone in all departments from housekeeping, to maintenance, to reception supported our holiday in a very friendly, efficient and professional manner.  We were always
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for visiting Disneyland
Summary: You can get NO closer to the Disneyland Resort!!!  Friendly staff, nice rooms, and a decent rate!  My son and I always attempt to book this hotel for our visits to the Disneyland Resort.  Only downfall that we both agree on, is the Captain Kids breakfast (included with stay) is NOT GOOD AT ALL!!

Summary Heading: Nice location Poor free Breakfast and Noise
Summary: We took our family to Disneyland and chose this hotel.  The staff was great and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable.  We were on the second floor of the three floor hotel.  Small children began running around the room above us at about 11:30 PM and continued until after 2:00 AM.  We complained to the staff.  They may have tried to do something but the noise did not stop.  It's not a very sound proof hotel.  The free breakfast that was supposed to last until 10 AM did not work well.  Many of us who arrived between 9:30 and 9:45 AM found that trays were not resupplied and the staff was busy cleaning up the room in a hurry to close the room.  We had to ask for items that should have been resupplied.  I might stay here again because of the location, but not for good
Manager Response: none

Summary: The mini suites are spacious and we love the.  My only complaint would be the dresser tops were sticky and the rugs are very dirty so don't walk barefoot on them.  Very close to Disneyland Parks and places to eat.  I would highly recommend for convenience factor.

Summary Heading: Great hotel across the road from Disneyland!!
Summary: My partner and I stayed here for two nights in September to visit the Disneyland Parks and were really happy we chose this hotel.  Our room was extremely clean and comfortable.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly whenever I had queries at Reception.  Their breakfast area was under construction but the hotel still had an area outside where we were able to pack our own breakfast to take with us to Disneyland, which was great!!  It was really yummy and the staff again so very friendly.  Disneyland is just a 5-10 min walk across the road.   Highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to spend a couple of days at Disneyland!! Many thanks to the staff for a wonderful staff, we will definitely stay again if we visit this area again.

Summary: After a exciting, fun and very long day at Disneyland , this is the perfect place to rest those weary bones. My grand daughter and I had no trouble falling asleep in a very comfortable room.  Parking and accommodations are excellent.

Summary: This is one of the closest hotels right across from Disneyland. We have stayed here 3 times.  The staff if great.  The rooms hold 6 people very comfortably.  The breakfast is so-so but it does feed the kids.  I stayed with the cold cereal.  I will go back to this hotel again.

Summary: We have stayed at this property multiple times and it always fits our needs and is strongly supported by 5 star customer service. we have two small children so proximity to Disneyland for naps and at the end of the day is very important. Clean and well maintained.

Summary: You can't get closer to the entrance of Disney with out staying at a pricier Disney hotel.  The rooms are clean and made for families.  They have a great breakfast that is free and easy to get to.  Highly recommend for your Disney stay.

Summary: The location is why we booked this room. You basically have all of the convenience of staying on property without the price tag. It's not a fancy hotel, but it gets the job done. The room was surprisingly spacious and clean. The breakfast room had recently been redone but the food is pretty bad. The standards are there...cereal, yogurt, juice, milk, and fruit. They also have pastries, and the hot foods (eggs, meat, potatoes, waffles) were a mistake we only made once. Overall, it was a great experience and considering how little time we actually spend hanging out in our hotel room, the location made up for any shortcomings. As a frequent Disneyland visitor, I can say this is definitely one of my favorite places to stay!

Summary: Directly across the street from Disneyland entrance.  Super convenient with access to dining just a couple of steps away from front door.  Great hotel for families.  The room had a microwave and mini fridge.  Taxi cab from the nearest target was only $14 round trip.

Summary: I will give this hotel credit for one thing, the location is absolutely excellent. It is mere  steps from Disneyland. However I will never stay here again. When we entered the room, it was immediately clear that my boyfriend could not fully stand up in the modified shower without hitting his head on the ceiling. I went back to the front desk and asked if we could possibly be switched to another room. I was told no, they could not switch us and that "these things happen when you book online." When I complained further I was told they had one day later in the week that we could switch, but we would have to completely vacate the room and remove all of our belongings from 11am to 3pm that day.

Summary: Great place to stay as a family, close to disneyland and california adventure, didnt use the car at all. Close to affordable restaurants too.  Service was good, staff was friendly. Room did what it was supposed to for a family of five. Would stay here again.

Options are microwaved sausage egg mcmuffin, apples, bananas, orange juice, coffee, granola bars, muffins. Very basic simple stuff. Beats $15/person at IHop next door. Staff was great. No issues. Rooms are basic. Nothing fancy. They do have a small fridge and microwave. Furniture and fixtures are older. Overall a clean place. Small roach did sneak into our room one day when we opened the door. It was quickly

Summary Heading: Great location and staff....but cockroaches killed the rating!
Summary: We loved this hotel the first two nights we stayed there (the staff was AMAZING and the location cannot be beat), however, on the third day we found a cockroach in our room (hence the two star review). The manager was very nice about the situation and listened to our complaint, but we still felt the need to write a review to warn other guests (especially those with children). Hopefully they will solve this issue in the future as the hotel itself (and its staff) are wonderful.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review.  I greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and hope we will see you again soon. They have modernized their breakfast room and it has a lot more seating than previously and is tastefully decorated.  Very clean.  If you can't handle the steps, they will let you sit downstairs and bring you your selected foods.  They go out of their way to make your stay great.  Beds comfortable. Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  We hope you will come and stay with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and taking the time to write a review. We enjoy having you stay with us and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments. We look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: You can't beat the location (it's literally across the street from Disneyland). Nothing fancy, but clean and just what you need for a Disney stay. The wifi has greatly improved from our last visit, thanks! We had one hiccup this time with the reservation. Despite confirming three times (including once upon check in) that our second room would be held overnight for a party coming in on a red eye flight from Hawaii, their room was released. After some frustration, they were able to get the room back, but only because no one else had suddenly reserved it. It could have been disastrous. I was disappointed that this happened, but it was resolved.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again taking the time to write a review.  We enjoy having you stay with us and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments. I am sorry for the issue with your other room.  We waive the room and tax for that room the first night.  We do hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: the hotel is conveniently located in front of the Disneyland main entrance, so considering that you will expend the whole day at the park, this could be a good option. The problem is the service, i reserved a room, but when I present my mexican credit card they did not accepted because the didn´t showed my name in it, so i had to pay in cash, this is absurd. The pool is small, and the room looked old and without maintenance. There are some others hotel next to it, that look better and friendly than this.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am sorry there were issues with the credit card.  We will accept credit cards without a name on them as long as when the card is swiped, the name field returns a value.  If it does not, for fraud prevention, we will not accept the card.  I do hope you will stay with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We chose this hotel because of it's location and it was advertised having a "full warm breakfast".  When we checked in they informed us the breakfast room was being renovated so they had a grab and go breakfast.  There was minimual offerings, not enough to have something different each day and actually be full.  After 3 mornings of the same thing we went to a restaurant on the 4th morning.  I thought our room rate should have been adjusted to reflect this or had been notified to bring different food and use the mini fridge.  Other than that it was a great facility and staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay and appreciate your comments and compliments.  We did post on our website and all email correspondences regarding the breakfast renovation.  The breakfast area is now reopen.  We hope we will see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We love this hotel.  We have stayed once before and really the location can't be beat.  The rooms are really large and always CLEAN which is the most important thing to me.  I read others saying the beds are bad, well, personally I love a firm mattress, especially after a long day in the parks.  I slept like a rock/baby all 3 nights because of the wonderful firm mattress.  The kids loved the pool, which was perfect since it was 98 and 96 degrees (ugh) when we stayed.  The grab and go breakfast was great.  I heated the breakfast sandwiches in the room and got the banana, muffin and granola bar for later in the parks for a snack.  They had coffee down in the grab and go area as well.  Everyone we came into contact with (staff wise) were helpful and cheerful, which is always
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again and taking the time to write a review.  It was wonderful having you here again.  We greatly appreciate your comments and compliments and look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Best choice we could make for the Money.
Summary: Hotel was better than expected.  Does that sound bad,    it shouldnt.  I know these hotels get hammered buy guest to disneyland  and was worried,  but we're very pleased with hotel and would definitly stay here again.  If you cannot stay at disney hotel,  then this is next best choice.  We are used to orlando,  so we had no idea it was really that close to park entrance.   The room had a couch and a comfortable bed. The breakfast area was under construction  so they arranged a outside breakfast area to go buy and get stuff.  To out suprise  it was only 20 feet from our door.  And the items were fine for us.  Probably worked out better than an indoor area with long lines.  So overall we were very happy with hotel,  front desk, parking  and cleaning.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and we are very pleased to have exceeded your expectations. Summary Heading: Best Western Park Place Is The Place to Stay

Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guests and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  I am very pleased we were able to check you in early so you could get your day started.  We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Perfect location - right across from entrance. Perfect for families, smaller groups, etc. Free internet, free parking, free breakfast, pool hot tub, laundry. Clean, although rooms need updating. Probably does not matter too much because you are usually in the park all day. I would have preferred better pillows or a harder mattress, but but overall pretty good place.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review. We enjoyed having you as our guest and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  The rooms will be remodeled starting after the first of the year.  Please come back and see us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This is obviously not the Four Seasons, however, the location is the BEST! Service is decent enough.. Bed sheets were a little weird but not a deal breaker specially after a day at Disneyland! Would stay there again for location and price alone.  It was super convenient to walk to and from the Park.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  We hope we will see you again.  Thank you and take care

Summary Heading: Hard Beds and Loud A/C ; Heater = No sleep
Summary: What a disappointment. On the outside it looks good, on the inside it is a Motel 6 from 1970.  The Beds: The Bed was so bad we could not sleep and had to cut our Vacation short just to go home and get a decent nights sleep. I asked to move to another room but was told all the beds are the same. I can stand sleeping on a Firm Bed but this was above and beyond Firm. "Plywood on springs"  Overpriced and this place is not worth the short walk, if you are staying in the back then it really is not the closet hotel.    So many people talked about the location they side stepped the real problems.  I contacted the Gen. Man. after we got home she said " I will never sleep in a bed as nice as my own bed at a motel/hotel."   The above is not true.   The A/C / Heater: The A/C Heater IS LOUD
Manager Response: I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay or the accommodations.  We were not notified of the A/C problem during your stay.  You did mention it at check out and when we asked why we were not notified right away so we could address the issue, you did inform us "because it seemed like all the a/c's were the same".  As far as our beds, they are all Serta Presidential Suite Firm Pillowtop mattress.  We do try to provide quality bedding for all of our guests but unfortunately can not meet every guest's mattress preference.  It does not look like you fully enjoyed anything during your visit to the area which is very unfortunate.  We did try and compensate you for some of your discomfort and refunded one night of your two night stay.  I do hope your next vacation is much more enjoyable and you are able to take pleasure in your surroundings and experience

Summary: Staff were professional and friendly throughout entire stay. Rooms were very clean and comfortable and beds were wonderful to sleep in after a long day.  Highly recommend this hotel even if it wasn't located across the street from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate your comments, compliments, and recommendation.  We hope we will see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Avoid this place with a 10 foot pole. Very noisy, walls are thin. The mini suites has the sink outside the toilet and bathtub...go figure. Staff not accomodating at all. They promised hot buffet breakfast but due to reno they offered a sausage/egg sandwich BUT my family cannot eat pork and my daughter a vegeterian. They were not willing to change or accomodate at all. Staff behind the ocunter were not helpful at all. They don't understand not to argue with customers. Place is dirty.  AVOID AT ALL COST
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and letting us know about your experience. I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay.  The front desk staff was not trying to be argumentative.  We were just trying to ensure you that the beds were queens and not doubles.  We did try to show you rooms with both bed types.  Queens size beds are only 6 inches wider than full beds so it is hard to make a visual comparison unless they are right next to each other.  Regarding the breakfast, we did notify travel agencies and had all the information posted on our websites as to what would be offered during the breakfast renovation.  Since you did go through a travel agency, they would have been the ones to notify you of the breakfast.  I am sorry we did not have other breakfast options available during your stay.  Due to the renovation we had very little storage but items were available to accommodate vegetarians including various fruits, granola bars, muffins, as well as orange juice and coffee.  Again, I am sorry you did not enjoy your stay, but do hope you enjoyed your time at Disneyland.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We arrived in LA late at night with 2 young kids and after being in a really crappy motel elsewhere. This was awesome, the check in lady was really friendly and the room was really spacious for us all. The fact that the couch was a sofa bed was great as it meant the kids could have a bed each and this was a huge bonus we were not expecting. Having simple things like the fridge and microwave was good to keep drinks cold as it was hot. Only gripe was the air con was so loud!! A little annoying the breakfast restaurant next door was being upgraded and we had grab and go breakfast which in theory were good but by day 7 we were really over them as they were the same every morning and a bit noisy at night. We rented a car twice while there and having this available in the lobby was so
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your stay with us, including the location, amenities, and location.  We greatly enjoyed having you as our guest and appreciate your comments and compliments.  We hope to see you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Best hotel not on the Disney lot
Summary: Super clean, super friendly staff, and super close to Disneyland! Wifi went in and out, but if you're going to Anaheim/ Disneyland and you have enough time to spend in the hotel to complain about the wifi then you aren't doing it right.  I would recommend this hotel even over Paradise Pier on Disney property. I personally found this hotel much more accommodating and accessible.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you stay with us and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments.  We hope you will come and stay with us again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Great hotel, great price and location.  Closer to Disneyland than the other resort hotels (with the exception of the California Grand).  The only thing I will do differently next time is request a 3rd floor end unit room.  Everyone passes through the first floor on the way to the parks in the morning and are usually very loud and excited, which woke my family up very early every morning.  Other than that, I won't stay anywhere else when we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review. We enjoyed having you as our guest and greatly appreciate your comments and compliments. We look forward to your next visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Trouble with your internet Wifi service
Summary: Asked at least 3 times to have the problem fixed.  Only once did the fix work and then only for a few hours. Kept telling me to call the internet service provider.  My room was at the very back of the hotel and around a corner.  I think the Wifi antenna did not work in this location.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We do have wireless ports throughout the property to provide service to all rooms.  We do ask that you call the network provider so they can determine the exact issue that may be occurring in your area, at the time you are trying to access the Wi-Fi.  I do hope you will stay with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: close and convenient.....but beware of bugs
Summary: I always try to stay at hotels across the street from the entrance. I have stayed at several hotels however, this weekend was booked for my first few options so I settled with this hotel.  Pros: -Queen suite was spacious and had a mini fridge and microwave. We did not feel cramped at all. Plenty of space for a family. -Breakfast was provided, however the breakfast area was under construction so the hotel provided grab and go breakfast with a nice little breakfast. Had no complaints -Location!!! The hotel is situated directly across from Disneyland, which is perfect after a long day at the parks and especially when you have 2 little ones -Parking gate-- makes me feel a little safer knowing the parking area is gated   Cons: -Parking is shared with the adjacent restaurant. The
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write a review.  We enjoyed having you as our guest and greatly appreciate you taking the time to share what you enjoyed and what we can improve.  I am very sorry that their were a couple of bugs in the room.
