Summary: We have stayed here several times, with our most recent stay from March 10th to March 17th.  Our family stays here when we go to Disneyland.  It is the closest lodging to the main gates.  Even closer than the Disney hotels!  The rooms are clean and laid out well.  The breakfast is fine, and I have heard that they will be expanding soon.  They were also very accommodating with our room request.  We will happily stay here again!
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We greatly value our return guests and look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We have stayed here twice and will do so again when we visit Disneyland this December. The location can't be beat and the price is good. Continental breakfast is basic but a good way to get something in your stomach before heading to the parks. I would highly recommend this hotel. We have stayed on property at the DLH, and unless I get a fantastic deal at the GCH, this is our hotel of choice at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a response of our property.  I am pleased we continuously provide the service you have come to expect.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: The hotel is directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. I agree that it is as close as you can get, the grand CA might be a few steps closer, but this place is a great value.   The rooms were what I expected, nice but the bed is very firm, not to my liking and the first night I didn't sleep at all. The 2nd night we were so tired after a day in the rain at Disneyland that I did sleep and the bed didn't bother me as much. The TV's are pretty small/old, but it worked. We have a large car and didn't have any issues parking, so I wouldn't really worry about that.  We didn't use the pool or spa but the spa is under an over hang which is nice if you hit rain. There are a few vending machines and washers/dryers.   The breakfast is as advertised. I think people expect
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  The information you provided will help us improve our service for all guests as well as for you on a future stay.  I am sorry we did not quite live up to your expectations.  The TVs will all be replaced with flat screens by the end of the year.   Unfortunately they cannot all be replaced at once.  The restaurant is a separate entity from the hotel. Our food is not provided by the restaurant.  We lease the space for continental breakfast.  Unfortunately the breakfast is not yet in place due to needed equipment. I am also sorry you experienced trouble making your reservation and receiving your confirmation.  The rate is not anything we were trying to trick you on.  It was merely an error.  We do have set rates.  If you were quoted something out of the ordinary for a particular reason and it is not showing, unless the person is here that made the reservation or you have detailed information, we cannot honor that rate.  Thank you for writing down the information so we could honor the rate you were quoted.  We hope to see you again soon so we can exceed your expectations and treat you to a typical Best Western Plus Park Place Inn Stay.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: A great hotel without breaking the bank!
Summary: Our family of 6 (2 adults and 4 kids ages 12, 10, 8 and 4) spent 5 nights here and were very, very happy with the experience.  The front desk staff were friendly, courteous and actually appeared to be happy with guests checking into the hotel.  We reserved a room with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch. And while they weren't the softest beds, the linens were clean and couch bed was serviceable. The bathroom/vanity area was larger than we expected and allowed us to all get ready very quickly in the morning. The room also sported a coffee maker, microwave and mini-frig...which actually kept stuff cold!  The room was very clean upon our arrival and staff did a great job of servicing the room while were at the park throughout the entirety of our stay.  The continental breakfast is
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We greatly appreciate hearing from our guests.  We are very pleased you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to having you as our guest again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Great location, only steps to the Disney gate
Summary: We made the trip with two small kids. It was wonderful to be so close to the park. We came back to the room for naps each day and headed back out in the evenings in warmer clothing to enjoy the parades and parks at night. It took less than 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Disneyland/CA Adventure entrance. I'm so glad we stayed here and not further away at a hotel that required driving/parking or a shuttle.   Rooms were clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were newer, recently updated. We also liked the sitting area, the mini-suite feature, with a small sofa and a couple chairs.   But be sure to stock your mini fridge with bottled water! The hotel water tasted terrible and the little mini-mart nearby sells water for a huge markup.
Manager Response: We are very pleased you enjoyed your stay with us.  I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property and letting us know we are on the right track.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: This is a very nice, reasonable place to stay while visiting Disneyland.
Summary: The room was very nice and the beds were quite comfortable. Be sure to ask for a close room. All of the hotels along this strip have narrow fronts and then extend back about a block so if your feet are tired a room in the back of the hotel can seem like quite a trek. The staff was very nice and moved us to a closer room once we saw how far it was!  We were very happy with our stay overall.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We have stayed at almost every motel across from Disneyland and this motel is by far the cleanest and friendliest place.  Rooms were clean and spacious.  We traveled with a large group and they had us in adjoining rooms all next to each other which was great for "cousin time".  So nice to just cross the street after a long day at Disneyland and be back to our nice comfortable beds.  We also left an i-pod touch in the room which I worried we wouldn't see again but due to an honest housekeeper it was mailed back to us.  Overall, a great experience and we will be staying there again when we go back in December!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property and the wonderful compliments.  I am glad we were able to get your Ipod touch back to you with no trouble.  We look forward to seeing you again in December.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Will be staying here from now on!
Summary: This hotel is our favorite and we stay here everytime we go to Disneyland. Which is about twice a year and now that we're annual pass holders it will be more. The only complaint we would have is when we got into the room there was jelly on the carpet and some other stuff. We left it because I wasn't about to touch it. Plus when we had the maid service the room the next day and we returned she still didn't clean it and there was still some dirt on the bathroom floor. so finally the next day maid service finally cleaned it up after leaving a $5.00 tip for them, but I also understand they have tons of rooms to clean in a short amount of time. So, not that big of a deal. Management and staff was very helpful and friendly the entire stay except for the guy who was working the late
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am very sorry that some jelly was left on the floor of your room, but pleased it will not stop you from returning.  When you stay with us, please let us know immediately if you feel there is anything that needs to be corrected in your room.  We will correct it to the best of our ability immediately or when it is most convenient for you.  We definitely look forward to seeing you again and thank you again for your review.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We stay at park place in from 2/21/12 - 2/25/12. The location is great, at the cross walk to Disneyland.  Everyone was really nice.  We had 3 rooms and I had requested they be close together.  When we checked in they had our rooms waiting for us, all next to each other. The rooms were big and clean.  We really enjoyed our stay.  The next time we come to Disneyland we are staying at Park Place Inn!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am pleased we were able to accomodate your request and have all rooms next to each other.  This sometimes can be difficult to accomodate.  We definitely look forward to see you again when you come back for a visit to the mainland.  Mahalo, Malama Pono, E Hui Hou

Summary: I've just returned from my first stay at this hotel and I have nothing but great things to say! The staff were extremely friendly and courteous, I booked a queen mini suite and the room was large and very clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic with a small gift shop inside and a mini mart right next door. Right at the crosswalk to Disneyland you couldn't ask for more.  I had read reviews about noise but I was on the third floor and had no issues at all.    Not a bad walk to the Garden Walk shopping area, plenty of restaurants close by, I have every intention of staying here again and would recommend it to anyone with no hesitation! Thank you to Best Western Park Place Inn for making my stay so enjoyable!
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate you taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am extremely pleased you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Another great stay across from Disneyland
Summary: We've stayed here 4 times before, and we love this hotel. It is not glamorous or posh, but it has just what we need when we visit Disneyland. It is right across the street from the Disneyland walk-in entrance. The rooms are clean and large. The free breakfast opens at 6:30am and includes pastries, fruit, juices, coffee, hard boiled eggs and yogurt. On this visit I think the hotel staff was even friendlier and more helpful than before. We will definitely stay here again next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We enjoy hearing from our return guests that we are continuously providing the service you enjoy and expect.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Closest to the park entrance and great!
Summary: We hadn't stayed at this hotel in many years, preferring instead to splurge and stay at the Grand Californian.  This year, we decided we didn't want to pay for the overpriced rooms at GC and so we booked a suite with breakfast here.  We were really pleased with the quick and friendly check-in and the cleanliness of the room.  With two adult kids, we need 3 beds to be comfortable.  This room had 2 Queens and a hide-a-bed - perfect for us!  The rooms have been updated with large tv's, new paint, and nice bed furnishings.  The breakfast is perfect for us - pastries, cereals, fruits, and drinks.  For the price and location, you cannot beat this hotel.
Manager Response: It is wonderful to hear we exceeded your expectations and thank you for writing a review.  It gives us great satisfaction when guests who usually stay at a Disneyland property, are greatly satisfied with out property.    We definitely look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: As others have mentioned you book this hotel because of it's location.  Not only is it closer to Disneyland and California Adventure than the parks own parking lots, but it's also walking distance to tons of restaurants, fast food, and shopping.  The room was clean, mini-fridge worked well, wifi worked great and the staff was very friendly.  We did not take part in the included breakfast which was next door at a buffet restaurant, our friends did and said it was fine.  The only negatives kind of come from the giant positive of location...Parking and Noise.  We arrived just before midnight, yet had to have our car out by 3pm the next day.  That seemed kind of unfair and made it so we now had to drive to the Disney parking lot instead of being able to just walk across to the park
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We do greatly appreciate all feedback from our guests.  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay and that you will be coming back.  I do apologize for the teenagers.  Late in the evening we do have a security guard roaming the property.  However if there are any problems, please call the desk.  Someone is here 24 hrs a day to address any situations. As far as the parking, since we do have limited parking, we need to ensure guests arriving for the day have a spot available.  Check out time is 11am.  Instead of having guests move their vehicle at their check out time, we do provide the courtesy of extending parking until 3pm.  However at 3pm guests that have checked out must move their vehicles.  This allows guests with a guaranteed check in of 3pm to have a place to park.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: You could not get any closer than this hotel to the main entrance of Disneyland. It was right across the street.  The room was great, I loved the decor, I wanted to take the pillows home with me. There was a huge long vaniety with mirror and sink, separate from the bath and toilet.  We only paid $99.00 and that included a continental breakfast.  Parking was $8.00 but big deal. It was very quiet, no people noise or street noise, and the staff was great.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your room and your stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you during a future visit.  Take care

Summary: Our family of 5 (kids aged 7, 9, 12) stayed at BW last spring break.  The rooms were clean and spacious enough for a our family of 5 as our oldest slept on the pullout sofa.  There are a lot of hotels along this stretch of road that are very close to Disney but none closer than the BW,  It is literally right at the cross walk to Disney.  The breakfast is pretty bad but it's free.  Eating donuts for breakfast was cool for our kids the first couple days but even they tired of it after that.  Every day we left the park for lunch and a swim since there are lots of affordable restaurants within minutes walking from our hotel.  Captain Kidd's buffet next door (same buidling where the free breakfast is served) was very affordable and had decent selection but once was enough for us.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of our property.  It is always wonderful to hear guests have enjoyed their stay with us.  The breakfast does currently include Biscuits and Gravy, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, oatmela, toast, bagels, muffins and fruits.  Additional items are coming soon. We hope to see you again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Affordable & clean convenience, with top rate resort quality servive at ALL hours!
Summary: Was very pleased that the rooms and grounds were very clean and roomy, and each of the personnel were so helpful and professional.  The only draw back that I found was the motel style buildings with exterior corridors and difficult crowded parking...it is not good when a woman with small children is loading/unloading multiple luggage in the rain dragging my little ones and pushing a stroller- in many trips.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay.  I am sorry it was difficult for you unloading/loading your bags due to the exterior corridors and our limited parking.  We would be very happy to have you stay with us again.  Please know that if you need any help while staying with us, we will help you in any way we can.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: It’s all about location when you go to Disneyland and this place has the best location you can get.  From reading the reviews I wasn’t expecting much from this hotel but as soon as I walked in the room I was extremely surprised.  Everything was clean, the bathroom and sink area looked to be recently remodeled. This is the sixth hotel I have stayed at when going to Disneyland and can honestly say it’s the best one to date. Keep in mind its no Four Seasons but for what you pay for, and the location, you can’t get much better. This will be our go to hotel in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  I am extremely pleased that we exceeded your expectations.  We definitely look forward to having you stay with us again.  Thank you and take care

Summary: Just returned from a Disneyland vacation and stayed at the Best Western Park Place Inn.  Although not fancy it was great for our purposes.  Super convenient access to the park.  The room was clean and nicely appointed.  The pullout bed that my son had to sleep on was pretty awful  (sagged in the middle) but he didn't complain.  The breakfast was basic;  boiled eggs, toast, danishes, bagels,cereal and fresh fruit.  We enjoyed out stay and would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am very happy that you will be back to stay with us.  I am sorry the sofa bed was sagging in the middle.  We do want all of our guests to be comfortable in our rooms.  I know if a child does not get a good nights sleep, it can make the whole trip miserable.  If you feel anything in your room needs fixed or replaced, please let us know and we will do our absolute best to make it right for you.  In the case of our sofa beds, we do usually have replacement sofa bed mattresses.  We look forward to seeing you again.  Thank you and take care

Summary: this hotel is ideal for going to disneyland.  It is close even closer than the disneyland hotel.  The rooms were clean and very comfortable.  Staff was friendly and accomodating.  I would recommend this to everyone just for location alone.  Did not go into the continental breakfast but my husband said it looked good.  Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.  I am glad your husband enjoyed the continental breakfast.  Hopefully the next time you stay with us, you will get to enjoy the improved breakfast as well as your husband.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: great location right across the street from the main Disneyland entrance.  Make going and coming really easy.    Average Rooms, limited parking (1 car per room and they really mean it)   contiental breakfast limited, not a lot of selections, seating limited.   If you think you'll feed the family before going to the park it won't work.  IHOP and McD's nearby.  I would stay here again just because of the location
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  All reviews help us to improve our service to our guests.  We do hope to have you stay with us on a future visit to the Disneyland Area.  Our preparations are almost complete for an upgraded continental breakfast.  We will be introducing pancakes, scrambled eggs, and sausage.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: As Close To Disneyland As You Can Get
Summary: This isn’t the nicest or flashiest hotel in the Disneyland area, but it is the closest to the pedestrian entrance and for that reason is worth staying at. Including taxes and fees, I paid  $434.36 for five nights, an excellent rate for the convenience. The rooms are basic, clean and quite large. I stayed in a King bed room. The staff were all helpful, the deadlock inside my room wouldn’t engage so I went to the front desk to ask if it could be fixed and the maintenance guy was at my door waiting when I returned to my room (I went straight back), I was blown away by how quick it was. The gift shop in the lobby is very reasonably priced, especially in comparison to neighbouring mini marts. There are any restaurants in close walking distance, including McDonalds, iHop and Dennys.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  It is wonderful to see you enjoyed your stay with us and that you were pleased with your interactions with our staff.  We look forward to seeing you here again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: I recently spent 5 nights at this Best Western in Anaheim, and was extremely pleased with the quality of the furnishings, the cleanliness of the room, the front desk staff and the cleaning staff.   My only complaint is that the building doesn't have gutters and on the two days that it rained this caused  waterfalls over the exterior stairways; there is, however an alternative exit.  The complementary breakfast was only so-so, lacking any hot foods.    We had 4 staying in the room and there was plenty of space for everyone.  We were attending a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center which was a very pleasant 15 minute walk away.  An entrance to Disneyland was right across the street.  There were numerous places for a quick meal within a 10 minute walk.   The entire area was
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We appreciate hearing back from our guests.  We look forward to you staying with us again.  By then we should have pancakes, sausage and scrambled eggs included with our breakfast.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We stayed at this BW right next to the Disneyland entrance in early January 2012 for 3 nights. We consider ourselves "Disney pro's", having been 3 times now. For us it was about location; picking the best decent hotel as close as possible, because our approach to Disney has us get there early, leave mid afternoon, and return in the evening. All without having to take out a mortgage. This place seemed to fit the bill.  Pro's: 1. Location: WOW. It is literally the closest lodging to Magic Kingdom possible, even more than the horrible, disappointing and overpriced Disney offerings (we stayed at the horrible, overpriced Grand Californian last time; see my TA review). A 5-10 minute walk has you at the MK or DCA gates. So this place is good if you want to leave the parks and rest or
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such a detailed review of our property.  It will help us focus on needed areas of improvement.  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay with us.  We do look forward to having you stay with us again.  For a more pleasant stay your next visit, I would like to address a couple of points.  The AC units used daily.  If the one in your room seems too loud, please let us know.  If it needs replaced, it can be done in about 10 minutes with a new one.  We do have two elevators available.  They are on opposite sides of the pool.  For our continental breakfast, it appears there may be a misunderstanding of where ours is located.  It is next door at Captain Kidds but is not part of their buffet.  We host breakfast on their second floor.  It consists of biscuits and gravy, bagels, toast, muffins, cereal, fruit, oatmeal, yogurt, juices, coffee and milk.  We are also in the process of introducing pancakes, scrambled eggs and sausage.  We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We stayed at the Park Place Inn for one night in January.  We have previously stayed here on other trips to Disneyland.  We were surprised to find a king room her for $89 on a Saturday night (AAA rate), so it was no question whether or not we would pick this hotel for that night. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were quickly checked in and given our parking pass.  Parking is $8/night, but this is becoming pretty standard for hotels around Disneyland.  Our room wasn't ready yet since we checking in before 2:00, so we parked the car and headed over to Disneyland for a bit.  You can't beat the location of this property!  We came back just after 3:00 and were given room 163, which is on the north side of the property. The accommodations were pretty standard for the Best Westerns in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just spent three nights at the Park Place Inn. You absolutely can't beat the location, there is nothing closer to Disney. Parking was convenient. The room was clean and quiet, but the bed wasn't the most comfortable. Breakfast was mediocre at best, but it was free so it's hard to complain. I would consider returning on a future visit, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
Manager Response: We do appreciate you taking the time to write a review of our property.  All information guests provide to us will help us improve our service.  Unfortunately we will not be able to provide items such as omelettes because we do not have a restaurant onsite.  However, we are updating our breakfast and will soon provide sausage and scrambled eggs as well as pancakes in addition to our other offerings.  We do hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care,

Summary Heading: nice property but service not personal
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights during a road trip which was a recovery from cancer treatment trip. I booked the room well in advance and explained we wanted a room close to the front of the motel, up on the third floor to have a quiet room, for health reasons. When we arrived we were given a room at the very back of the motel down on the first floor. I had even phoned directly to confirm my requests ahead of time. I explained about my requests, but because we checked in late at about 9 pm. they were completely full so we had no choice. Because of my treatment, I was very tired and seriously the walk from the back of the motel to the front, is as long as the walk from the front of the motel to the Disneyland gates! I suppose I could have asked for a handicap room, I don't know if
Manager Response: First I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your stay with us.  I am sorry you were disappointed with your stay.  If you were located on the first floor in the back of the property that means you were reserved in a room with a King Size bed.  These are located on the first floor with only 2 on the third floor.  We never guarantee locations of rooms, it is only on a request basis due to the possibility of guests already occupying rooms from previous day arrivals, guests not checking out or extending their stays or any unforseen problems that may occur.  I do apologize we were not able to get you closer to the front of the property.  I would not know the reason without knowing exactly when you were here.  Again I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay.  We will have an upgraded breakfast soon with sausage, scrambled eggs and pancakes.  Again I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay.  I hope you will give us another chance to show you what our customer service is really like.  Take care

Summary: We stayed here for the 2nd time Oct 22-31st.  It was great.  We did not spend to much time in our room, most of the time was at Disneyland or in the pool.  Kids loved playing in the pool with Dad, I loved the hot tub.  We stayed in a suite room, on the 3rd floor.  It was nice and quiet.  Small, but worked for us and our 11 year old kids.  The breakfast needs work, that would be our only complaint.  It was fine for myself, but my pickier family wanted more selection.  We are not use to eating pastries as our breakfast, and warmer options would be nice.  No other complains it is a great place to stay, very close to the park.. we came back to the room a couple times in the day to drop stuff off and it did not take us long at all to get to and from the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for you review of our property.  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Within the next month or so we will be introducing new breakfast items.  We hope these new items will better satisfy the pickier eaters.  Having two small boys, I totally understand trying to satisfy them when on trips.  We do hope to see you again soon.  Take care

Summary: My husband and I took our 1 and 2 year old to their first trip to Disneyland Dec. 15-19 and were very pleased with our stay at the Park Place Inn. We had a very friendly welcoming upon arrival and were to our spacious king size room within minutes on the first floor.  I had called two days upon arrival to request a crib and verified upon check-in that one would be in the room, but did not have one when we walked in. We called the front desk after we got our things unpacked and one was brought to us promptly. That would be the only reason why I didn't rate 5 stars; everything else was great.   I don't see anything mediocre about the Captain Kidd's continental breakfast; it was actually the best continental breakfast I have had with plenty of a selection. Plus it was nice not
Manager Response: I greatly appreciate your review of our property.  I am so very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  I am sorry you did not have the crib in your room when you arrived.  We do try to have these placed in the rooms prior to arrival when requested.  We do hope to see you again in December.  Thank you and take care

Summary Heading: Perfect location to Disneyland And California Adventure
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights last week and we were very happy with our choice of hotel.  We usually stay on Disney property but decided to save some money this time around and were very happy we did!!  The rooms are very clean, beds are comfortable as are the pillows, there is decent water pressure for the shower (which usually stink in a hotel), and the room was kept comfortable with the air conditioner - though it was a bit loud.  Room was well equipped with a microwave and fridge that fit our needs.  We ate the free continental breakfast at Captain Kidds only once (not huge breakfast eaters), and it was fine for free.  Bagels, hard boiled eggs and the usual you would find for no cost.  The best part about the hotel was the location to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Right
Manager Response: I greatly appreciate you taking the time to write this review of our property.  I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay.  I am very disappointed with the impression that you were left with at check out.  I undertand your feeling of the lack of customer service these days.  However I am taking immediate steps to ensure the simplest acts of customer service are not overlooked at our property.  We do care about your experience with us.  I want to make sure that our guests are pleased with our service from first contact until departure and any time after.  I do hope we will see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We have stayed at the Best Western Park Place Inn several times, and our recent visit over the Christmas holidays 2011, was exceptional.  The front desk staff at check-in was very welcoming and friendly.  When making our reservation (for a mini-suite) several months prior to our arrival, I had requested to have a room on the 3rd floor, as it has been suggested in other reviews that it is quieter.  This request  was accommodated and throughout our 8 day visit, we did not notice any noise. Our room was recently updated (with new bedding) and appeared to be clean.  The large refrigerator was very useful for water & juice.  I would prefer a little more lighting in the room, but still seemed brighter than previous visits.  The water pressure was more than satisfactory, and there was
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am very pleased that you had an enjoyable stay with us and we were able to accomodate your requests..  We are working on improving our breakfast and you should see some positive results in a couple of months.  We hope to see you again soon so we can continue to provide you with the service for which you have complimented us.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This is directly across from Disneyland. It's clean and  convenient to chain restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice place across the street from Disneyland.  Quiet.  Good breakfast at restaurant.  The shower did not turn on easily but the water pressure was fine.  Front desk was very helpful.  Great deal for the price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am sorry you had a little trouble with the shower.  Please let us know if you ever have trouble with something so we can make sure it is fixed for you and future guests. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care,

Summary: This hotel is on the crosswalk for the entrance to Disneyland, no need for a shuttle just a short walk which is so nice after spending the day walking around Disney.  The room we had was perfect for a 7 night stay, fridge, microwave, tons of room for 4 large suitcases and still room for all our purchases. Never once did we feel like we didn't have enough space. The front desk staff was nothing but helpful, when we needed a taxi, they called and it came fast. When we needed laundry done they sent it out and had it done, only $25 for a huge bag full. Cheap and worth it!!  I see alot of people complaining about the breakfast but seriously we had coffee, juice, bagels, donuts, fruit and cereal, it was free and we were satisfied and the kids were happy.  We will definitely stay here
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  I am pleased you enjoyed your time with us.  We look forward to welcoming you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We stayed here the weekend of Dec 9th-12th. You cannot beat the location of the hotel. Across the street and there you are! We had 11 people in 3 rooms and although our rooms were spread out across the property, we didn't have to go too far to get to the other rooms. The rooms themselves are decently big for 2-4 people. The mini-suite is nothing more then a standard room with a pull out couch. Parking is a bit of a challenge, but we ended up finding spots in the back of the property, where 2 of our 3 rooms were anyway. Overall I was pretty pleased. I'd stay here again just because its just so much nicer not to have to catch a shuttle or walk too far to get to our beds.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We appreciate the feedback our guests provide.  We do look forward to having you stay with us once again.  Next time hopefully we will have your rooms closer to each other.  Please make note that it is easier to provide rooms next to each other if they are the same room type.  Thank you and take care,

Summary: Stayed at this hotel Dec 1-9 , The location is Key. We stayed in rm 305, stayed here 6 times in the previous years and have looked at other places but always returned here, Found out later we were on a smoking floor but would have never known it. They did have work being done on the roof which was a bit noisy but we didn't come to sleep in :). Rooms are clean and spacious, and the staff is friendly. cons are the parking charges and stalls are tight., Clean room, and proximity to the parks are great. I would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I do apologize regarding the noise from the roof repairs.  However, despite the roof repairs I am pleased to see you enjoyed your stay with us.  We do look forward to you staying with us again.  Thank you and take care,

Summary: Just back from a three night stay at this property. This was our second trip to Disneyland and our last stay was at a hotel that was a 20 minute walk from the entrance. This time, we wanted to be close. For those of you searching for a closer hotel--this is it. Besides the Grand Californian (which is on the property), I belive this would be the closest ou could get to the Disneyland entrance. We had family staying at the Disneyland hotel and they had  a longer walk than us! Don't be fooled though--this is not a Hilton, Westin or Four Seasons. You are getting a average to below average property in a great location. The service from the front desk people and other staff is very good. The room cleanliness was acceptable, the property itself is in dire need of an upgrade. I felt
Manager Response: I would first like to thank you for taking time to write a review of our property.  Your comments will help us improve our service and our property for future guests.  I am sorry that you did not entirely enjoy your stay with us.  I do hope you will reconsider and give us another chance.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We stayed here December 1-6.   Unfortunately, the Grand Californian (where we stayed last trip) was not in our budget this trip, and we wanted to be as close as possible to the parks.  We were very pleased with our stay.  The room was nice as well as clean; the bed very comfortable, and we took advantage of the microwave and fridge to compliment the free breakfast (after a trip to Target 2 miles away).  As others have stated, the breakfast is sparse (everyone looked pretty grumpy eating it also), but it is free.   Management - I would suggest adding some different flavors of yogurt, bananas and some condiments for the hard boiled eggs (at least hot sauce!).  Also, a toaster out on the line so that guests could have hot toast and bagels if desired would be great (ended up eating
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  We definitely look, forward to you visiting us again.  We will be offering new breakfast options after the first of the year.  Also we do have attendants on hand at breakfast.  They will be more than happy to toast or heat up items that we serve.  We hope to see you soon.    Thank you and take care

Summary: We stayed at this hotel November 27-December 1, 2011. I thought that this place was outstanding. The staff was very helpful, the beds were comfortable, warm showers with plenty of water pressure and right on the corner across the street from Disneyland.   The only thing I could say they need to work on is the continental breakfast, yes it was free but yuck.   I will def stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a great place to stay for our trip to DLR.  it was clean, the staff was VERY helpful. and all went on without a hitch.  We got our reservations for 2 rooms about 2 months in advance thru Costco.  When I paid the bill in full I contacted the hotel to see that the rooms could be side by side or at least close to each other. They said they would "see what they could do".  I expected from other experiences they it would likely be close but not too close.  Well they gave us side by side in the 3rd floor with a view of Disneyland.  (although the Palm trees were blocking Space mountain but you can expect them to cut down the street trees)  We have stayed at the Fairfield and the Disneyland hotel in recent years and the Park Plus was a bit above the Fairfield and a bit below
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are looking for an ok room near Disneyland this place is great.  We loved that you could walk to the main gate in 5 minutes or so.  We were on the third floor in the back, which was nice and quiet.  Overall though this is a fairly dated hotel and is due for an update.  Things like 12 channels of low def TV on a old tube tv seem pretty non-standard to us these days.  But, we came into town for just one night then were hitting the park all day the next day and this hotel is super convenient for that.  Few things that were bother some.  When we showed up the fridge was turned way down and was not even cold.  We did not have much to put in there, but would have been nice to have it semi cold when we arrived.  We could have asked for another room I suppose but seemed like a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were really happy for the most part, the room was really nice.  It was clean, had a fridge and micro which is always nice.  Pros, location, room size, clean, friendly staff.  Cons whomever was above us made noise at all hours of the night and day, parking spots hard for a large vehicle and although we didn't use the pool it was very small.  Overall we were happy with our stay and had it not been for our noisy neighbors I would have been completely satisfied.  Oh and you just can't beat the location.  It makes noisy neighbors more bearable....
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our hotel.  I am pleased that your stay was for the most part very enjoyable.  I apologize for the noise from the other guests.  For a more enjoyable stay please let us know if other guests are being inconsiderate. We address the situations discreetly and do not think of it as complaining or petty.  We want all of our guests to enjoy their stay but also ask that they be respectful of others.  We hope to see you soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Service, Location, Clean Room, and the Mouse!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for the first time on a recent trip to Disneyland. We would definitely stay here again based on the cleanliness of the rooms and location. If you have a stroller, the bottom level is great. Pack everything up and roll it out and across the street - no messing with elevators, trams, etc. This makes all the difference for us.  I thought the beds and pillows were very comfortable and the room was reasonably quiet. The A/C worked, but did struggle a bit to cool the place down. Not horrible, but we like things on the crisp side in our room. The mini fridge and micro were great to have and helped us save money by bringing some of our own food and not eating out all the time.  The cleaning staff was very friendly and thorough. Our room was clean when we arrived
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide a review of your stay at our property.  I am very pleased to see that you enjoyed your time at the Best Western Plus Park Place Inn and Mini-Suites.  The complimentary breakfast is in the process of being updated.  After the first of the year we will have new offerings that we hope will appeal to more of our guests.  We look forward to you visiting us again soon.  Take care and thank you

Summary: My friends have been staying at this BW for years now so that's why I picked this hotel.  Here's a rundown of positives and negatives:  Pro's 1.  Directly across the street from the maingate at Disneyland 2.  Nice bedding and comfy pillows 3.  Towels were pretty soft  4.  Free continental breakfast at Captain Kidd's buffet 5.  Free internet and Free printing at the computer desk in the lobby  Con's 1. Be prepared to hear the running of children, honking of car horns by 6:30 AM.  I'd book the second floor and up next time. 2. Charge for parking $8/day 3. Continental breakfast didn't have hot chocolate- what on earth??   4. Like to see nicer travel size shampoo, soap etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  Letting us know what you liked and disliked is greatly appreciated.  This information will help us evaluate and improve our service to our guests.  We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We booked this because it was close enough to Disneyland to walk, but far enough away to be a bit less expensive. Clean rooms, comfy beds. Easy walk to Disneyland made it worth it to us.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our property.  I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Please let us know what we could do to make your stay even more enjoyable.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Yes, this hotel really does have the best location to Disneyland of the hotels on Harbor Boulevard. It's closer to the main gate than the Disneyland Hotel.   They really seem to put a high standard on customer service. We went to the front desk for a few minor issues and questions, and we left with all the answers. They were even able to accommodate our adjoining room request. They did a few extra things as well, such as leaving a note and giving us a call to remind us about Daylight Savings time.  The rooms are spotless, the towels plentiful, and the soap and shampoos were replaced every day. Plus, the shower has really strong water pressure.The continental breakfast has lots of options, including yogurt and hard-boiled eggs, so you're not just on carb overload.   I can't
Manager Response: Thank you for writing the wonderful review of our property.  It is always wonderful and helpful to see what pleases our guests so we can continue providing the service our guests expect.   I am very pleased to see that we exceeded your expectations and we will strive to do so everytime you stay with us.  We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Booked for the location and werent disappointed
Summary: My wife booked this motel for us online based on it's close proximity to the park entrance & reasonable price.  We certainly werent disappointed with what we got, it was pretty much what we expected & right about what we needed (somewhere to sleep - most of our waking hours were spent at nearby attractions!).  Not super nice, but no major flaws/problems during our week there & it was about as close to the park as one can get without staying at a disney hotel.   The staff was helpful & friendly enough when we had questions.  The breakfast was what weve come to expect from these types of places - serviceable for a quick bite before heading across the road, but really nothing more.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our property.  Your review will help us determine where we need to improve.  I am pleased you enjoyed your stay.  We will have an updated complimentary breakfast after the first of the year.  Thank you and take care. We hope we will see you again soon.

Summary: If location is very important to you this property is ideal.  It is literally across the street from Disneyland/CA Adventure's main gates.  Easy walk!  We stayed 5 days and did not get back into our car until it was time to go home.  There are tons of restaurants and things to do close by (other then the parks).  The rooms are average size with comfortable beds, mini frig and microwave.  The free breakfast was light, but perfect if you just need something to get you started for the day (cereal, muffins, fruit, coffee & juice).  Our family of 5 ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and took extra apples and coffee into the park and it was perfect.  The only other thing I would say is if carpets are important to you beware of this property because the floors could definitely
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  It is very helpful for us to read our guests comments so we know where we are excelling and where improvement is required.  I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  I do hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We go to Disneyland a lot, and about half the time we stay here.  While its a bit more expensive, the prime location justifies the price.  When you spend all day walking around Disneyland, the fewer steps to your room the better!  Also, we like that they have sofa beds in the "mini suite" rooms, which means we can fit a lot of people in each room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Four months ago, I reserved two rooms online for our trip with our grandchildren - we let their parents tag along.  Booking online - I had to book each room separately.  When the hotel was smart enough to combine the reservations when e-mailing the confirmation - I figured they'd also be smart enough to know we'd at least like to be on the same floor and on the same side of the hotel.  This was not the case on check-in and I was not happy.  The manager on duty when we checked in, I believe her name was Sherry, came to our rescue.  We had to compromise by giving up our King bed on the ground floor, and since we can't climb stairs - we had the hastle of walking an additional distance to the elevator, but Sherry came up with a better than expected solution - and made this Grandma
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review and letting us know of your experience with our hotel.  I am pleased Sherry was able to find a solution to the room situation.  As you mentioned, it is much easier to place guests' rooms next to each other if it is the same room type.  Our Kings are mostly on the first floor.  Our Doubles are over the lobby and surround the pool, while the Mini Suites are throughout the second and third floors.  I hope this information will help you and others when making reservation plans. We are updating our breakfast.  However, for the bagels and toast, we do have a breakfast attendent.  If anything needs to be toasted or warmed, the attendent will be more than happy to do it for you.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland, just average accomodationsd
Summary: We have stayed here a few times now and love the location for visiting Disneyland. The staff is very friendly but the accommodations are just ok. I also think they can be a little pricey for what they offer. All in all if the price is right we would stay here again.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.   I am sorry you are not completely satisfied with the accomodations.  However,  I am pleased that you do enjoy your stay with us.  Thank you for letting us know where we need to improve.  I hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Great Location great place to stay
Summary: Stayed for 9 nights during Sept-Oct. Room was large enough for two adults and three teenagers. Stayed on third floor and watched Disney fireworks from balcony. Literally two minutes walk from Motel to Disney.Longest part was waiting for traffic lights to change. Room clean and staff were excellent and polite. Breakfast good (continental) but fresh everyday. Plenty of Cafes within walking distance and also McDonalds.  Would highly recommend this property.
Manager Response: We appreciate it when our guests take their time to write a review of our property.  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  The entire staff works very hard to ensure that you have an enjoyable stay.  I do hope that we see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: I recently stayed at the Park Place Inn, and have stayed there multiple times before in the past.   However it was before the motel added the paid parking, which i find to be not very convenient, and an added expense, since you must use a card to even get in and out of the parking, and since the motel is small anyway it makes things feel even more tight since you feel as if you are walled off from the street area.   Some of the motels along Harbor Blvd have added this parking fee.  Because of the paid parking, they now will not allow you to leave your car there the day you check out past thier regular checkin time at 3pm which is also very inconvenient if you want to spend the rest of the day inside Disneyland.  I found my rooms to be clean and nice as expected and service from
Manager Response: First I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  All comments help us to improve our service.  I am happy to see that you did enjoy your stay with us and that our rooms and service have lived up to what you expect.   I am sorry that you found the parking gates to be an incovenience.  Vehicles have always been required to leave by 3pm however, before the gates it was quite difficult to enforce the policy.  The policy is in place due to our limited parking.  We do extend parking beyond the 11 am check out to 3 pm to help accomodate our guests.  However, we can not extend it beyond 3pm so we can ensure guests arriving that evening have a place to park.  The card access has significantly reduced the number of non guests using our parking lot (for easy access to Disneyland) ensuring that our hotel guests have a place to park.  If you have any further questions or concerns, please give us a call. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We've stayed at other Good Neighbor hotels, this was the first time at this property. We always had too many in our party for one room, and it was less expensive to get 1 room somewhere else than 2 rooms. Now that they've got the mini-suite, we fit! Okay, location: great. Same walking distance to the entrance as the Disneyland Hotel, without all the temptations of Downtown Disney along the way (that's a plus and a minus). Room (mini-suite) was fine, 2 queens and a queen sofa sleeper. Only 1 bathroom/shower, separate sink area though, so one could shower while another did sink stuff. Clean. A little noisy at times, but not too bad. Parking was a bit tricky though, and having to pay for it in addition to the room is a minus. The parking lot is made for smaller vehicles, driving in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  The information you provided will definitely help us in our goal to improve our property and our service.  Some helpful information in case of future visits:  We do have two elevators.  They are located on opposite sides of the pool to provide access to the front and back half of the property.  Access traveling south on Harbor is just as easy as from the north.  When traveling south you would make a left turn into our driveway from the East Shuttle Entrance traffic signal.  I am pleased you enjoyed our hotel.  We do look forward to having you and your family staying with us again.  Take care.

Summary: We stayed here fror 8 days we had a room on the ground floor which was 15-18m away from the traffic lights to go across the road and into the wonderful world of Disneyland.  We could not have asked for a better positioned hotel, across the road was the bus stop to walmart No 43 straight down harbour blvd to McFadden Street cost $1.50 each way.  There is also a bus stop directly infront of the hotel which is where you pick up the grayline buses to be taken to their terminal for Universal, Sea World, San Diego etc. A continental breakfast was supplied daily by going into the Captain Kid restaurant next door consisting of cereal, toast bagels muffins tea and coffee.  Plenty of places to eat lunch or dinner just nearby.  The staff were always very accommodating, we will stay here
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to review our property.  It is greatly appreciated.  I am very pleased that you had a wonderful stay.  We do look forward to having you with us once again.  If there is anything we can help you with during your next stay, please let us know.   Thank you and take care.

Summary: Clean  comfortable accommodation. Pleasant staff and a good convenient location for Disney Land made this hotel an excellent place to stay. The price was moderate and an excellent all day buffet next door at reasonable price was an advantage. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  We do appreciate "hearing" from our guests regarding their stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you once again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: GREAT place to stay for Disney!!
Summary: REALLY, TRULY across the street from the park entrance. Lots of hotels say they are right across from the park. I suppose technically they are, as the park takes up acres and acres and there can be hundreds of hotels "across" from the park.But, this one is directly by the walk up entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure not "across"from the farthest corner of the park and you have to walk a mile to the entrance. The rooms are nice, clean and you have a little room to spread out with the mini suite. Microwave and refrigerator were clean and worked well. Wireless Internet was so-so/variable. But it was free. The parking is charged for but you really do get a spot to park in- some places charge and it's first come first served for spaces so you could be paying for a spot that
Manager Response: I would first like to thank you for taking time to write such a wonderful review.  We can definitely learn from all reviews our property receives.  Reviews such as yours let us know what we are doing correctly to please our guests,so we can continue providing the same kind of service.  We greatly look forward to having you stay with us once again.  Please let us know if we can be of any assistance during a future visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: One of the hotel nearest to Disneyland's entrance. Can't beat that. We had the mini suite (2 queens, fridge and microwave). It was clean. No complaints. We went for the free breakfast next door. It's very basic. We weren't impressed by the hard boiled eggs as it tasted sour. If it helps, iHop is just next door and McD is a couple of doors down the street.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  I am sorry you were not pleased with the breakfast.  However, we are currently taking the steps to introduce new breakfast options.  We do hope to see you again and that you find the breakfast more enjoyable on a future visit.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Across the street to entrance for Disneyland & California land.
Summary: You are across the street and entrance from Disneyland & California land.  Lots of hotels say they are across the street, and technically they are, but you have to walk a long way or take a bus to get an entrance.  No other hotel is closest to the main entrance, not even the Disney hotels.   To get to Downtown Disney is a walk, especially when the monorail is broken.  But you are closer to the parks than even their hotels.   Free hot breakfast at Captain Kidd’s restaurant next door and up their steps.  Decent.  Had dinner there too, and it was convenient, but not the best.   Because I wanted this hotel (our 2d stay there, 1st stay we used the pool and hot tub, did not use it this time), I could only get different rooms each night from the website.  About two weeks before I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our property.  We do appreciate hearing from our guests.  I am pleased we were able to make your stay more enjoyable by accomodating in the same room during your stay. We look forward to seeing you during a future visit.  Please contact us if you need anything.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We were very impressed with the large, comfortable and exceptionally clean rooms. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, including the wonderful Ross who owns an independent car rental company in the hotel lobby (GREAT experience). We were very impressed; breakfast was a nice touch and yes, the property is literally right across the street from DL's entrance which made it incredibly easy to go back to the room for a nap. Overall great!
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  I am very pleased that our rooms exceeded your expectations.  I will also pass on your comments to Ross.  We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Well worth the 115$ per night. Room was a little stale, but it had free breakfast.  Best part is it's CLOSER than the Disneyland Hotel for far cheaper. A great value
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  Please let us know what you would like to see to improve our rooms.  We do hope to see you again soon.  Take care,

Summary: After not being able to book the Park Vue Inn,  we decided that the Park Place inn and suites was the next best option.  We are a family of five and booked one ot thier mini suites which worked perfectly for us.  The room was clean and the beds were soft.  They provided every amenity that we needed.  We spent every day in one park or another, so the room was really just sleep and storage.   Pros:  can't beat the location,  five minute walk even with a five year old.  Comfortable room.  Very good service.  Free continental breakfast Cons:  You pay eight dollars a day to park.  Breakfast was so so,  but I guess it will be improving shortly.  (those were the only reason that park vue was our first choice.
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  I am pleased that we exceeded your expectations.  I do hope we will see you again during a future visit to Anaheim.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: It's been a long time since I've slept on such comfortable hotel beds. Of course, we were very tired from long Disneyland days, and would have slept well, no matter. But none of us woke up with stiff or sore backs. That's always a good sign. The room we had was very quiet, clean and tidy. Housekeeping was punctual in bringing us some extras that we requested. They were at our room within five minutes of our call. There is no hotel closer to Disneyland. The breakfast in the morninig is adequate but rather 'ho-hum'. There is no way that a disabled person can access the continental breakfast, as it is on the second floor and there are only stairs. But the hotel guest book suggests asking the hostess for help. Please don't rely on a wake-up call. Luckily, I woke up in time to make
Manager Response: I would first like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We definitely appreciate the positive comments.  But you also help us by letting us know where we may have made mistakes.  I am sorry that we missed your wake up call.  It definitely should not have happened.  You should be able to rely on us to call you at the time you requested.  There is a computer generated wake up call as well as a follow up by the Front Desk.  Again I am sorry that your call was missed.  Regarding the breakfast, you will be able to enjoy new breakfast options after the first of the year.  There will be new items introduced to improve the quality of the breakfast. We do look forward to having you stay with us again. And again thank you for the positive review of our property.   Thank you and take care,

Summary: Just returned from our second stay at this hotel.  Chosen again for the closeness to Disneyland.  Probably closest to the main entrance to the park - even closer than the Disney hotels.    Just a couple of downsides to our stay.  No in-room safe to lock up our valuables.  They do offer free of charge boxes down in the main lobby but but note they are very small and we could not fit in over half the stuff we wanted to lock up.   Secondly - while they do offer a bare minimum continental breakfast nothing special was offered to any of the partcipants who were running in the Disney half marathon.  I do know that several other hotels were offering a quick breakfast to race participants before the race but nothing was open for guests at the Park Place Inn.  Hopefully this will change
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am sorry we did not have a safety deposit box that fit your needs.  However, for guests that do have larger items we offer the option of providing you with a claim check and holding the item in the back office. Regarding the breakfast: We lease our breakfast space from the restaurant next door so unfortunately we are not able to provide breakfast earlier than 6:30 am.  We do hope we will see you again.  Take care

Summary: We've stayed here for the past few years during our annual Disneyland half marathon and family fun runs.  They are located at the perfect location and offer reasonable rates.  We were very happy with our room which was spacious with huge counter area for our amenities, good sitting area, mini refrigerator and tv.  They hotel staff was very accommodating with our room requests which helped with our runs.   We were able to partake in the breakfast one morning which includes muffins, breads, danishes, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal and biscuits and gravy with milk, coffee, juice and hot water for tea.  It was adequate but would have liked to see maybe a self-serve waffle station.  But overall, good for a quick bite.  The kids enjoyed the pool.  We are very pleased with Best
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review for our property.  We are very pleased that you enjoyed  your stay with us and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  There will be new breakfast options available after the first of the year.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: When we visit Disneyland we stay at the Park Place!  We've become Rewards Members because we've liked this hotel so much. Rooms come with a mini Frig, and microwave, older model TV, and comfy beds, with lots of pillows, plus free wifi. At check in our room was not ready, so we just walked across the street to Disney all day.  The next morning we noticed that the maid did not pick up the last guest messes on the floor near the couch, near the bed table and on the side near the closet.  We thought for sure that it would be taken care of the next day, but NO, when we got back after midnight all the same left over mess was still there.  If the maid misses obvious things what is she not cleaning, I did not even look under the bed!!! The Free breakfasts are the usual, dry cereals,
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  All information helps us improve our customer service and lets us know what steps need to be taken.  I apologize for the items left in your room as well as the incident with the hot water.  After our general manager spoke with you she did investigate both incidents and is taking steps to ensure that this is not repeated.  We do hope to see you a gain soon.  We would like you to once again have the experience that brought you back to our hotel.    Take care and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We've stayed at the Park Place Inn a number of times over the years and I'm finally getting around to writing a review.   The location can't be beat for anyone visiting Disneyland.  Just right across the street and down the main pedestrian walkway and you're at the parks.   The microwave and fridge in the room are really handy and there are grocery stores close by to get supplies.  The breakfast in the restaurant next door is good, carb heavy but worthwhile to start your day.  They have cereals, fruit (apples & oranges), danish, donuts, toasted bagels, hard boiled eggs and warm biscuits and gravy.  The hotel had seemed to be getting a bit rundown on our last visits but it's looking better again this time.  The room was very clean, the bed was comfy and the air conditioner worked
Manager Response: We appreciate you reviewing our property.  We are very pleased that  you enjoyed your stay and that we can look forward to seeing you again as well as being introduced to your friends.  Please look for updated breakfast options coming in the new year.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Just a quick break before school starts.  Of course, location, location, location.  We found the hotel to be clean, the staff to be friendly and helpful.  Arranged a cab to be there for us this morning.  The PC and printer in the lobby is great for flight check-in.  The only downside is the breakfast, adding yogurt and a little more variety in fruit would help.  Overall, for us it was good value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  We look forward to you and your family staying with us again.  Please look for a change to our breakfast coming in the new year.  Thank you and take care

Summary: Great location!  Right across the street from Disneyland.  Unfortunately our carpet was filthy.  The carpet was dark green so is was hard to tell how dirty it was.  But our clean feet were DIRTY after walking on it.  It was like walking on black top.  We informed the management about the carpet.  They apologized and admited it had been awhile since the carpets had been cleaned and that steam cleaning was scheduled for the following week.  They definitely need to be more aware of the cleanliness of their rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comments.  All feedback helps to improve our service to our guests.  We do have a rotating cleaning schedule working on different areas of the property every month.  We do strive to ensure you have the cleanest rooms possible during your stay.  We do hope you will stay with us again.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Perfect  for families with young kids!!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights with a group of 10 people having connecting rooms. AMAZING location to Disneyland!! Perfect for quick walks back for naps and diaper refills. Front Desk was extremely helpful whenever we needed anything. Rooms were large and clean, need bigger coffee makers though. The breakfast is just like what everyone else has said, small and kind of gross. We ended up just using it for coffee and milk. If you hear super loud booms at night, don't worry it's just the fireworks. We will definetly be staying here again!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay.  Please look for new breakfast offerings coming in the new year.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care

Summary: We stayed at this Inn for 5 nights and found the following:  Pros: Across the street from Disneyland, Clean Rooms, Nice pool (but small) and Friendly Staff.  Cons: Breakfast was terrible.... typical continental breakfast but they added peeled hard boiled eggs (which upset my stomach) and biscuts/gravey - the biscuts were biscuts but the gravey I think was some sort of luke warm soup (runny and awful)! We ate there 2X and the Breakfast never changed we chose other options the remainder of our stay.  The beds are VERY soft. Ok for me, but sleepless nights for my husband. Third floor very loud our  room vibrated between 9:30-10:00pm everynight due to Disney's fireworks (never noticed that at other hotels in the area in past stays).
Manager Response: I am very sorry that your expectations were not met at our hotel.  We do hope you will stay with us again.  There will be new breakfast offerings in the new year.  Unfortunately there is nothing we can do regarding the Disneyland fireworks.  They are set off almost directly across from our hotel.  For the 15 minutes of fireworks, unfortunately the rooms in our property going to vibrate with the boom of the fireworks. Again, we do hope to see you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Perfect location, clean, nice pool, good value, helpful staff, comfortable.  Would not consider staying anywhere else for Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response.  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank  you and take care.

Summary Heading: You can't get any closer to Disneyland then this hotel!
Summary: I stayed here with a group of girl scouts last week and I was impressed with how close this hotel was to Disneyland in fact I think it's closer then the Disney Hotel!  It's clean, comfortable, and roomy.  Not a five star hotel but not shabby either.    The only reason I gave it four stars was the complimentary breakfast.  There weren't too many nutritional offerings but if you need just a few carbs to get your morning started then it works.  I just wished they offered more fresh fruit and healthier options but no one in my group complained about the doughnuts and cinnamon rolls.    I would stay here with my family in the future I'm not sure about the pricing since I was with a group but you can't beat the location.
Manager Response: It is wonderful to read that you enjoyed your stay with us.  The girls that come here every year are a great  bunch of girls and the chaperones do a wonderful job. We will have new breakfast offerings in the new year. We do hope to see you and your family sometime in the near future.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Closest hotel to Disneyland without being on property.
Summary: Our number one top priority was location, and this hotel has it.  Walk out the front door, cross the street and you are there!  The service was great, they even mailed my husband's expensive running shoes back to us when he left them in the room.  (On our dime.)  They were very friendly and gave great recommendations.   The family suites have been recently remodeled and are great for a family.  We had six people in our room, 2 adults 4 kids, and didn't feel overly crowded .   The pool area is nice, freezing cold, but it was December so what do you expect? The hot tub was huge and we spent a lot of time there after a day at the park.   The gift store in this hotel is a TREASURE!!!  Fun souvenirs at great prices.  I'd definitely check it out before spending 3 times as much across
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review of our property.  We are very pleased that your stay was enjoyable and that our staff was able to fulfill your expectations.  All our employees are willing to help you with anything you need.  Hopefully you will be able to visit us during a warmer part of the year.  The pool area is a little small but definitely still refreshing.  Thank you for your comments regarding the gift shop as well.  We do our best to stock it with nice but affordable souvenirs. We hope we will see you soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: Pros: Great Location!!, Great Location!!, Great Location!! to Disneyland.  This hotel is literally right across the street to the pedestrian entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Front Desk very helpful,  Needed a taxi early in the A.M. to go to John Wayne Airport and they lined everything up. The taxi was there right on time!!    Within walking distance to Bubba Gumps, Cheesecake Factory,    Took a taxi from the Amtrak Station to Hotel, Took a taxi from Hotel to the Angels baseball game and back to the hotel from the Game,  Very easy to get a taxi.  Rooms are very spacious, Clean, Quiet.  Cons:  Don't really have any.  Pool is small but didn't spend much time there.  Very pleased with this hotel,  If we go back to Disneyland we will 100% stay here again!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and the convenience of our location.  We look forward to having you as our guest again and hope to see you in the near future.  Take care

Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights for a quick solo trip to Disneyland before heading down to San Diego for business.  This was a standard motel room.  2 Queen beds and a pull-out sofa, that i did not pull out.  The room was clean.  The lighting is not great- very dark in the room.  The bathroom was fairly spacious and nice- again very clean.  The bathroom area actually had the brightest lights in the room.  The decor was... brown.  Very brown.  Carpet, chairs, table, bedding, entertainment center... all brown.  The fridge and microwave worked well and were good sized as was the TV.  It was a decent room and the bed was very comfy.    I got a AAA rate in September, so it was not very expensive at the time- $82/night.  It was a great value, especially since it was, say it with me now,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I am very pleased that we will be your first choice for your next visit to the area.  We look forward to having you as our guest once again.  Take care,

Summary: Hotel is OK, but the location just outside Disney land was fantastic. We only visited DL one day, but it was no problem walking to the hotel in the afternoon to change to warmer dress (needed in the evenings in July 2011).  Rooms are clean and OK - the pool area is 'so-so', and too small considering the number of kids using it! The breakfast has been seen better - but OK.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  We do appreciate hearing from all of our guests.  If there is anything specific you would like to see an improvement on, please let us know.  We would like input from our guests so we can make the next visit more enjoyable.  Take care,

Summary Heading: great location, but not much else
Summary: I recently stayed here for 4 nights with our 4 kids, ages 11 to 16, in a minisuite (2 Q beds and a Q pull out).  We have stayed near Disneyland many times but this was our first visit to this particular motel. Before we arrived, I had contacted the property to ask for a room near the elevator due to a recent broken foot and to inform them that I was having a rental scooter delivered to the front desk.   I was assured that would be no problem. The location of the motel is excellent, and the beds were comfortable for the few hours a day we were there.  The room is not particularly comfortable to 'hang out' in, so I am glad our plan was to spend our waking hours in the parks.   We were very pleased and appreciative to note that our room was indeed near the elevator.   Parking was a
Manager Response: We are very sorry that your stay with us was marred by the incident with the scooter.  Scooters of the same type have universal keys.  Unfortunately a guest using one of these keys took the scooter that was reserved for you.  We were unaware of this until the guest returned the scooter that evening.  We do not record delivery of scooters in our computer and were not aware there was a scooter that had been delivered for you.  Scooter companies park the scooters in the lobby with paperwork for the intended recipient.     Again we are very sorry that your scooter was taken by another guest of the hotel and do apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.   We did take steps to try and find out what happened with your scooter, but until the guest returned it there was no way for us to know what had happened.    If you were having trouble with your AC we do send someone as soon as possible to check it and make sure it is working properly.  If ther ewas trouble with the sink we could have taken care of it if notified. Again we are very sorry and do hope that you enjoyed the parks.  Thank you

Summary: Room was decent.  Good location across the street from the Disneyland Main Gate.  Problem was the parking: very crowded and they charged you a daily fee.  The surrounding hotels do not do that.  Disneyland was very crowded with 1-1.5 hr waits to get on the rides (went on Wed and Thurs) and all food and drinks in the park were very overpriced.  This hotel was much less costly than the Disneyland Hotels but comparable to other hotels across the street form Disneyland.  We stayed at the Park Vue Inn next door to this hotel last year.  Park Vue did not charge for the parking.  I found the parking charge just irritating.  It was 8.00/day, not much, but just irritating.  I would lean towards the Park Vue Inn next time.  There was no safe in the room either.  There was not much
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location!  Right across the street from Disneyland!
