Summary: This was a greta hotel.  It was easy to get to from the airport using the shuttle.  And we were able to walk right across the street to get to Disneyland and California Adventures.    The room was very big and very clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property. We hope to see you again when you take another trip to our area.  Take care,

Summary Heading: Great Value, good rooms and an awesome location!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Place the second week in July for a Disney vacation.  You cannot beat the location as it is directly across the street from the Disney parks.  And after a long day of walking, it was super nice to just walk across the street and crash.   The rooms are nice and well maintained.  Super clean.  Granite countertops, lots of space. We had a room with a hide a bed, and it was a little springy but ok.  Beds were good.  Pillows are sort of down-ish (I like firmer pillows, but that is total personal preference).  Rooms were cleaned each day and freshly made up for us to return.   The pool is small, and there is a nice hot tub, but really, if you are there for Disney you aren't hanging out at the pool much.  It was clean and there were always towels available for use
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We greatly appreciate hearing from all of our guests.  I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We do look forward to having you and your family as our guests once again.  Take care and we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF-WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND STAYING HERE!!
Summary: I thought this hotel would be a great place to stay because of the close distance to Disneland, but the whole street is surrounded with hotels that offers shuttles so don't chose this hotel based on location. Also, you are only allowed 1 CAR PER ROOM!!!!! And they charge you 8 dollars to park. At the end of a Disneyland filled day, I just wanted to come back to my hotel and relax-this hotel was just full of stress and was the worst part of my Disneyland stay.   The front desk staff were very unfriendly. When I came to the front desk to check-in and out they were just standing in the corner laughing and definitely not working. The wouldn't even acknowledge my presence until they were done with their conversations.  The BEDS are very hard with little square pillows. THEY DON'T
Manager Response: First I would like to thank you for taking the time to write about your experiences.  Every review helps us to evaluate the service we are providing.  I am sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us.  We do let guests know when reservations are made, with confirmations sent to guests and on all websites referring our hotel that we do charge for parking and it is limited to one vehicle.  I am sorry this affected your vacation.  I am also sorry the room did not meet your expectations.  We no longer use comforters in the hotel.  The offer to let you out of the reservation was not intended to be rude but to address the fact that the room did not meet your needs and that we did not have the option to make changes that would meet your satisfaction.   If you have any additional questions or concerns please let me know.  Thank you,

Summary Heading: A great Disneyland good neighbor hotel
Summary: We booked our vacation through Disney travel, and before making the vacation plans, we checked the reviews for hotels close to Disneyland.    We had wanted to stay in the Disneyland hotel, but after finding out we could stay here for $1000 less, we chose this hotel.   It is a statement always written in here,and I will be another to say it.... the location cannot be beat!!!! Just for the heck of it I timed it, 4 minutes from the street corner to the front gates of Disneyland. This was so helpful when we wanted to take a break during the day.    We arrived before the check in time on a Sunday afternoon, and we were met by a security guard before parking, who checked to see if we were staying there, we liked that.     I told the front desk clerk that we had no problem coming back
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to write a review of our property.  Your comments will helps us improve our service and image.  I completely agree that the security guard should not have been smoking where he was in front of guests.  This has been addressed.  Visibility of security is higher in the overnight hours when security is making constant rounds of the property. I am very pleased that you enjoyed your stay and that we can expect to see you on future trips to the Disneyland area.  Take care,

Summary Heading: If your going to disney stay here!
Summary: Hotel is Literally straight across the road from the park probably bout a 2minute walk. Rooms were nice & affordable with free wifi and breakfast. Hotel had a pool and spa but we didn't use either as we spent all our time in the park. Will be back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a recommendation for the Best Western Plus Park Place Inn.  We do appreciate your comments and hope to see you agin soon.  Take care,

Summary Heading: It was okay, but probably would try to stay elsewhere.
Summary: We booked this hotel at the last minute and we have four kids, so we were limited on our choices. We stayed in the mini-suite, and the room was clean, but the sofa bed was falling apart and missing springs, so would have been uncomfortable for anyone taller than 4 feet.  Our fridge didn't work well, and the microwave wouldn't even pop a bag of popcorn.  The pool was closed most of the time we were there, and it was freezing water, so my kids didn't want to swim.  The worst: the parking is horrible.  We have a larger vehicle, and could not park easily anywhere due to the narrow spaces. One large SUV owner even placed a cone behind his vehicle.  I was told there was less parking than number of rooms, which is unbelievable.  The breakfast is so, so.. not much in fruit options,
Manager Response: I am very sorry to see you were disappointed with your stay.  We do appreciate you taking the time to write a response so we can understand where we need improvement.  However please let me address your concerns so you may give us another chance.  Please let us know immediate if something is not working properly so we can address it.  If the sofa was uncomfortable, we do have replacements the same for the microwave.  I am sorry the pool was not open during part of your stay.  Unfortunately there was an unforseen incident with a guest that caused us to have to close the pool and treat it.  However, we did maintain the temperature of the pool at its normal 80 degrees.  Our parking is limited however the non compact spaces do accomodate full size vehicles and we guarantee everyone a place to park.  If only compact spaces are left, or guests have parked over the lines, we do accomodate guests in registration spots or unmarked parking areas by our maintenance office.  The breakfast does include hard boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, bagels, toast, pastries, 3 types of cereal and oatmeal, fresh fruit, juices, coffee and milk. Please feel free to call me.  We would like to experience a more enjoyable stay and what is typical of The Best Western Plus Park Place Inn and Minisuites.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: We stayed here with our family and extended family. They were able to keep us all on the same floor and next to each other. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The staff were very helpfull. I needed a scooter to get around Disneyland and they recommended a great rental company and also let me keep the scooter in the lobby and charged it for me. The hotel and staff are FANTASTIC, and I would stay and recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat. Thanks for a great time
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We strive to make each guest's stay memorable.  I am very please that we were able to help you and your family have a wonderful stay.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: A little background first. We are Annual Passholders to Disneyland from out of state. We usually make it there at least five times a year. We have stayed at several properties on Harbor as well as two of the properties on-site.  When balancing comfort, expense and convenience, this property has become our favorite. The rooms are clean, spacious and we are able to sleep six quite comfortably. The beds are very comfortable with the exception of the sofa bed.  The absolute best feature of this hotel though is location. You are literally across the street from the park. Perfect for the afternoon naps and quick pool break to refresh for the evening. From our calculations, our room was actually closer than the on-site hotels when walking. Closer for hundreds less on a 3-night stay?
Manager Response: Thankk you for reviewing our property.  It is always a pleasure to hear wonderful comments from our guests.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you when you arrive in Novemeber.  If the sofa bed is uncomfortable, please let us know and we will do our best to make it more comfortable.  Thank you and we will see you soon.  Take care.

Summary: It is a cinder block three storey, an average hotel room with a big window that you have to keep closed so the room is always dark.  I stay in the two queen with a sitting area, just to get the extra elbow room.  The free breakfast is not good as lots of people have said, but it is good enough to get you through the morning.  But the LOCATION!!!!  Across the street and into Disneyland, and if the park gets too busy back to the room for a nap and then back to the park.  Cannot be beat!  One thing - book as early as possible.  Lots of people have discovered this place and the prices have gone up because of this.  The lady at the front desk really wants to get you the right room (sorry I did not tip you).
Manager Response: I am pleased that your stay was enjotyable.  I am not sure what you mean that the window had to be kept closed all the time so it was alwys dark in the room.  Please let us know if there is something you would like us to address.  All of the windows do open and have a sheer curtain as well as the heavy curtains to offer a little privacy and let in light.   Our prices do vary depending on the season however, reserving as early as possible is great advice to ensure a choice in room type.   Thank you for your review and we look forward to seeing you again soon.  Take care,

Summary: I don't know why I didn't write a review before of them.  There was not actual parking space for us and we had to park along the wall that displayed signs not to park there. I informed the front desk of the situation and they said it was their "over flow" parking and it was ok to park there.  I could not even get out of the passenger side since we were parked parrallel.  I had brought this complaint in detail to the hotel of why did I have to pay a parking fee for a parking space I never recieved and their answer was again, the "over flow" parking and I was not given a refund for the parking fee. I work for a Best Western and to see this happen was extremly disapointing.
Manager Response: I do appreciate you addressing your concerns.  At the time of your stay, we did utilitze the area you mentioned as overflow hotel parking.  The no parking signs only applied to the back corner of the wall to ensure that emergency vehicles had room to turn the corner.  As a hotel employee, I am sure you are aware many hotels do sometimes have parking concerns and do find alternative parking locations.  Fortunately we were able to accomodate your vehicle in our overflow parking area, which was onsite, provided the same access, and no further of a walk than the marked spaces on the other side of the building.  I am sorry your were disappointed with the parking accomodations.  However, I would like to hear from you regarding the additional ratings since nothing was mentioned in the those areas.  I would like to be able address them with you and see what we could do to improve.  As a fellow Best Western Hotel Employee, I hope you understand we are always striving to improve our customer relations and guest satsifaction.  Thank you and take care.

Summary: This was the second time my wife and I have stayed at the BW Park Place, although the third time for my wife.  We requested a room not on the firs tfloor and they easily accomodated us.  The location is absolutely perfect; out the door and you can be in the park in 10 minutes, depending on how fast you can walk!  Keep in mind this is not a fancy resort, but it is clean and comfortable.  Our first night we had a problem with the AC  unit and the following morning we reported it to the Front Desk and we could hear them calling maintenance as we walked away.  The room was still a little stuffy but there was improvement.  The cleaning service does a fantastic job.  Everyone at the Front Desk was extremely helpful; we were able to check our bags with them early since our room wasn't
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property.  We do enjoy hearing back from our guests.  We look forward to seeing you in October and hope you have a wonderful anniversary while you are staying with us.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you while you are here.  Thank you and we will see you soon.

Summary Heading: Great location! Perfect spot for families visitng Disney
Summary: We live in NY and made this trip with our son who is a Disney season passholder. My husband had recently had back surgery and wasn't sure how much time he'd be able to spend at Disney.  This was the perfect location.  We were able to walk to the park so when my husband got tired, he could go back to the hotel and relax at the pool.  My son was able to pop over to the park on the days we had other sightseeing plans.  So, everyone was happy. It's a perfect spot for families. The breakfast was basic and could have used yogurt added to the menu but it did give us a quicker start in the mornings.  The hotel staff was helpful and stayed on top of maintenance and housekeeping. It's a basic room with nothing fancy but since you're just sleeping there, frills aren't needed. The air
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I am very pleased that your stay was enjoyable and that your husband was able to come back and relax when he tired.  Thank you for your suggestion about adding yogurt to the continental breakfast.  We are looking for ways to improve our breakfast.  We look forward to having you again as our guest.  Take care.

Summary Heading: good breakfast room, comfy beds and perfect location
Summary: First time here and will choose again for Disney stay.    The other hotels breakfast rooms are crowded and usually cant get a seat.  Park Place Inn uses the upstairs area at Captain Kidds, there is plenty of space and the breakfast is adequate.  Bagels, pastry, cereal, juice, tea coffee, clean area.  Rooms are standard Sth Harbor Blvd fare with comfortable beds.  Walking out of Disneyland across the road and into your hotel is a welcome relief.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking your time to review our property.  It is very nice to hear that you will be staying with us again.  We look forward to having you as our guest once again.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you to enhance your stay the next time you visit.  Take care,

Summary: My son and I stayed here on a recent weekend trip.  The location can't be beat!  Walk across the street to Disneyland.  No shuttle bus schedules or waiting...that is worth a lot.  We requested a room away from traffic noise and were on the third floor.  The rooms are basic...good if you go to Disney from early until late at night.  A fine place to sleep!  The front desk was helpful and arranged a cab to pick us up.  We now fly in to John Wayne Airport.  Very quick trip to cab over to Disney.  The free breakfast is a little sad...good if you have  young kids and just need some cereal, milk and juice.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to review our property.  I am very happy that you enjoyed your stay with us.  I am sorry you did not enjoy the Continental Breakfast.  It does consist of Biscuits and Gravy, Hard boiled eggs, Toast, bagels, pastries, 3 choices of cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, 2 juices, coffee and milk.  Please let us know what you would like to see added to the Continental Breakfast that would make it more enjoyable.  We do appreciate your feedback.  We do hope to see you again soon.  Take care.

Summary: We made the trip for our first Disneyland visit in the middle of May. The room was nice, well cleaned, and the room was serviced each day to our satisfaction. The only downside is that they only have a limited number of king bed rooms. We were told that the only one left was on the bottom floor upon arrival, so we had to stick with a bottom floor room. However, it worked out well and there wasn't any exterior noise at night that we noticed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I am glad that your night was restful even though we did not have an upper floor room available.  We do have a number of King bed rooms.  However, they are mostly located on the first floor.  We are limited on the upper floors.  We do hope to see you again soon.    Take care.

Summary: Very comfortable, clean, and laidback!!  ACROSS the street,,, and you are a football field away the entrance.!! Location is perfect, not fancy, but is the perfect  location.....Rock!! Yes, there  are fireworks at Disney around 9;30,..The front of the hotel is a perfect location to witness them,especially if you come back from the park earlier in the day.!. So friendly!!.. WARNING!!! Don't eat at Captain Kidds next door!! Not a buffet, but a Barf- fet.. Hate to be harsh!!! Sorry!!  Would stay at this hotel anytime!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on our property.  I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay at our property.  We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Thank you and take care.

Summary Heading: Location is great, continental breakfast is very poor, with no selection
Summary: The location is great, we chose this hotel because it says a full continental breakfast but this is not the case. They really could offer a better selection for this for a cheap upgrade to the hotel. Some yogurt and fruit would be nice, and better selection of cereal. I would chose a different hotel next time because of this.
Manager Response: First I would like to thank you for taking your time to review our property.   All reviews help us to better serve our guests.  I am sorry you were disappointed with our continental breakfast.  We do serve Hard boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, an offering of bagels, toast and pastries.  There are three cereals to choose from as well as oatmeal, fresh fruit and juices, coffee and milk.  Based on your ratings, there seemed to be something else that you did not find agreeable during your stay.  Please let us know how we can assist.  We would like you to visit us again and make your stay enjoyable.  Thank you,

Summary: About a quarter of a mile to main gate only a little further than the walk from our car in the main lot on the first day. Room was spacious and clean, refrigerator worked a little too well, ac a little too poorly, parking a bit scarce, breakfast at Captain Kidd really felt free. But we could get to the park in the same time as the Disney hotels at a third the price. So budget wise great choice they really shouldn't change a thing as that would increase there prices and leverage themselves against there bigger neighbors.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our property.  Just to save you a surprise on a future visit;  I am not sure what you mean as far as a walk from the main lot on your first day.  The main lot at Disneyland is a parking garage which requires a tram ride to Downtown Disney.  If you parked in a parking lot near Disneyland that was most likely the Downtown Disney Parking which will charge you after the first couple of hours.  May be more expensive than the parking structure.   Again we do appreciate your review of our property.  I am sorry the AC was not operating to meet your needs.  Please make sure when you stay with us, that you bring to our attention anything that is not meeting your needs.  I am please that your stay was enjoyable and you would stay with us again.  We look forward to seeing you soon.  Thank you,

Summary: I stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights in early May.  This is about our 7th time staying here in the last 5 years and as before I was not disappointed.  The location is absolutely perfect - a very short walk across the street to the main gates of Disneyland.  The staff are super friendly and accommodating.  I had requested a room at the front of the hotel because we love the Disney views.  It is a little noisier but I was happy that they honored my request.  We asked for a wakeup call each morning and we got our call on time and then they would also follow up with another call to make sure we received the wakeup call.  The beds were very comfy and it is great to have a full size fridge and a microwave in the room.  The breakfast is very simple - I do think they could change
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  It is wonderful to hear from our repeat guests and knowing we have not disappointed your during your stays with us.  Everyone at Best Western Plus Park Place Inn works hard to exceed our guest expectations and to make every stay memorable.    Take care and we hope to see you soon,

Summary: We've stayed at several of the motels (Howard Johnson, Desert Inn, Castle, Anaheim Inn, Camelot, Fairfield) in walking distance to Disneyland, and this is by far our favorite.  (Well, we love the Disneyland Hotel and Grand Californian the most probably, but of course we can't afford those every time.)  Anyway, the breakfast is just OK, but our kids LOVE it and can't wait to come back (probably the sugar cereal and sweet rolls we usually don't eat.) They did have boiled eggs to provide a little protein.  Yes, the nearby McDonald's is great, too. The rooms are clean and comfortable. One stay the sink had a weird smell, but it was taken care of right away. Best of all, the rooms do not have yucky bedspreads like other budget motels but instead have the sheet covering over the
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  It was wonderful to hear that you have chosen us above other hotels in the area.  We are constantly working to improve our property and our service.  When guests return to our property, we know we are getting it right.  We look forward to having you as our guest once again.  Take care and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: As with all of the reviews, you simply cannot beat the location!!  However, all of the staff members are attentive and helpful. Each request and inquiry was met in a very satisfactory and timely manner. As a matter of fact when we said the sofa bed was a bit lumpy, a brand new mattress was delivered within minutes!! The rooms are HUGE and up to the high quality standards we have come to expect from Best Western. The beds are incredibly comfortable and we all found the room to be very quiet to ensure a good nights sleep. The small refrigerator was perfect for keeping water and soda cold. The continental breakfast was a perfect way to start the day before heading into the Magic Kingdom.  It was so satisfactory that we have already made reservations for a return trip in June!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review.  I am very pleased that we were able to meet all of your needs and perhaps surpass your expectations.  We look forward to your stay with us in June.  Please let us know if there is anything we can do for you.  Take Care,

Summary: We stayed for three nights this February. We're out of town Annual Passport holders, so we've stayed at quite a few hotels on Harbor. We loved this one! The rates in February were really reasonable.   The staff was friendly, the room was nice and it wasn't noisy. The bus stop for the shuttle is right outside the hotel, much closer than the stop was for the hotel we stayed at on our last trip. This is the closest we've stayed to the park. It took us less time to get to the gate than the tram takes from the parking lot.   We'd be staying again on our next trip if we could, but the day we arrive isn't "available as a check-in date."  We will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: First I would like to thank you for your review.  I am sorry we do not have openings on the day you would like to return. We hope we will be able to provide you with another enjoyable vacation soon.  Take Care

Summary: best location to be close do disneyland. the hotel room was very clean and really nice sized. it has a extra large fridge which is great for storing drinks and breakfast things. we didn't have any problems sleeping. needed to find a pacifier in a hurry and the staff was really helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property,  Our staff enjoys hearing their efforts are appreciated.  Thank you and we hope to see you again soon.  Take Care

Summary: Travelled with my sister.  The mini suites were big enough, the beds comfortable.  The staff were extremely helpful.  Although it was a motel style accommodation definately felt like a hotel guest room. Considering there were a lot of young families around, we found it to be quiet.    Easy walk across the road to Disneyland.  Lots of places to eat up and down the street.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We greatly appreciate all feedback  we receive.  I am pleased we were able to meet all of your needs.  We hope we will see you again soon.  Take care.

Summary: We checked in late and got stuck with a room right out front of the gate to Disneyland. I read the previous review, but did not heed the warning. The location of the room was great for looks, but the city bus stop starts really early and goes really late, and the walls and windows are really thin. They have their continental breakfast at Captain Kids Buffet right next door. We did not go because we ate at Captain Kids and it is GROSS. Parking is super tight and people take up 1.5 spots. They have a bunch of additional fees etc. Can't beat the location though.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking your time to review our property.  All reviews help us to better serve our guests.  I am sorry you found your room too noisy.  We do hope you will try one of our other rooms on a future visit as well as our continental breakfast.  The breakfast is provided by the hotel not Captain Kidd's.  As far as additional fees, the only thing we charge is the room rate + city tax and $8.00 per night parking.  We hope you will give us another chance to serve you.  Thank you

Summary: Well i checked the map to make sure I had the right hotel and looked at some of the reviews a bit harsh I thought this is a budget hotel at 116.00 including parking and continental breakfast. Walk to disneyland the reason why your there, yes allow you to park before checkin, clean comfortable no problem with staff, Dont worry about Captain Kidds buffet breakfast macdonalds is cheaper , even though breakfast is complimentry it was a mess we paid for breakfast and still not impressed. I would not have a problem staying here again, but with a large choice of other hotels just as convenient to disneyland I would try another for the experience.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We appreciate all feedback we receive.  I am pleased we were able to meet all your needs except perhaps for the breakfast.  We do hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We chose this place because of its perfect location--you really can't get much closer to the main gates! The front desk staff were phenomenal: so welcoming at check-in and we were offered all kinds of helpful hints and tips for our stay (8 nights) including suggestions for getting back to LAX. We stayed in a mini suite because there were 6 of us (2 adults/4kids). The room was big enough for all of us and the fridge/microwave was perfect for our take-out meals. The hide-a-bed was a bit lumpy and bumpy but within 30 minutes of me asking for a mattress topper, a brand new mattress arrived at the door. House cleaning was excellent--they did a great job of cleaning a room that, thanks to 4 kids, looked like a tornado had hit it most of the time! We found that we had to run the A/C to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I am very pleased the front desk was able to offer you some helpful tips.  We strive to make sure each guest has the best stay possible.  We look forward to seeing you again during a future visit.  Take care,

Summary Heading: WONDERFUL STAY AT BEST WESTERN CLOSE TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: I was concerned about being as close to Disneyland as possible with my nine year old daughter. I could not believe how close this place was! I absolutely recommend this place for anyone with small kids. You literally walk across the street and are on Disney property. There is just a brief walk to the main gates of Disneyland, Calif. Adventure and Downtown Disney. No wheels needed! My room was $129 a night and included continental breakfast at Capt. Kidd's. The breakfast fare was simple, but the place was tidy and not too crowded. They offered boiled eggs, toast, bagels, couple of frest fruits to choose from and cereal, milk, juice, coffee. It is just across the driveway of the main entrance to the hotel. I felt perfectly comfortable traveling as a woman alone w/small child.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our property.  I am very pleased that you felt safe and comfortable staying in our hotel.  We do hope to see you again during a future visit.  Take care.

Summary: They charge way to much at this hotel. I wouldn't mind paying 200 dollars a night if the hotel was nicer and if the rooms had more space. It is in a great location right across the street from disneyland but not worth the money. Along s harbor blvd there are nicer hotels that we would have rather stayed in and most of the other hotels have shuttles that can take you right to disneyland. The rooms were clean but very out dated. The pull out couch beds are very uncomfortable and need to be replaced.  The continental was ok the only things that were good about it was donuts,juice,milk,and coffee. The captain kidds next door to the hotel is terrible the food tasted like it had been sitting around all night and all morning and service was bad. I think the fact that the hotel charged
Manager Response: I would first like to thank you for writing a review.  We can learn and improve our service to all of our guests from all reviews we receive.  I am sorry we did not meet your expectations.  There are several restaurants in the immediate area.  I do hope you were able to enjoy some of the other restaurants.  Parking or resort fees are charged by a number of hotels in the area.  Our fee is one of the lowest.  I do hope you will give us another chance.  We are always trying to improve our services and our hotel.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My family of 10 did a 3 day hopper to Disneyland.  Since I have 3 toddlers it was very important to be close to the parks.  The walk from the hotel to the Disneyland entrance was no more than 5 minutes.  I would stay here again because it was a great bargain.    The hotel was clean.  One thing I wish it had was a double sink, but then again we didn't use it much.  On the second day we were able bring the kids back for an afternoon nap.  That was great because we stayed out late for the fireworks.  All in all, great value and convenience.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our property on Trip Advisor.  Our housekeeping and maintenance staff take great pride in provide a clean and comfortable environment.  They will be very happy with your comments.  I appreciate your strong rating of our property.  We do hope to see you soon.  Take care.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel a couple time when going to Disneyland and we love it.  We have a 2 and 5 year old so we get the mini suites so we have enough room for them.  Right across the street from Disneyland so when you had a long day in the park didn't have to walk far.  Clean rooms but a little dated, breakfast is ok not great but good enough.  Service was great.  Will never stay anywhere else when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to review our property.  Reviews do help us improve our service to our guests.  Thank you for letting us know the good and what needs improvement.  We look forward to you staying with us again.  We hope that you see an improvement on your next visit

Summary: stayed at the best western park place inn for one night end of february.  a quick one day trip to disneyland with a 3 year old and 2 year old.  was unable to checkin early as it was 8a but was able to leave car in lot so we can cross the street to park.  location was best for a day trip to disneyland as we only had to cross street.  less then 5 minutes to entrance gate which was good for the two little ones.  was convienient to come back mid-day for the kids to take a nap and for us to replenish our energy and snacks and drinks for cooler to take to park. rooms were great.  clean and had a large king size bed with large sofa bed.  i had no complaints complimentary breakfast...skip it.   this hotel was perfect for my family for disneyland.  will definately return for our next
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I am sorry we were not able to accomodate you with an early check in.  When rooms are available we will check you in as early as 8 am.  I am pleased that having parking available for you so you could head straight to the park did help you enjoy your day.  Please let us know what we could do better with the breakfast.  We do provide biscuits and gravy, hard boiled eggs, pastries, bagels, toast, cereals, oatmeal, fresh fruit, juices, coffee, and milk. We do look forward to seeing you again on a return visit.  Take care

Summary: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel from February 14th to the 21st.  I really loved the location of the hotel and the friendliness of the front desk staff.  We had a little problem with our phone in the room.  It would ring just once on random which would wake us up in the middle of the night.  We told a young man at the front desk about it and they seemed to fix it right away (only happened one other time after that).  Also, we found blood on my husband's pillow our first morning there (was probably too tired to notice it before sleeping on it the previous night).  We left a note for the cleaning staff to change it which they did.  I think it would have been nice have received a little apology note or something from the front desk staff (because someone else's blood
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  All reviews provide us with insight as to how we can better improve our service to our guests.  I am very sorry there was blood on your pillow.  I am also disappointed to read this because it should have never been placed in the room.  It is unfortunate that the front desk was not made aware of the situation.  However it does show us that to better serve our guests that we may need to improve the communication between departments.  I am happy to see that this incident would not prevent you from staying with us again.  We would like a chance to make up for this mistake.  Thank you and take care

Summary: Just returned to Washington State on 2/20/11 from 4-night stay at this Hotel (3-days at Disneyland).  This was our 4th trip in the last 6-years with our boy/girl twins (they are 10 now), and our 4th different Hotel.  This was the best so far and we will be back again, especially if their rates continue to be reasonable.  Like everyone else already has said, it is not a 4 or 5-star Hotel but you just can't beat the location.  It's a little rundown and we had a couple of issues but nothing major.  The hide-a-beds are terribly uncomfortable but all we did was ask the front desk for some extra padding and they brought us up an actual additional mattress to put on top.  This prevented us from putting the bed back into couch mode but we did not care because we were going strong at
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  It is very important for us to hear both the positives and negatives so we can continue providing the services that our guests appreciate and to make improvements where needed.  We definitely look forward to you staying with us again and exceeding your expectations when you stay with us.  Thank you

Summary: This hotel is in a terrific location close to Disneyland.  The breakfast was fairly poor, with cold eggs not hot, and some product called '2 per cent' milk that tasted repulsive.  Oh for some fresh milk from Victoria, Australia!  Other than that, the hotel was acceptable and keenly priced.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  While you found our hotel pleasant, I am sorry you did not enjoy the breakfast.  It is a continental breakfast offering hard boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, bagels, toast and other pastries, cereals, oatmeal, fruits and assorted beverages.   All reviews do help us to look for ways to improve our service to our guests and your comments will be helpgul in identifying points where we can improve.  Thank you and we hope to see you in the future.

Summary Heading: Good for the price. Nicer than similar across from Disneyland.
Summary: Good staff. Room & breakfast better than many of similar hotels across the street from Disneyland. My only complaints are bathroom fan was barely effective and the air conditioner's coolest temp was 69 degrees. All of us thought the room was too warm and stuffy; we had it running the entire time and opened the window when we could. It was cooler outside than inside the duration of the trip. This makes me concerned about what happens when the weather is hot.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are pleased that your enjoyed your stay with us.  Regarding the AC unit, it does not go below 69 degrees, otherwise the unit would freeze up.  When it is below 69 degrees outside, rooms can first seem stuffy when entering.  However it is just like home units; if it is 65 degrees outside most likely the home air is not going to be turned on to match the outside temperature.  Even if it feels a little warm when entering the home.  When it is cooler outside we recommend the fan setting to bring the cooler air in and circulate the air.  During the summer season 69 degrees does make the room very comfortable  We do hope you will stay with us again soon and let us provide you with a memorable vacation

Summary Heading: Surpassed our expectations.  Well maintained, very clean, quiet, fantastic location, good value.
Summary: In the past 7 years we have been to Disneyland 3 times and each time we stayed here.  This time we were there Jan. 27-31, 2011.  I was happy to find the same manager is still there, and especially happy to find our room immaculate and in fact, cleaner than some far more expensive properties that we have stayed at in the past 5 years.  While many places state location to be accross the street from Disneyland, you can still end up walking a fair distance or taking a shuttle.  With this motel, you are only a few minutes walk from the main gate and it is very safe because there are always people around even if you come back late at night after the fire-works.  Being so close also allows for taking a break out of the park mid-day (breaks it up nicely).  The suite we were in was well
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review of our property.  We greatly appreciate all positive reviews.  I am very thankful that you were so detailed on what exceeded your expectations so we can continue providing the same level of service or even find more ways to surpass it. We look forward to having you here in the future and to once again exceed your expectations and make your vacation a memorable one.

Summary: I recently stayed at Best Western Park Place Inn and was very impressed with the service i received and the quality/cleanliness of the accomodations.  At the time of my arrival I was very ill and needed to go to the hospital. Though I arrived before official check-in time, the front desk clerk helped me get checked in, had the hotel hold my bags at the front desk as my room was not yet ready due to my early arrival, and called a cab to take me to the hospital. I'm very appreciative of his help; I was very ill at the time and travelling by myself.  All the other staff whom I interacted with during my stay were also very kind and helpful.    The location of this hotel is unbeatable...it's literally just a crosswalk away from the entrance to Disneyland. The room I got was large &
Manager Response: I am very sorry you were so ill when you first arrived.  I am very pleased that we were able to assist you and make your stay comfortable and memorable even though it started off on a low note.  Thank you for describing the help that was provided to you and what you enjoyed about our hotel.  I hope you were able to fully enjoy your time with us and that your illness passed quickly. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you

Summary: Our family of 4 (to younger kids) stayed here for 8 days. It is the closest hotel to Disneyland's main gate. You can walk from Disneyland to your hotel in about 3 minutes. It is a simple hotel but clean and we had very good service from the people at the front desk. The free breakfast wasn't grand by any means but it did the job. The best part about breakfast is that after we were done we would grab a few apples,oranges, bagels and pack them up to take into the park.. Great money saver.  The pool is smaller but it was nice to have the option of relaxing before or after Disneyland. There is a small fridge and microwave in the room which was helpful to store small food items.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I am glad our staff was able to make your stay enjoyable and that the breakfast served your needs.   We look forward to seeing you on a future visit.  Thank you

Summary: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at this hotel while on a trip to Disneyland - this last time we were there for 7 nights.  You just can't beat the value.  This is NOT a 5 star hotel, but the rooms are super clean and quiet, the staff is very friendly and helpful and the price just can't be beat.  We noticed how the cleaning staff was busy all times of the day and night, even the elevator didn't have a speck of dirt.  The best part of this hotel is that you are literally STEPS away from Disneyland and family friendly restaurants.  The location of the hotel makes it so easy to take a break from Disneyland and come back for lunch or a rest.  The free breakfast is what you would expect for free, but with kids a bowl of cereal and a boiled egg works just fine - certainly not the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I am very pleased to read your comments.  Our housekeeping staff does work extremely hard to make our guests stay comfortable.  All the staff strives to make each guests stay memorable and enjoyable.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My stay there was fine. The place was clean - so clean it smelled like a hospital.  BUT, I left a pair of shorts there and they returned them by FedEx at a very high cost!  Turns out the airbill was marked 16 lbs when it should have been one pound.  The hotel took no responsibilty and told me the matter was closed.  It really made me mad that I trusted them with my credit card number, I was overcharged, and they just didn't care.  I would NEVER go back there and certainly would not recommend them.
Manager Response: I am glad you enjoyed your stay.  I am very sorry for the rate that was charged by FedEx.  The weight is filled in by FedEx and the charge processed by FedEx.  We have contacted FedEx to have them adjust the weight and a credit has been issued to your card.  I apologize if you were not made aware of the shipping procedures and the possible cost when we contacted you about the shorts that were left behind in your room.  We have also made adjustments to the way lost and found will be processed so guests will not be caught by surprise at the cost of shipping I apologize for any inconvenience and hope you will provide us another chance to serve you.  Thank you,

Summary Heading: Would recommend this in a heart beat
Summary: We were very pleased with our stay at the Park Place Inn.  The rooms are large and comfortable, and having a mini refrigerator and microwave in the room was very convenient.    The price was exceptional, especially considering the close location to Disneyland and the continental breakfast.  My husband brags to people about how his wife (me) finds the BEST places.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review of our property.  We strive to make all of our guests stays enjoyable and memorable. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great location, super staff, nice rooms
Summary: We chose this Best Western as part of our Disneyland package, and were extremely pleased at the proximity to the park, size and amenities of the rooms and hotel, and overall comfort of our visit. Every member of the staff we encountered was very professional and polite. The only complaint I would have is that the beds were "double", not even queen size--not sure if there was an option with our package. There were a few minor issues with our room--one lamp that shorted out and a broken hair dryer, which we mentioned on check out, but didn't really impede the comfort of our stay. The included continental breakfast was decent, the hotel was quiet, and overall, we would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review of our property.  We are very pleased you enjoyed your stay.  We do have minisuites which have two queen size beds plus a queen size sleeper sofa.  This is an option with Walt Disney Travel if requested.  I am sorry about the lamp and the hair dryer.  If there is anything that you need or if something is not working right in the room, please let us know so we can make sure you fully enjoy your stay.  We look forward to seeing you on a future visit

Summary: First off, the location can't be beat.  Just a quick walk across the street, and you're at the gates of Disneyland. That alone adds a star to the rating.  We stayed from 12/30-1/2.    The room itself was a little on the small side, but enough room for two adults and two 10 year olds. The bathroom was very small though. Room appeared to be clean when we arrived, however a piece of paper and a Tylenol we dropped on our first night were never picked up/vacuumed the entire time of our stay. Other than that, the room was always made up each time we returned from the parks. The beds were definitely smaller than we are used to, but were pretty comfortable. Very convient having a microwave and a fridge in the room.  The free wifi is also a plus at this hotel. There is a charge for
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We do appreciate hearing back from our guests.  Comments like yours help us know what we are doing right and what we can improve on.  For your comfort, you may want to consider a minisuite during your next visit.  It comes with 2 queen size beds plus a queen sleeper sofa and the room is larger than a standard.  We look forward to serving you during a future visit.

Summary: We booked our Disney vacation from Dec.20-27th.  I had booked a mini-suite for my family of 5 (kids 9, 7, & 4), and a separate room for my in-laws.  Based on other reviews, I requested our rooms to be at the back of the hotel, where it was suggested to be quieter.  It definitely was!  We didn't notice any noise at all.  The rooms were definitely clean, but could have used more lighting.  However, it comfortably slept our family of 5.  The pool is small, but we did not mind.  We unfortunately visited during the heavy rainfall over the Christmas period, and would have appreciated more washers/dryers.  There are only 2 of each for the entire hotel, and we often in use when we tried to use them.  Despite what other reviews have stated, the continental breakfast was adequate.  There
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review of our property.  I am sorry your visit had to coincide with one of the heaviest rains we have had in quite awhile.  Hopefully you were still able to enjoy Disneyland.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The Best Western Park Place Inn is located directly across the street from the main gate to Disneyland in Anaheim.  This place is the closest place that you can stay to the park.  With such close proximity, this Best Western is even a shorter walk to the gates than 2 of the 3 hotels inside the park.    We have stayed here a few times now during visits to Disneyland and find the place very comfortable and reasonably priced.  There are several room types to choose from and the staff is always very accommodating.  There is an elevator and luggage carts for convenience to the 2nd and 3rd floor rooms if needed.  If you are sensitive to street noise and undisciplined children, we would recommend a room higher up and towards the rear of the property.  There is a swimming pool, free
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  We greatly appreciate our repeat guests and strive to make every experience memorable.  We did begin charging for parking.  We installed parking gates to control the parking on our property.  Due to our proximity to Disneyland, we were having guests of Disneyland who were not guests of our hotel, parking in our lot and taking away parking from our guests. The gates eliminated the need to staff a person to monitor parking and along with the non guest fee has become a great deterent for parking in our lot for non hotel guests.  Many hotels in the area will either charge a parking fee or a resort fee.  These can range from a few dollars to $21.00 or higher a night. Our limited fee and the parking gates will help ensure that our guests have parking

Summary Heading: Clean, amazingly convenient location, and the staff was great to us
Summary: We make our annual trek to Disneyland...well...every year.  While staying on Disney property is immersive, we just don't see the value in spending top dollar on a room we are rarely in.  We decided that for this year's extended trip (10 nights!) we would give an off property hotel a shot.  The staff was great, and very accommodating.  The housekeeping service didn't skip a beat.  If anything, they were almost too eager to make up our room each morning, so we quickly got accustomed to using the 'please do not disturb' sign as after a long day walking at Disneyland, it's nice to sleep later than 8 AM.  And what's really great is as even though we lingered each day, our room was spotless each night when we returned.  The location really can't be beat, and it's actually a much
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful review and kind words.  We are very happy that you chose our property for your stay and we would be very happy to have you back again.  For your comfort on a return visit, perhaps you will be able take advantage of our minisuite which is 2 queens plus a queen sleeper sofa.  Wishing your family the best during this Holiday Season.  Take Care

Summary Heading: The Best Choice for your Disneyland Vacation
Summary: We have stayed at several of the Motels that are "right across the street" from Disneyland over the past several years.  This was our 2nd stay at the Best Western Park Place, and I have to say, I will probably not stay anywhere else again when we travel to Disneyland.  This Motel is truly the closest to the entrance to Disneyland (and at 10:00 pm at night that is great) ~ and they offer everything that a family needs for  comfortable lodging.  The rooms are clean (even the carpet, as my white socks barely got dirty walking around).  The beds are very comfortable.  The bedding is nice as are the towels in the bathroom (thick and soft).  It is pretty quiet (as much as a motel with hundreds of families can be).  There is a good refrigerator and microwave in the room ~ as well as a
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and recommendation.  Our guests are extremely important to us.  We do understand the importance of "word of mouth" as many of our guests find us based on recommendations from past or frequent guests.  I am very pleased we met all of your needs and received a 5/5 on all rating factors.  It definitely helps us understand on what we should keep doing to make our guests' stays exceptional. We hope to see you again soon.  Take care.

Summary: Let me start by saying, I am a travel agent and have stayed and toured many hotels.  I booked this hotel 5 months in advance for my husband and 5yr old and 7yr old.  I re-confirmed the reservation twice before we arrived to find the only rooms available had only one bed.  The person checking us in did not seem to understand why 4 of us could not sleep in one bed for a week and explained that we could be on the waitlist for 2 beds, but it would probably take several days.  As a travel agent I understand that Requests are just that and cannot be guaranteed, however; they cannot expect you to sleep 4 people in one bed.  This reservation was a prepaid nonrefundable rate and I asked to speak to the person in charge to get our money back,so we could stay somewhere else.  The person in
Manager Response: Thank you for addressing your concerns.  All reviews help us improve our service to our guests.  I would like to take a moment and hopefully clear up some of the issues you mentioned.           When a reservation is made through a third party prepay site such as Expedia, Walt Disney Travel or Get Away Today, to name a few, you are correct that requests are not guaranteed.  You are always much better off calling a property directly if you wish to be guaranteed certain bedding options.             When reserving a standard room on a third party site, the sites do mention that a standard room is either a room with one king bed and a sleeper sofa or two full (double) beds.  Both of these do accomodate 4 people.             If you made your reservation as a advanced full prepay directly on the Best Western website, you personally selected the room type you wished to be in and were provided with that room type.          The room you stayed in was a room with one King and a sleeper, comfortably accomodating a family with two adults and two children.  As a travel agent I am sure you are aware that hotels do try their absolute best to accomodate guests' requests but in sold out situations it is not always possible.  If a room with two full size beds had been available we would have gladly moved you to the room.             As far as an employee having a heated discussion with her boyfriend in the back office;  this is not tolerated and would have resulted in disciplinary action.           I am very sorry your stay was not enjoyable.  I do wish you would give us another chance to show you what our service and hotel is really like.  I understand if you are not happy at check in it can ruin the perception of the rest of your stay and of the employees.           If you would be willing to give us another try, please call the hotel directly so we can ensure you receive the room that would best accommodate your needs.  Thank you,

Summary: We first stayed at Best Western Park Place Inn & Mini Suites in 2006 and did not hesitate to stay here again this time. The best thing is that it is directly across the road from Disneyland (a 5 min walk to the gate). The rooms are clean and spacious. There is a full size fridge and free internet. Breakfast at Captain Kidds next door was ok. Not a lot of variety - cereals, juice, fruit, donuts and bagels - but it's free! Also, there are laundry faciliites near the pool which is also handy. There is parking for a small fee per day and there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. If you are planning a trip to Disneyland, this is definitely the best place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was great here.  Some people might say the rooms are a bit old & shabby looking, but for the price I paid, I think it was a terrific.  (And I even slept on the couch there, every night!)  Our room was bigger than your average hotel room.  Never a problem with elevators working.  Never a problem finding parking.  Free breakfast was your typical, adequate, basic, maybe a tiny bit better than average.  Internet access worked.  Staff was extremely helpful & friendly.  But LOCATION was supremo with Disneyland right across the street!  All in all, magnificent for the price.  (Actually, whenever there are no bedbugs, I am pleased).   Just don't expect a palace or a breakfast feast, and you won't be disappointed.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to write a review of our property and recommend us to others.  "Word of mouth" is extremely important to us.  We are always extremely happy when we receive a 5/5 rating on all ratings.  It tells us we are definitely moving in the right direction.  We do hope to see you again soon.  Take care.

Summary Heading: Closest to the Park and very nice!
Summary: Everytime we go to Disneyland in Anaheim, we stay at Best Western Park Place Inn.  This hotel is one of the clearnest we've been to in the area.  What is also wonderful is that it is literally right across the street from Disneyland.  Walk out the doors of the front desk, cross the crosswalk, and you're there!  This makes coming to and from Disneyland a lot easier.  No going to your car (and paying for parking) or waiting for a shuttle.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to rate and recommend our property to others.  We are very pleased that you enjoy our property.  If there is anything we can do to improve for a future stay, please let us know. Thank you and hope to see you again soon.  Take care

Summary: Booked a free night stay at Best Western Park Place Inn (Hooray for Stay 2 nights, get 1 night free promo!) for a quick 2 day trip to Disneyland.  I arrived at 10 am and had absolutely no problems checking in HOURS early.  I didn't expect to be able to check in early at all - I thought I'd just ask the hotel to hold my luggage while I headed off to Disneyland until check in time.  When I approached the counter I was checked in without any mention of normal check in time or that they were doing me a favor.  I was also able to check my luggage after check out while I spent the 2nd day at Disneyland.  Service was very good and much appreciated.  The gal at the gift shop was very personable and accommodating. The outside of the hotel had more of a motel feel than a hotel, but it
Manager Response: Thank you for taking your time to write a review of our property and recommending us to others.. We wish to make every guests stay enjoyable and comfortable.  i am very happy that you enjoyed our property, location and service. We hope to see you again soon.  Take care

Summary Heading: Okay rooms, horrible parking,  but great location to the park....
Summary: We stayed at this hotel the second week of October with my family (three adults and two toddlers) The location of this hotel is wonderful to Disneyland park, and the front desk staff was very professional, however, I have a could of things to say--the parking at this hotel was not very good, and you are truly limited to one space so--if you have friends who live in the area that want to visit, they will only allow them to park there if the hotel is not booked (which it usually is due to the good value), and even if they do, it is only for a very short amount of time. The rate was decent for the location, however, the rooms are also dated, and while serviced daily, the floor did not seem very clean.    The other issues I had was that our keys kept getting demagnitized so we had
Manager Response: Aloha, Thank you for your review of our property.  I am very sorry you had some issues with our property.  Having to wait for hours and place 3 phone calls to receive extra pillows is not acceptable.  I do also apologize for your keys demagnitizing.  Hotel key cards are very sensitive.  When kept next to cell phones or credit cards, they can become demagnitized.   We do wish we could improve the parking.  We did install the parking gates and started charging for parking to deter non guests so our guests would have a place to park.  Being directly across from the main entrance does make our parking lot a temptation for non guests.  We do try to accomodate visitors for a couple of hours but we do have to limit the time. The housekeeping carts are left outside certain areas until they are reloaded for the following day. They should not be left out overnight.  We will make sure that they are not blocking or making access to guests rooms difficult. We are continuously renovating or updating the rooms.  Every six months we address something in the rooms whether it is the bedding, furniture, painting, carpet, etc.  I am glad that you found your stay enjoyable overall.  We greatly appreciate all reviews and use them to help us improve our service for our guests.  You have provided us with some valuable information and I do thank you.  We do hope to see you back soon.  Mahalo

Summary: I just got back from a week long trip and stayed at several hotels during our trip and this was by far the best hotel I have stayed at when coming to California. They have some of the best customer service, great location, and rooms were excellent and the beds were very comfortable. The staff for the hotel does an excellent jobs!!! I would not go anywhere else when I come back to California!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the absolutely wonderful review of our property.  We strive to provide exceptional service to all of our guests.  We are extremely pleased when we have been informed that we hit the mark.  It is rewarding to know that our efforts, to continuously improve our customer service, are working.  Thank you again and we hope to see you very soon.  Take care,

Summary: Service--Excellent!  Rooms very clean and spacious. Location couldn't be any closer.  We spent five nights and had a very comfortable and quiet/ relaxing time.  One issue appeared and the management was more than prompt and generous to satisfy our complaint.  We had left two items there at checkout and were notified by phone of these items.  Our suggestion to them was to toss the items because it would be more costly to ship than the value.  One week later we received the two items in the mail, postage paid by the motel.  This place went above and beyond the call of duty!!  We will be back!!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your ratings, review and recommendation to others.  We hope to see you again soon.  Take care.

Summary: This is our third stay here. 5 minute walk to Disney. Nice, clean, and roomy. Staff is friendly. Breakfast room was always busy while we were there. People waiting around for tables. We always got there early enough for a table. Breakfast was simple but that's ok. We'll definitely come back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and recommendation to others.  We hope to see you again soon.  Take care.

Summary: We stayed in this hotel because it was across the street from Disneyland. We were in Anaheim when the temperature reached 110 degrees. It was wonderful to go back to the hotel and cool off. The hottest day we went back three times. The room was very nice. My daughter and I each had our own queen bed. It had a couch that could be made into a bed but we didn't need that. The included breakfast was not great. We have had better at other Best Westerns. For the convenience and price I would totally recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  I am sorry the breakfast was not satisfactory.  If you have time, please let us know what would have made it better for you. We are always striving to improve our guests' experiences.  Your input would be very valuable.  Thank you and we hope to see you again.  Take care

Summary Heading: Small room for being a mini suite for family???And small pool...
Summary: We booked this hotel through AAA travel after being recomended for location and more affordable pricing for a family to stay at Disneyland.  We hadn't been to Disneyland for 6 years and after staying at this hotel I would have prefered to spend the extra money and stay at a nicer hotel.  We were in 5 people should have been 6 last person couldn't come, the room was tight for us all to be inside, beds 2 doubles 1 fold out futon.  We had 3 kids so we had also booked this hotel to be close to Disney but also with a pool to relax after busy days.  The pool went to just 6 feet deep was so small, crowded all of the time, sign posted by the pool said 8 people at a time but always more than that were in it.  They had the continental breakfast next door, wasn't good or fresh place
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our property.  All reviews help us to better serve our guests.  I am very sorry you did not enjoy your stay with us.  We know the cost of a visit to Disneyland is extremely expensive and we do strive to make each of our guests stay enjoyable. I would like to take this chance to clear up a couple of misunderstandings.  The review mentioned the mini suite consisted of two double beds.  This room actually consists of 2 queen size beds and a sleeper sofa.  Also, while our pool is not as large as one may find in a full service property, 8 people maximum is inaccurate.  The 8 people maximum applies to the spa/jacuzzi, not the pool.  The pool occupancy is 21. I do apologize if the there was a strange odor in the restaurant and the food did not appear fresh.  Since we lease the space above the restaurant for the breakfast, you may have been smelling the food that was being prepared for the restaurant buffet served at lunch and dinner.  The continental breakfast items are served fresh daily with an option of hard boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, bagels, toast, pastries, cereals, oatmeal, fruits, juices, coffee, and milk. As with any breakfast bar, it is best to arrive as early as possible for the best selection.  As the breakfast hours are winding down, selection does become limited.   We did not choose IHOP because it is a full service restaurant and very busy.  Sending 199 rooms of hotel guests on a daily basis to IHOP for continental breakfast is not a viable option for us, nor a beneficial one for IHOP. Again I am very sorry your stay was not enjoyable.  I do hope the information above has been helpful in alleviating some of your concerns regarding your stay with us.  Please feel free to contact us for any additional information.

Summary Heading: Excellent Value and Good Customer Service
Summary: Almost every year we have a chance to go to Disneyland, we stay at the Best Western. It's easy access to Disneyland (directly across from the park), they have more than adequate breakfast (it's free). (Biscuits, gravy, hard boiled eggs, cereal, milk, juice, donuts, danishes, bagels and toast) and they have public transportation that stops right in front of the hotel. They are also within walking distance to Denny's, IHOPs, Captain Kidds, Tony Roma's, McDonald's, Coldstone and Mimi's. They have a gift shop and if you can not check into your room right away, they hold your luggage for you. In the rooms are refrigerators and microwaves. We either get two double beds or a King bed and both rooms are more than enough for us. The pool and jacuzzi are a great way to unwind when you get
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review.  I am very pleased that you enjoy your time when you stay with us. I would just like to offer some help with the A/C issue.  Our A/Cs do get used on an almost daily basis especially in the summer.  Often times they are set at the lowest setting, all day while the guest is out, so they do become tired.  If you have any problems with a loud AC, please let us know.  We do have spare ones that we can switch out. The process takes only 15 minutes.  Thank you for your ratings of our property.  When we see you again, hopefully we will be able to have those all up to fives. We do greatly appreciate your business and your recommendation.  Take care

Summary: This hotel was clean enough.  We were only there to sleep as the rest of our time was spent at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel.  We do hope to see you on a future visit. Take care.

Summary: Stayed at several hotels near Disneyland and this was our favorite by far. Room was clean and they provided a free continental breakfast every morning. They also had laundry facilities which was very convenient for us as we only had to pack enough clothing for 1 week, not two.  The greatest thing about this place is the location. Couldn't get any closer to Disneyland. This truly was "walking distance". Great for leaving the park mid-day when it gets crowded and taking the kids back to the room for a nap then returning for the night re-energized.  We will stay here on future trips to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us.  We would be very happy to have you with us on a return visit.  It looks like our service could have been improved upon.  Please let us know what we could have done better for you.  Your next visit we would love for you to be able to rates us 5 out of 5 on service.  We hope to see you soon.  Mahalo

Summary Heading: Value for money and sooooo nice, great staff
Summary: First time to LA and found this lovely Hotel.  highly recomended.  rooms very spacious and clean, Staff friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review.  If you have a chance to travel to our area again, we do hope we have the chance to welcome you back to our property.  Thank you

Summary: My wife and I stayed at this hotel 9/22 - 9/26 for our vacation to Disneyland. You cannot find a closer hotel outside of Disney property.  I admit to being a little concerned about noise when we checked in and they gave us a ground floor room second in from the street (room 102). We needn't have worried, the room was quiet and being that close to the front was perfect after a long day of walking around the parks. Checking in was fast and easy and the hotel staff were professional and kind. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.   All-in-all, I can't find one thing to complain about. The continental breakfast next door is mostly cereals and juices but was just enough to get us going until we could make it to our character breakfasts in the park.   We booked through
Manager Response: Thank you so much for such a wonderful review of our property.   We look forward to the chance to provide you with another enjoyable stay in the future.

Summary Heading: Simple clean motel just across Disney entrance
Summary: Brekfast - basic to poor. Room - standard at most. Clean. Pool - small with a hot Jacuzzi.  Use it for Disney visit. There are shuttles to hotels. I don't know how they operate. Might be better to find a nicer place with a good shuttle service.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  All reviews help us to provide better service and accomodations for our future and repeat guests.

Summary: Staying so very close to Disneyland is great.  The hotel is average or maybe a little above average for the area.  I have no complaints but nothing to make you go wow - except how close it is to the Disney entry.   Although we have been to Disneyland and stayed at other hotels near this one, this is the first time here.  Parking is limited but once we parked we didn't move the vehicle so it was fine.   Front desk staff did their job fine but nothing extra.    We had a top floor (3) room facing Disneyland and the street.  There was some traffic/street noise but not an issue unless the window was open.  We did not notice any room to room noise. The A/C worked fine. The small fridge and microwave were nice to have.  There are drink vending machines and a small store.  We did use
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  It is important to hear from our guests so we know how we can improve on our guests' visits with us.  We would greatly appreciate a return visit from you.  You stayed in one of our standard rooms with the full/double size beds.  I understand you found the bed itself comfortable just not the size.  We do offer rooms known as our mini suites which consist of two queen beds plus a sleeper sofa.  These are normally about $20.00 more a night that a standard room. We are continuously striving to improve our customer service so we may make our guests visits memorable.  Even though we are considered a limited service property, that does not mean our customer service should be limited as well.  Thank you again for the valuable information you provided us.

Summary Heading: Awesome deal, would stay again without a second thought.
Summary: Ok first of all, this is not a 4 or 5 start hotel.  If you are looking for luxury, or to walk into a room and ooh and aww, this is not going to be for you.  If you are practical, want clean and comfortable and close, then this is the mecca.  We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights.  The staff was friendly, the rooms were immaculate, and it was quiet, even when we had neighbors next to and above us.  The beds were comfortable, the pull out sofa beds, not so much.  If you have older kids, I'd recommend a 2 queen room over a king with a pull out.  But seriously, has anyone ever slept on a comfortable pull out??  The breakfast is ok.  I think the only downside is that it doesn't change and after 8 mornings of it, you're really, really sick of it.  They offer exactly what they
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review.  We do strive to provide our guest with comfort, convenience and a memorable experience.  We do hope you will come and visit us again soon.  Take care.

Summary: best location for Disney land visitors at a decent price.  Very comfortable everything and has a great feature with a half wall separating bedroom area from the table & chairs area.  Breakfast buffet had only sweets, but there was a microwave and fridge in the room.  I was dissappointed in Disney Land itself, but Best western was a highlight!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review.  We do hope you have a chance to come back and visit us.  I am sorry there were only sweets available when you visited the continental breakfast bar.  We do stock it with hard boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, bagels, pastries, cereals, oatmeal, fruits, milk, juice, and coffee.  We will ensure that the breakfast bar is being maintained throughout the duration of the breakfast hours.  However as it is coming to an end selection does become limited to prevent food waste. I am sorry you were disappointed with Disneyland.  If you would like to tell us what specifically disappointed you, perhaps we could give you some tips to better enjoy a future visit. Thank you for visiting us.  We hope to see you again

Summary: This is the fourth time we have stayed at this hotel/motel. The staff are always great to work with and the rooms are always clean with a microwave and frig. It is located DIRECTLY across from the entrance to Disneyland, which is so convenient, especially at the end of the day and you're dead tired or if you want to go back for a nap in the afternoon and return in the evening. If you are going back to your room in the afternoon, leave a request at the desk that maid service come in the morning as they sometimes don't clean until very late in afternoon. Parking is limited and you have to pay, but it is now gated. The Captain Kidd restaurant that offers a complimentary continental breakfast to hotel guests (quite adequate for most people w/cereals, fruit, juice, coffee, donuts,
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review.  We greatly value our return guests and do sincerely hope that we continue to meet or exceed your expectations of our property.  All comments do help us to better serve our guests.  We do often have guests return in the afternoon from Disneyland for a break before the evening show and events.  We would like to better accomodate these guests so they may have a relaxing afternoon break.  We look forward to having you stay with us again.  Thank you for choosing Best Western Park Place Inn and Mini Suites

Summary Heading: Great Location and Value but...lousy parking!
Summary: The BW Park Place offers great value and the location is prime for visiting Disneyland.  It has a continental breakfast next door, staff is friendly, and rooms and surrounding areas are adequate.  I have to say, though, the parking is very limited.  At check in I had to wait about a half hour for someone to leave and then the parking was not very close to the room. During my 5 day visit,  there were always cars waiting to park in an already full lot.  The other problem I found was the noise level.  You can hear the adjacent room's shower and water running and people walking past the room can be heard clearly.  For me, it was convenient to get to Disneyland in an electric scooter, so I overlooked the detractors.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location for family trip to Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I traveled with our two-year old son to Disneyland for the weekend. The Best Western Park Place Inn was in a perfect location right outside the entrance of the park. We were able to go to the park in the morning, head back to the hotel for nap time and go back in the evening. Consider parking in the Best Western lot when you get into town, and then pre-check in so you can just pick up the key at 3 p.m. (check-in time). We had a suite and it worked out well - plenty of space for a pack n' play, etc. This is a motel, with doors leading to the outside, so you have a bit more noise than a regular hotel. Overall, the hotel was clean and the pool/hot tub was nice in the afternoon when taking a break from the park. Didn't like the very soft beds.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very nice rooms, great location.  Right across from walkway to Disneyland.
Summary: They allowed up to park our car at 8:30 a.m. and said they would call when the room was ready.  We got back to the hotel at 1 p.m. and sat in the lobby for a few minutes then our room was ready so they let us check in early.    Only negative was the bathroom smelt a little like mildew the morning after.  Continental breakfast at Capt Kidd's was better than most.  Had all the usual breakfast pastries, plus biscuits and grayy,  and four different kinds of cereals.  For a decent meal without earing a Disneyland, try Capt Kidd's buffet.
