Everything they had tasted pretty good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not exactly sprinkled with pixie dust...

In the end, I found a sweet deal at the Disneyland Hotel from expedia for 3 nights, but we needed to spend one night somewhere else.  We picked this hotel for it's proximity to the park.  It is about as close as you can get to the entrance of Disneyland, so it has that going for it.  The problem is that this is sort of a run down motel.  The rooms have their own air conditioning unit, but the units are very small (like a window unit) and very noisy when they are run.  They also don't cool the room evenly.  Our A/C was right next to the pull out sofa that my daughter slept on, and it blew on her all

Summary: Check in was fast and easy. The room was clean with adequate space for the amount of people in room.  Hotel staff were friendly. The children enjoyed the hotel pool and hot tub a refreshing retreat after a long day at Disneyland and to beat the hot weather at midday. After  a swim and something to eat at the many restaurants in the area, we were ready to enjoy the night shows at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Right accross the road from Disney

The staff dont care - zero customer service and really lousy food options. Lots of people hoarding food into used pizza boxes, plastic bags, hand bags, in paper napkins any thing they can find. No-one checks your room number so perhaps these people arent even staying at the hotel or perhaps just getting cheap food for their Disney adventure. Breakfast is served in plastic bowls and plastic plates with plastic cutlery  Small pool and spa.   They charge per car for parking!  The all you can eat buffet restaurant next door (below where

We didn't even hear DL fireworks so noise wasn't really a problem. The pool was nice for the kids and the hot tub was nice after a long day of Disney fun. Coin laundry area was convenient. Not happy about the continental breakfast, which is located in a restaurant next door and is just a regular continental so no hot food here. I didn't like that you have to pay for parking. The staff was friendly enough. We forgot something there and they held on to it until we could pick it up and they called us when they found our missing item, which was nice. There are a lot of hotel in this area so not
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I would recommend to stay here with small children for the economy and convenience.
Summary: Immediately upon check in we received great service. Although I had originally requested a closer room due to closer walking distance for my small children but also because of the fireworks but I didnt get it. I was given a room on the 2nd level way in the back.  I had asked them again if there could be any accomodations they could make to put us closer and they DID!!! The kids liked that we were up front and they were just a couple of feet from viewing the fireworks. The price was not bad for the accomodations but given I used a AAA discount too. The only complaint is they definately need a bigger pool because the people/pool ratio was very small.   This is our second time staying here and we find it hard to stay anywhere else as a family because of how truly convenient it is

Summary: We were staying for the July 4th holiday in a timeshare, but couldn't get a night for the 4th of July. We planned to go to the Park on the 3rd, 4th, and 6th.  This place was great for the location: right across the street to the entrance, which was wonderful for a crowded day at Disney, with a 4 & 6 year old.  We were able to check in early, 9AM, even though our room obviously wasn't ready, but we could park our car. ($8 charge)  We had breakfast at the IHOP, right next door, (kids eat free), and headed to the park. Came back in the afternoon for a rest and the pool. Our room was ready, 2 Queen beds, and a fold out couch. It had a refrigerator and microwave, and was quite clean. The price I paid, $113, through the Best Western web site couldn't be beat. This hotel is literally right across from the main gate so we decided to book it after getting a good AAA rate for 2 double beds.  Now this is not the Ritz, but it is a good mid-range motel (not Hotel)  Rooms and bath were clean although sleep quality was not the best.  Our air conditioner turned on and off.  If on, it blocked out the noise; if off, we heard the housekeeping staff as well as the kids running around.  Complimentary breakfast was really bad at the restaurant next store.  I'm a big breakfast fan, but only went there 2 out of 5 days.  Don't count on this

Summary: So we go to Disneyland every year and always stay at one of the DLR hotels because we thought you couldnt get any closer, and didnt think any other hotels would be worth the walk no matter how much cheaper it might be. I'm definately saving my money from now by staying here, and the walk was super close! I couldnt get over how close we were to the maingate entrance!! The rooms were nice and cozy. The pool was super small, the staff could have been quicker helping guests at the front desk but I think the distance to Disneyland and price made up for the little dislikes. =]   We have annual passes and this is going to be the hotel we plan to stay at for every future

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel on several occasions.    We LOVE the proximity to Disneyland.  TO get to our room, we walked a little farther than most people walk to get to the shuttle. IF you are looking for luxury, you should stay somewhere else.  BUT, if your plan is to spend your time at Disneyland, and you are looking for a nice place to spend the night, then this is a great and affordable choice.  The door to the room opens to the outside. The bathroom and room itself were a good size.  Mimi's, Cold Stone Creamery, IHOP, and Tony Roma's are all within walking distance of the hotel. Breakfast is upstairs at the restaurant next door to the hotel and they provide very basic items (sweet rolls, small donuts, juice, milk). Summary: We stayed two nights so we could go to Disney. We wanted a hotel within short walking distance to Disney. This couldn't have been more perfect.  Hotel staff is very helpful. Amazingly enough with all the traffic they get, the rooms were both very clean! The bed was comfy and the noise wasn't quite as bad as I expected considering the location. I would recommend this place and will probably stay at other best westerns in the future.

Summary: We asked for two rooms on the top floor in a quiet location. They could not have put us in better rooms, upstairs at the back corner. Perfect! The room was comfortable and it was nice to have a refrigerator and microwave. I wasn't a big fan of the breakfast, but it was what I expected. It will keep you going until lunch. One night we watched the fireworks from our room. Less people than the park and a great show. At the end of a long day, you will be so happy to just walk across the street to bed.  I would stay there again. The only negative was the sink outside the room. It wasn't great for us, but maybe would be a plus for a family getting ready.

We asked for a lower level room so that one in our party wouldn't have to climb two flights of stairs. Manager Response: none

Summary: I have no complaints about this hotel. Location is great. Breakfast is perfect for what we wanted. Most importantly it is so incredibly close to the Park. I would defiantly recommend this hotel for families or just the weekend getaway. If you have AAA make sure you book through AAA's website.

Summary: This motel is the closest one outside the Disneyland gates.  It was very convenient to come back to the room in the afternoon for a short rest.  Parking spots were easily available even though the hotel was quite full over the holiday weekend.  The internet connection seemed quite fast compared to other hotels/motels that I have stayed at.  The complimentary breakfast, while well stocked was very basic, and the breakfast area seemed very crowded -- one had to wait for a table.  The Anaheim Gardenwalk shopping and dining area is only a half mile away.  We had dinner there on two nights.  On the whole, I would recommend this motel for its proximity to Disneyland.

Summary: NIce, clean hotel, directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  You cannot get any closer to Disneyland/CA Adventure Park unless you stay in the Grand Californian. No need to worry about riding a tram, that was a definite plus for us.  You do have to pay 8.00 per night for parking, but you are assured of a space and you have to use a ticket to enter or leave the lot in your car.  This is not the Hilton, so as long as your expectations aren't too high you will not be disappointed.  It was noisy near the front of the hotel, so get a room near the back if that bothers you.  The noise did not keep us up.  For the price and close
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently traveled with our family of 18 including 5 toddlers to Disneyland. This hotel is "KEY"! Location, clean, friendly staff! Our family will definitely stay here again. Thanks to the Best Western Park Place Inn for making our little one's first trip to Disneyland magical!

Summary Heading: Very close to Disney, clean, but a bit noisy.

We were on the ground floor and the first family that walked by  in the morning woke us up, because it feels like they are going directly through your room. Summary: We bought a package with this hotel and Disneyland tickets.  I chose this hotel as it seemed to be right across the street.  I was a little concerned with room quality before checking in.  The hotel was great.  I felt it was clean and pretty roomy and there was no cause for concern in quality.  It had a sitting area, refrigerator and microwave.  Best of all after a long day in the park I just walked across the street to my room.  I felt that the staff was friendly as well.  We were able to pre-register for our room and get our parking pass prior to check-in early in the day.  It was within walking distance to a variety of restraunts and we had some great pizza delivered the first night, which was recommended by the staff.  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Directly across the street from Disneyland

Manager Response: none

There is some between the room noise..but really not enough to feel that it is invasive.We were on the second floor and only

Summary: I booked a room for two nights for my parents.  They are in their 80s and live in the Palm Springs area and going to Disneyland and back in one day is very tiring for them.  I really appreciate Lillian the manager who treated them like family, making sure they had everything they needed.  I asked that they be put in a quiet area which turned out to be in the back of the hotel.  Their room (140) was spacious and clean, not super modern, but nice.  The low season rates are great at this hotel, especially if you have AAA.  Book on the best western website.  I really appreciate the way my parents were treated. Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm in Anaheim for a tradeshow every January, and in the last few years have stayed at a lot of the places up and down the Harbor Blvd. strip. We changed hotels partway through our week (to a hotel by Hilton, Garden Inn and Suites, something like that). It was about the same price but GORGEOUS! The rooms were huge with a kitchen and corner couch and a separate bedroom. The free breakfast was a full hot breakfast. We took the Disney shuttle to the park which was very convenient.  I would choose a nicer hotel then one

I was not asking for any upgrades, changes, or special considerations, all the attitude I experienced was just in a simple check-in with prior reservations; a question about parking; and check out.  The location can't be beat, and the rooms are generally clean and well-kept. The pool is on the small side, but we were not there to swim, However  it was nice to cool off  at the end of a hot afternoon and get refreshed and rejuvenated for another venture  to the parks for the evening. All in all I would definately go back!

We stayed on the 3rd floor at the very end so, it was super quiet and were able to sleep in until around 9:30-10ish because it was so quiet. The staff even saved us a room for my parents that arrived 4 days after my husband and I did. They of course, didn't seem to be all that busy so I think that was the reason why they were able to do that. Parking was fine. No problem there. The breakfast was good and was plenty. Just the basics. Were not big breakfast people so

Summary: The location is just perfect.  The staff were  very helpful and provided excellent customer service.  The rooms were average, with a musty smell when we first got there. Had to use a strong air freshner. I didnt like the beds/pillows at all. It was not very comfortable.  We had rooms overlooking the pool on the third floor. There were people using the pool after the posted 'close' sign and I had to call the reception desk about the level of noise. They took care of it very quickly!  We used the pool a few times, but it got so crowded, and this was during the off-season!   Despite the terrible reviews that Captain Kidd's Restaurant received, the complimentary breakfast was quite good with plenty of variety. I didn't go in for any other meals though and it looked pretty deserted

Summary: Most important feature:  Very closest motel on Harbor Blvd to the Disneyland pedestrian entrance.  Step over the hotel driveway and you're at the stoplight to enter Disneyland. Rooms:  Room 165 was completely refurbished--very clean, excepting carpets.  Nicest rooms we've stayed in on Harbor Blvd.  Coffeepot serves 1 cup at a time.  Shower pressure fair; shower temperature consistent.  In our King/sofa sleeper room the air conditioner butted up against the sleeper and shot cold air over my kiddos all night.  Not miserable, but an annoying layout quirk.  Very large mini fridge.  Minimum toiletries:  shampoo, conditioner, bar soap--not refilled during stay.  Cutely folded towels. Continental Breakfast:  next door, upstairs at Captain Kidd's.  We ate breakfast in Disneyland, so did
Manager Response: none

The front desk staff was courteous and helpfull, even though we arrived at 11am, they gave us our parking pass although there were no rooms ready to check into yet. No big deal as it was a short stroll across the crosswalk into the entrance of Disney and California Adventures. It took me a shorter time to get to the main gates of both parks from this inexpensive hotel than from the Paradise Pier. Even when I called and asked if we could come a day early--no problem!  This hotel IS right across from the Disney entrance.  Last year we stayed on Katella Ave. with our other daughter and it was quite a walk.  The children in this year's family are younger and we knew it would be too taxing on them and our CFer. I liked that the toilet/shower was seperate from the sink/vanity area...it made getting ready much easier. The free continental breakfast was a great money saver. It was just across the alley in Captain Kids and had cereal, toast, pastries and juice/coffee. The breakfast was surprisingly good. The best part of the hotel was its close proximity to Disneyland. Summary Heading: No other hotels closer to Disneyland than this one!

Summary: The Best Western Park Place Inn definitely met our expectations.  The rooms were quite large and seemed to be well maintained.  The best thing about this hotel is the location to Disneyland.  It is literally a five minute walk and you are directly across from the pedestrian walkway.  You can hardly find a closer hotel which made it nice to go back to the room to relax if you needed a break. The only downside about this hotel was the breakfast in the morning.  Although it was free, the selection was quite bland (cereal, muffins, and danishes), and it was always crowded, noisy, and not enough places to sit.  Other than that, we would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Manager Response: none

Summary: We have always stayed at the Disney properties, with this exception. We found this hotel very comfortable, CLOSER than any of the 3 Disney properties, and you can't beat the price. Comparing what we used to pay for our hotels at Disney, we now save more than 75% which gives us the opportunity to spend more at the parks and have a better time. We would have given this review an "excellent", but the parking situation can get hectic. It can get ridiculous trying to find a parking space, but if you get there early, you should be OK. It was 7'4" wide and there was a row of vehicles parked against the back wall making it a real chore. The parking is kind of tight here, but it was never hard to get a spot.

Even the complimentary pancakes downstairs at Captain Kidd's was cold and burnt at times. I'd recommend you going to any other restaurant. The complimentary breakfast is a waste of time. The carpet in the room was lumpy, the wallpaper was dark and the bedspreads were itchy. The cleaning staff never smiled and couldn't speak English.  The shower had low water pressure and was too low. We had the 2 queens and queen sofa sleeper room, and it was plenty of room for us. Of course, that is taking into account that we weren't there very much. The rooms were clean and were always cleaned daily before we got back to our room at night.  The continental breakfast was fine, nothing fancy(bagels, toast, cereal, juice, danishes). If you don't want to mess with pricey shuttle buses, or wait for a shuttle when you have a cranky child who needs a nap now!! This is the place to stay! I would definitely stay here again!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Park Place Inn from September 14 -22, 2004. Staff at the hotel were nice and friendly. The hotel was very clean and well taken care of. We used the pool and hot tub every night. The pool goes to 6feet deep but was big enough and the water was warm. The hot tub was also great! There is towels supply in the pool area. You do need your room keycard to get into the pool and hotel (since it is in an enclosed area). The hotel has three floor levels, we had requested a non-smoking room on the quiet side. Our room was on the second floor and we were facing McDonalds up the street. It was quiet and the room was always cleaned by the maids (most days by the time we returned from breakfast it was already done). The breakfast upstairs included danishes,toast (white/brown),
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our second stay at the BW was in late February, 2004.  We came here again because we were very satisfied with our first visit from 4 years ago.  The hotel is very close to the entrance of Disneyland, which is a plus!  A major bonus is having a continental breakfast.  There was plenty to eat and it was nice to have one meal out of the way that we didn't have to pay for.  The rooms were clean.  Nothing fancy, but if you plan to spend most of your day at Disneyland and mainly use the hotel just for sleeping (as we did), then this is a great hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You can't go wrong booking here!
Summary: We just stayed at this hotel last week, what an awesome location!  Right across the street from both parks and Downtown Disney.  Our teenagers could come and go to each area and the hotel without concern.  The hotel was very accomodating, basic continental breakfast, but a great I-Hop right next door too!  Coach USA picked us up right in front of the hotel and took us to Universal Studios.  The car was parked the entire time.  We walked with ease to each area, and not being in shape, that was a huge concern of ours.  You can book with confidence here, we will definately stay here again.  Hope this helps!

Summary: Our Family just wrapped up a 12 night stay at the Best Western.  I will definately stay again, as they were extremely accomodating to our needs when our original hotel did not live up to the reservations. We couldn't be happier with the whole experience.  It was spacious enough for a family of 5, considering the amount of time you actually spend in the hotel.  It was clean and completly modern.  The room was always cleaned quickly, and done very well.  The pool and hot tub were a definite bonus.  The breakfast was more than enough and although the family grew tired of the same thing every day, what can you expect when you stay 12 nights,  It was enough.  The convient location to the Disney Parks is a definite selling point to this hotel.  You could't get closer unless you stayed

Summary: It's not a fancy hotel, but it has it all:  pool, hot tub, sauna, free continental breakfast right next door (GREAT pancakes!), microwave, refrigerator, hairdryer, free parking.  Best of all, it's directly across the street from the Disneyland main entrance:  simple to take the kids back to the hotel for a nap or a dip in the pool.  I would definitely stay here again.
